Either pick up the modestly priced recent “Classic” box (first 5 LP’s with bonus tracks in mini LP sleeves housed in a cheap advertising card-stock box) which has all the recent remasters (remastered too loud for my tastes, cutting off the peaks at both ends) or (best decision) get at least KANSAS and SONG FOR AMERICA in the original 1990 Kirshner label reissue but it get the Japanese import version (it was pressed by Sony Japan) as these have the cleanest original sound, comparable with the original LP engineering.  They sound pristine with all the analogue notes perfectly preserved.  You can find them inexpensively enough from third party sellers on Amazon, just be sure to inquire with the seller if it is the “made in Japan” version.

In the evolution of what came to be called (affectionately) “California Rock” and/or “California Country”, there were a number of hidden and not so hidden faces behind The Eagles, Linda Ronstadt, Jackson Browne, James Taylor...  Some of these were JD Souther, Kenny Edwards, Andrew Gold, Wendy Waldman, and some studio talent like the incredible Waddy Watchel who managed to show up on more than a few of these artists albums.  Quietly accompanying all of them was Karla Bonoff, seemingly peeking out from the shadows, enough to pen three songs on one #1 hit album by Linda Ronstadt, the singer she is most often compared with.  But Karla was anything but hiding in the shadows, she was just overlooked in plain sight, and all of the aforementioned artist knew and respected her.At 16, in 1967, she and her sister had already demo’d and cut an album under Bruce Botnick (The Doors) at Elektra.  Unfortunately that disappeared into Neverland, her sister became a teacher and Karla wandered off to hang around The Troubadour and make friends with the artists listed above.  With Kenny, Andrew, and Wendy, Karla formed Bryndle (which would be revived in the 90’s), which at the time was compared to The Mamas & The Papas but more progressive along the lines of The Eagles and Fleetwood Mac (the revitalized California Fleetwood Mac).  Obviously ahead of their time, the recordings didn’t make a big hit and Bryndle broke up, but not before attracting much needed attention on all four members.  Kenny and Andrew went with Linda as The Stone Poneys, Wendy and Karla began illustrious songwriting.  Linda loved Karla’s songs and once she was a solo hit maker, Karla would get more attention from Linda who already had eyes on Karla’s material, and they would become long time friends.  "Someone to Lay Down Beside Me," "If He's Ever Near" and "Lose Again" enriched the fabulous HASTEN DOWN THE WIND album in ’76, enough so that Columbia approached Karla to make her own album, along with much the same musicians and talent that went into HASTEN DOWN THE WIND.KARLA BONOFF was released in ’77, produced by none other than old friend Kenny Edwards.  I Can’t Hold On became a hit single, and in my old home town of Seattle, it was a #1 hit in the Pacific Northwest market.  Now she was opening for James Taylor and Jackson Browne, getting tons of exposure, and hey, folks noticed that girl could sing!Karla has some terrific albums, all of which have their own magic, but for many fans, this album, KARLA BONOFF was the special one which grabbed us first and holds first place in our hearts.  She may not sing with the “power” that Ronstadt had in their day, but many often like her pleasantly more so because of that.  Her voice is beautiful, like a breath of fresh air, like birdsong in a tree grove, it relaxes, it does not use special runs or vocal exercises, it is down to earth, folksy, and just plain likeable to loveable.  Her songwriting is equally beautiful, with all the right metaphors in all the right places, it reaches the heart without need for distillation.Her solo albums and her Bryndle works in the 90’s are some of the best and most beautifully poetic albums out there.  If you are “familiar” with Karla and wondering where to start, this is the logical spot and actually is the best place to start.  If you are new convert because of Bryndle or by way of some other vector, take this, KARLA BONOFF, and you will soon be on the road to RESTLESS NIGHTS, WILD HEART OF THE YOUNG, and NEW WORLD.Every song on this album is delicately poignant, whether it is a slow and low piano centric love ballad, or a more gut-digging lament with Waddy bending the guitar strings on the rosewood neck.  The songs are pure, full of heart, and timeless in their relativity to humanity, to womankind, and to the love-struck.  This music is not rock, it is not country, and you really cannot even call it “pop” without an argument, so let’s just call it Karla and let it be that.  Try some Karla on for size, she is perhaps one of the top five contenders for most underappreciated artist in the history of music.  She should have been a superstar, but maybe it is for the better this way.  She still tours and there is still plenty of Karla to go around for everyone who discovers her.Be sure you purchase the Columbia CD which says “Digitally remastered for Compact Disc by Joe Gastwirt at Digital Magnetics”, the sound engineering is perfect, the volume levels are perfect (no loudness, no lost lows), and the warmth of vinyl is still present.  I don’t know about the BMG release, but they are usually good.  The SBME Special Markets release sounded tinny to me and I replaced my copy recently with the 1990’s Columbia release and boy am I happy!  Look for it from 3rd party sellers at the top of the page under “new and used”.  Query the seller to be sure you are getting the release version you want.

When Led Zeppelin and Peter Grant formed their own private label (under the umbrella of their parent company Atlantic), their first release on the label was not a Led Zeppelin album.  That honor went to the newly formed “super group” Bad Company (June 15th, 1974).  Why “super group”?  Bad Company was formed by two ex-members of Free (Paul Rodgers and drummer Simon Kirke), Mott The Hoople’s killer guitarist Mick Ralphs, and King Crimson’s uber-bass maestro Boz Burrell.  These three groups were high class acts in the UK with a solid following in the USA.  The product of these four talents together formed a whole sound which was greater than the sum of the parts.  There are some arguments amongst fans as to which is the best Bad Company album, but in sales figures, this debut outshined all later albums, and most critics agree this was an astounding “Debut” from some such an assembly of rock veterans.  STRAIGHT SHOOTER, which followed (also being released as a deluxe remaster) was quite good and only sold a fraction less and slipped one notch on the charts to just barely equaling BAD COMPANY.  From there, each subsequent release sold less well.  I believe that was because this album, the self-titled BAD COMPANY worked on every level possible as a perfect album release.The most amazing factoid of BAD COMPANY is that every single one of the 8 total original tracks has either charted as a hit single, or has been a classic rock staple on FM radio ever since its release.  One song, the bluesy Ready For Love, was actually guitarist Mick Ralphs’ and was previously recorded by Mott The Hoople on All The Young Dudes.  Every composition and recording is simply a perfect track, highly worthy of setting up this album as the initial Swan Song release and deserving of every heap of praise garnered by a Led Zeppelin album.  The songs are pulse pounding Rock Steady numbers and include not only blues-rock-centric classics but a gospel-tinged ballad (Don’t Let Me Down) and an acoustic lyrical gem (Seagull).In addition to the remastered original album release (with fantastic engineering easily equaling the deluxe remaster releases of the Zeppelin catalogue), the bonus disc has some choice material as well:Superstar Woman (released as a re-recorded track on Paul Rodgers solo Cut Loose album, this is the original recording for the debut album which was not included).  It would have fit well on STRAIGHT SHOOTER but never managed to get included there either.Little Miss Fortune was the B-Side of Can’t Get Enough, not a bad track but it was obviously not good enough for BAD COMPANY.  Here it sits nicely as a bonus track.Easy On My Soul was an original Free track (featuring Paul Rodgers of course) from the Heartbreaker LP (’73), here it was re-recorded by Bad Company and was the B-Side to Movin’ On.  Solid as a bonus track but lacking the fortitude for the original LP.Of the alternate takes, demos, and LMS Studio session takes, the demos are interesting, the alternate sessions are more than interesting (fun to listen to), but as with the expanded Led Zeppelin deluxe packages, the real magic is in the remaster of the original LP.  This is a solid entry into the new Led Zeppelin/Swan Song catalogue releases, and worth every penny of your purchase.  Boomers and older fans will obviously be the largest market, but new listeners who have found an ear for classic rock cannot go wrong with this classic blues-based rock album, one of the finest ever produced and now tweaked even better with modern engineering.  The saddest part of the Bad Company story is that each album successively got weaker after this monster debut, but STRAIGHT SHOOTER is also available as a remastered deluxe package and was a worthy followup with Good Lovin’ Gone Bad, Feel Like Makin’ Love, and the epic Shooting Star.  Some even consider it a “better” album but the sales figures and chart position slipped just a tad and most fans agree BAD COMPANY is the best BC album with SS running a close second.  After that is was a slow but steady downhill.

I just HAD to have this set.  I am not a Dead Head.  Nor am I a “casual fan” of some of their hits.  If you fall into similar category, this is the set for you.  I had four Grateful Dead albums in my original vinyl collection: AMERICAN BEAUTY, of course The Album to own of theirs; then WHAT A LONG STRANGE TRIP IT’S BEEN a double LP, the best compilation album they took an active hand in releasing, a solid collection of what The Dead considered to be their best studio and live material; TERRAPIN STATION, a progressive rock turning point for the band and what I consider to be their best overall sounding album ever; and finally the oft-maligned SHAKEDOWN STREET, somewhat of an (at the time) urban R&B influenced adventure.  These four albums covered all of the styles of the two decades of original GD material and were all that was needed for a cross-genre loving something-more-than-casual fan.This new double disc, and for the umpteenth time entitled “The Best Of..” release is perfect for one such as me.  It is arranged conveniently in chronological order, covers almost the entire Great Garcia period over multiple labels (thank you Rhino), and hallelujah! It has the entire Terrapin Station suite, unedited and unabridged.  The engineering/mastering is superb!  Pristine!  Immaculate!  If only WEA could have come up with a less used titled.Now you can ride along with Captain Trips on his long strange journey from acid folk-rock tales through San Francisco laid-back acoustical Americana, through non-traditional experimental jazz-rock-improvisations, through art-rock/prog-rock symphonics, through Lowell George’s Little Feat influenced R&B, and on into the 80’s culminating in modernized but soft around the edges arena rock messages and anthems like Throwing Stones.  It is 50 Years folks, and how appropriate to release this now!THE BEST OF THE GRATEFUL DEAD really gives you an in-depth, without drowning, submerging into the music of one of the most celebrated and cultish bands in the history of music.  Their offspring is enormous, their influence insurmountable.  Garcia, along with Kantner and Slick of the Airplane were the royalty of the Haight-Ashbury scene and the three of them often worked together on many projects, melding the two bands into a brief Golem which produced forerunners of the Progressive Rock movement.Disc One will set you right up in the counterculture of the 60’s, blow you like a leaf in the wind across the American Beauty which is the folk-rock-Americana movement of Dylan and Arlo, right into the medium-is-the-message era of early 70’s art.  You will catch wisps of everything from Baez to Pink Floyd on the trip and be able to stop and smell the roses (American Beauties no less) along the way.Disc Two starts off really heady, Dead Heady, with their penultimate symphonic rock composition (Terrapin Station is nothing less than epic modern Homerian poetry, a mythos of grand proportions), then you get a tour of 70’s urban decay, and then what can only be called sociopolitical lessons in the era of Reganomics and The Iron Lady.As is usual with Rhino, a lot of good remastering work goes into the production, I have yet to be displeased with a Rhino engineering job (with only a few exceptions where the source material is wholly compromised and then it is as good as it gets).  The HDCD sound here is the best yet of any Dead album I have heard on CD!If this is not your brand of ear-candy, then skip it, but if you want to take a long strange trip back with me, get this and stay away from the other three BEST OF THE GRATEFUL DEAD releases which are both insignificant and lack-luster compared with this one.  For the young, repressed, or those who just plain “missed it”, you should at least dip your toe into this water.  Bob Dylan, The Beatles, Jefferson Airplane/Starship, Donovan, The Doors, Led Zeppelin, and Pink Floyd; there is just one more name missing from this group of artist who literally changed the landscape of music in the 60’s.  Add The Grateful Dead to the list and you have the murderer of “the music” on the day the music died.  These are the artists who started it all, a ball rolling which is actually still rolling today, it’s just that no one today wants to push it in another direction.  We need a positive force to change it, something like The Grateful Dead would do.

The review as written is below, This is an UPDATE due to the curious and sometimes spurious reviews which have been thus far posted and due to the comments added to this review (you should read them for more facts.  Fact of the matter is that there is considerable debate as to whether or not these albums in this box set are actually remastered or not.  The result of three other people besides myself, who have purchased this set and been able to compare it with some of the previous releases and remasters, is that this box set is indeed remastered once again, and the sound IS better, clearer, and lacking previous defects (loudness, distortion, etc).  As well, there is sufficient overseas (European) information on this release to verify that the label did indeed remaster these albums, something which has been lacking in the press releases of our side of the Atlantic.  Please don't be swayed by some of the caustic reviews and comments posted here, I can honestly attest that I DID NOT waste my money on a sham release designed to part me with my green leaves..............................................................................................................The Bee Gees began their career as an English folk-rock-ballad company, somewhat of a twist on The Beatles who were the standard for gold in 1967.  Their amazing harmonies breakthrough was quickly identified and unique on songs like The New York Mining Disaster, To Love Somebody, and on up through classics like Lonely Days, and How Can You Mend A Broken Heart in 1972.  By ’73 through early ’74 however, The Bee Gees had started to tail spin with flunking singles that failed to chart well, if at all.  In 1974, they served up a new dish a la Ahmet Ertegun (their Atlantic label executive) and with the help of Robert Stigwood.Teamed up with soul music producer Arif Mardin, The Bee Gees recorded and released MR. NATURAL which toned down the balladeering and made a few baby steps into the R&B direction.  Not a great success by any measure it did prove to be a major turning point for the band and is represented here in the first disc.  Charade, Throw A Penny, and the title track are really the best tracks on the album (though Dogs is also a standout) and are often found on “best of” compilations.  One is always of a mind to compare MR. NATURAL with the Philly Soul sound of Hall & Oates.In 1975, Eric Clapton guided his RSO label mates, the brothers Gibb, to Miami for their next recording adventure, where he was actively having much success on his own from those studios.  The Bee Gees headed straight away to rent 461 Ocean Boulevard, get a tan, and record the fantastic MAIN COURSE (which IMO should be considered their best 70’s album, it prefigures “disco”, has excellent pure R&B musicianship, and their most creative vocals).  You will find some folk-ish tunes, Songbird, and Come On Over (made into a hit by Olivia Newton John).  Many will find Wind Of Change to be the best song on the album and in fact it makes a perfect trilogy with Nights On Broadway and Jive Talkin’.  Songbird IS a beautiful tune, Fanny a solid hit single, Country Lanes a typical BG Ballad, and Edge Of The Universe is another terrific pop-rocker.  MAIN COURSE is the definitive encapsulation of what made the Bee Gees great in the 70’s.  It is not hyper-disco over-the-top glitter ball music, but an even-handed adventurous Pop-R&B masterpiece.Disc 3, CHILDREN OF THE WORLD is where the disco legacy takes off and disc 4, SPIRITS HAVING FLOWN is where the brothers reached their apex in the genre.  Nothing at all wrong with these albums, you just have to be definitely “in the mood” for that era.  Disc 5 collects the singles (A and B sides) and songs from Saturday Night Fever (of course).  It is unfair to type-cast these albums as “disco” as there are other quality tracks which are neither disco nor R&B, but the over-arching sellability of these during that period was indeed the dance magic and the trademark falsettos which were brought to the table.  CHILDREN OF THE WORLD works as a follow-up to MAIN COURSE, but SPIRITS HAVING FLOWN seems somehow flawed, even when this was the pinnacle of their success.  What is missing, is the other brothers.  Barry is now lead vocal on nearly everything with Robin and Maurice supplying “most” of the backing (even some backing vocals are Barry over-dubs).Disc 5 is just pure fun, and needed for those who want to cover this period with all of the studio tracks.  The one item missing is the single Long Version of You Should Be Dancing which tones down the vocals and ups the ante on musicianship.The sound quality on these discs is nothing short of terrific.  My last compilation of The Bee Gees was the 4-disc set TALES FROM THE BROTHERS GIBB which is comfortably remastered but not to the quality of these.  Audio levels are not “loudness wars” and engineering is beautiful.  You get thumping without baridroning, you get crisp clear highs which don’t make the dogs howl, and the atmosphere is enveloping.  Enjoy!

With War you have to remember that they were two things:  War was a “Platinum Jazz” group which fused together every available genre of the late 60’s and early 70’s into a gumbo of artistic freedom rarely seen from other contemporaries of the period.  War was also a Billboard chart topping Soul/R&B act with all of these hit “singles”.  As the title implies, The Hits is a compilation of the Singles (with the exception of Spill The Wine which is the only full length version on this disc), and since the CD does not indicate the track times at all, neither on the back list nor inside the skimpy insert, one will not know this until after purchase.  It IS rather disappointing to not get the full length versions of Slippin Into Darkness, The World Is A Ghetto, and Gypsy Man as these were my personal favorites among their jazzy funk jams.  This is especially true when one realizes that the CD is barely 50 minutes long with near 29 minutes to spare for added length on tunes.  I had all the original vinyl LP’s and reviving that set in CD would be costly (but to be sure I will work on it as time goes by) so if you are in my shoes, expect the worst and be happy with the singles for now.For the unfamiliar contemplating this adventure in retro music, here is what to expect.  Lyrically, as with many 70’s classic rock artists, the songs often take on a “socio-political” stance.  The music has been called “laid-back California funk vibe” which does not mete out justice.  They were funk-rock, jazz, latin-rock, rhythm’n blues, with a splash of Jamaica-Mon thrown in for good measure.  They were a transcendental cross-racial multi-ethnic line-up from 4 continents surrounding the Atlantic ocean and the music appealed literally to everybody who had ears and two foot-tapping feet.I got my copy for five bucks at the blue box store when Amazon still was selling it for three dollars more, but now they have lowered the price to equivalent, so if you are totaling up enough for that free shipping, go ahead and get this (barring your need for the REAL War albums) or just drop by Wally World and pick one up for the change in your pocket.  I only give it Three Stars for the already stated disappointment in skimpiness, but if you just want some car stereo jams and want to enjoy some funked up jazz-rock hit singles from your youth, or while you are IN your youth, then by all means, call this one a good investment.

As with the same release of Best Of The Guess Who, I am rather disappointed with the resulting surround sound quality and mix. I should have left this one alone too, but it was in my box store and I have been "Experimenting" with these releases lately.  It still seems to me that certain "progressive rock" albums were meant to be quad and others not and a recent indulgence in some classic rock artists, like The Guess Who and the Best Of Bread album before you now, has vented a whole new crop of Quad releases (even if they were never released as quadraphonic albums in their day).Despite this original album release dating back to 1973, it is now dated and not the "best" compilation you can find. If you are not so much interested in a rather sub-par surround album as you are in having a good sounding CD release of Bread's best tunes, you need to consider the Elektra (and later Rhino remaster) release of Anthology with 20 career spanning singles, a much more involved and better sounding compilation. The stereo analogue to digital transfer is beautiful, the remastering equally magnificent, and the song selection includes all of these doubled with every fan favorite track off of all of their albums.Now if you are interested as a "collector" then you might just want these limited and numbered releases. So evaluate your requirements before deciding to plunk down double the cost of another product you might find more fully satisfying. The one is strictly for collectors and mad enthusiasts of Bread, a group which defined the soft rock genre.It would have been far better to at least attempt to do this with Anthology, if not with the limited 6 album output of Bread.  Yes this album had its moment in the sun but again, there is a far better Best Of collection out there to attempt a multichannel experiment on.  In fact the gentleman reviewer who claims missing 8 songs, including Aubrey, is actually thinking of the Anthology release, since this one originally came out before Guitar Man (album).If you are a neophyte to SACD quadraphonic albums, this might sound great to you.  If you compare it to other releases which were actually recorded and engineered for Quad release in the 70's you will find distinct short comings.  And if you compare it to some incomparable ones like Dark Side Of The Moon, failings become readily apparent.  In the end, you must decide the value and trade off.  I was a little disappointed, but I have Anthology to go to for fulfillingness and this one for a slight pleasure of surround sound.

I guess money belts are becoming more high-tech to prevent thefts.  Apparently, this one is designed to protect  against electronic pickpocketing and identity theft.  And that is where the belt compartments are lined.  And according to the product page, it is RFID protected.I do not know what RFID protection is, and there is no definition on the catalog page.  However, if it is protected against electronic thefts, then that is one good reason to purchase this,  especially if you travel abroad!There are several pockets and an inner pockets for easy access to credit cards.  The zippers pull easily, especially with the aid of the zipper ribbon pulls.Also, one pocket, the length of the belt is located in the backside.  It would be great for airline tickets, but keep in mind that it is not easy to get to that pocket if you are wearing the belt.  But, yes, that long pocket is very useful for tickets.My only concern about this Protection-Lined material is that it is hard, not soft.  It has the propensity to get sweaty under the clothes.  When it is heavier, it is not as flexible underneath clothes.But, for the protection of your cards, it may be beneficial to use this, figure out how to use it without interference and how to use it comfortably.  That is up to you....  Product for Review,  Rizzo

Anybody who does yoga, knows that your clothes must be flexible for those challenging poses.  These shorts are very comfortable, lightweight, and the stretch is perfect.  There is a thick waistband and, if the waistband is not enough support, there is a drawstring.  The waistband is a couple inches, and, what is good is it has three line stitching.  This means the waistband will not go wonky!  It is secure!I do other exercises in these shorts too, so, they are perfect workout shorts.  This is not polyester,  it is  87% Nylon and 13% Spandex.  That is what makes it a quality set,I enjoy these as casual wear also.  Nice fit!  Review for Product,  Rizzo

I purchased a brand new one.  I was wasting more labels than using them effectively.  The Printer kept rolling out several at a time, I could not get it to stop.  Then, I could not print from the computer page...These machines are sensitive, and I could not rely on it to work properly and consistently.It may work for some, but I could not longer take a chance.

If you are used to the regular shower heads that are mostly used, you will like this rainfall effect  I love that it is 8" wide spray of water.  The water completely covers you.  The pressure is good.What I also like is that this is stainless steel, very very thin, and lightweight.  It is easy to install, doesn't take much.  I also like that this is simply one type of spray.  I don't need various pulsating sprays;  I just like it to be 'full"  and with the 8" it is wide.Very nice spray!  The polished chrome should fit the decor of almost any bathtub/shower stall.  Review for Product.  Rizzo.

The Bugzi Stroller Hooks are not only great for strollers, but any other device where you need to "hang" an object.  The hooks are thick, well made, and with a sturdy velcro that goes over a bar.I used these on my mother's rollater.  She takes it into the store, and has her water bottle and tote bag handy.You have the choice of TWO hooks for one Stroller Hook.  You can spread it for two hooks, or, you can create a stronger hook by closing this hook to make one.I keep this for my nephew's visit to the home.  Taking him to the retail stores with a stroller, always creates a need to hang things, bags, water bottles, gadgets, purses, coats, snack bags, toy bags, etc.And, one of the neater things is to hang this in a closet for hats, pats, umbrellas, glasses, etc, etc.These are strong, and the gray are quite inconspicuous.  The velcro is very sturdy.  So, yes, this is great for a stroller, but there ae many other uses for these sturdy hooks...  Product for Review, Rizzo

I think you need a sledgehammer to get these fruits or vegetables through the cutter.  I have tried a few things, and simply could not get them to go down smoothly.  You place the fruit or vegetable upside right, and with pressure, you are forcing the cover down to press through the slicer.This is a plastic cover with a metal cutter.  A section on top creates the slices.Well, I tried, and tried.  Didn't work for me, but it may for others.  I will work with it again, and adjust my review if needed.  Review for Free Product.

What I especially like about this wallet, is that it is small enough to fit in a regular purse.  But, it is also large enough to carry as a wallet/purse...for the times when you just when you do not want to carry a complete bag around.I can pop my phone in here, ipod, etc and with all my credit cards, cash, I can walk around places, without having to lug a purse.  The purse measures close to 8" in length x 4" high.  It is patent leather, meaning, it always maintains the beautiful shine.  You can use this formally,  or very casually.  It works both ways.What is also a good feature is the carrying strap.  This is wide enough, you don't have to scrunch to get your arm through.  When I go into a large store, I always fear leaving my bag, so I just pop this on my arm and it stays!There are two compartments, with zippers that flow easily.  The zippers have small metal pulls, making it easy to grab!  One side of the wallet is for the credit cards.  Each side of this credit card compartment has slots for the cards,  and.....  two spots to place dollar bills, without folding them.The other side is where you can place a cell phone, ipod, etc.,  and there is a zipper for cash.Very attractive wallet, sufficient to hold a lot of cards, and other small necessities.  Review for Product!

Usually wear a small/medium in winter gloves and these latex gloves fit perfect. They fit really snug which is great when working where you need precise finger movement and don't have slack at the tips. They are really nice and thick so you know they will over protection as well and won't rip or get a whole when bumping your hand on somewhat of a sharp object. You can almost reuse them if you didn't really get them too dirty or damaged. Will definitely be purchasing more of these in the future.

This is an excellent trimmer. It has great battery life. I take about five to ten minutes to quickly trim and groom my beard a few times a week without charging. If for some reason the battery dies I can connect it to the power cord and still use. Other trimmers won't let you do that. You either have to charge it and unplug it when  you need to use it. Not with this one which is really convenient. It has a lot of precise adjustments you can make with attachment a or b. This version doesn't have the slide up precision trimmer but it is practically the same thing. It works just as well. The trimmer is very quiet and it feels as if it is not even on with little vibration. It has a great look and a nice and comfortable feel on your hands. Cleaning is very easy as you can use water. Just make sure to oil it after rinsing it and before use for prolonged blade life. Overall an excellent trimmer with lots of precise adjustments with just two attachments. The attachments are firmly in place on the trimmer so no fearing of the attachment coming loose and ruining your beard. Definitely a keeper.

It mixes well with cold water. Keep the spoon if you don't drink it quick enough. It does settle a bit so a good stir before sipping will help to get it mixed. It is easy to drink and just the fact of drinking mushrooms can cause a gag reflex but not here. I like to use really cold water and drink it real quick. If I am really thirsty I can chug it real fast. If I drink it after eating it can be a bit harder to drink. Says it helps with stress and immune and I hope it does help. The fiber does help with my digestion since I am in a keto diet and don't get much fiber in my diet.

This is an excellent trimmer. It has great battery life. I take about five to ten minutes to quickly trim and groom my beard a few times a week without charging. If for some reason the battery dies I can connect it to the power cord and still use. Other trimmers won't let you do that. You either have to charge it and unplug it when  you need to use it. Not with this one which is really convenient. It has a lot of precise adjustments you can make with attachment a or b. The slide up precision is a big plus. This is a two in one that that does a really great job. The trimmer is very quiet and it feels as if it is not even on with little vibration. When the slid up trimmer is pushed up and activated it gets a little louder but hardly annoying. It has a great look and a nice and comfortable feel on your hands. Cleaning is very easy as you can use water. Just make sure to oil it after rinsing it and before use for prolonged blade life. Overall an excellent trimmer with lots of precise adjustments with just two attachments. The attachments are firmly in place on the trimmer so no fearing of the attachment coming loose and ruining your beard. Definitely a keeper.

This is an excellent compact bowl and compartment. It is a good size too. Expected it to be smaller but it is not too big either. It is just about the right size. Sometimes I don't have enough time to have milk and cereal before heading to work and I'll use this. It is leak proof and haven't had any problems with any leaks at all. It is very easy to clean as well. Plus, it collapses after you are done to save a little space. I also use it a lot for gaucamole and chips. Keeps the chips safe and the gaucamole air tight. I've used it with soups as well and when I wash it, it does not stain or leave any smell from previous foods. Overall, it is a great compact bowl with a separate compartment that cleans well.

These are perfect for baby back ribs. The foil is not just heavy duty, it is extra heavy duty. These are thick and are very sturdy. I've used heavy duty foil to mimic this but somehow they always end up dripping juices. These pouches help sealing all the juices and help cook up some very juicy tender ribs. They are great for veggies as well. It will create some steam action inside the pouch and cooks up some delicious veggies with no supervision.

This is an excellent hitch bike rack. I used to own a Swagman XC hitch rack and can compare the two. They are pretty much similar. Big difference between the two is the locks. You can leave your bikes locked in place without any other hardware. This makes it very convenient and fast to keep you bikes secured. My wife's car has a 1 1/4 inch receiver while my car has a 2 inch receiver. Since we both use it, it was much more convenient for me to purchase an adapter that downsized my receiver 1 1/4 inches rather than attaching and reattaching the 2 inch adapter to the rack. It is easy to adjust to fit certain bikes if needed to. On the swagman it was easy as well but the SportsRack has bigger knobs and are easier on the hands. If you need to open your trunk the center bar collapses to access your trunk with having to remove the rack entirely. All in all, this rack is great and will probably last very long. My Swagman has been on the road thousands of miles through hot deserts to heavy rain and I believe this Sportsrack will perform as well. Only upsides to the SportRack is the locking feature, the ease of use to adjust for bikes with the knobs and the extra straps to secure the bike wheels. I would definitely recommend this to anyone. Install a hitch on your car if you don't have one. These are much easier to use, faster to set up and safer. I used to have a trunk rack and that was a pain each time.

These are so much fun that I even enjoyed these with my kids. These are a great alternative to legos. I think my sons were bored with the legos and these came in at the right time. The pieces are made of great materials. They don't look cheap and looks like they will last for years of play. The pieces aren't tiny either where you will loose some pieces in the carpet. Kids don't need any manuals and they just started building. Its great for their minds to use their imagination and build whatever they choose too. Although, you can build the specific designs that are included. Had to purchase a plastic bin to keep these organized and prevent them from mixing with their other toys. Overall, this a great play set for kids who love building.

This worked perfect for me in my garage. I have a Kicker iK501 stereo system that has excellent sound but no bluetooth. Hated having to go to the stereo to check on my texts or to make any song changes. It was either a new stereo system with bluetooth which was not gonna be cheap. This was a cheap alternative that I was able to add to my already great sounding system in the garage. The setup couldn't be any simpler. The sound coming out of my stereo is just as good or better than when it was with my aux cable. I can work in the garage and have my phone with me and change the song wireless. It has excellent range too. I've gotten inside the house and was still able to stream music. Great little device for those non-bluetooth devices.

This is a great addition to my sons collection of dinosaurs. This particular one is pretty much displayed after weeks of playing with it. It has great detail and the legs, arms and mouth action are great. Plus, the sounds are a great bonus. It is made of pretty durable materials. My sons had some play action and they were pretty rough. Luckily the t-rex's arms are short and are not prone to breaking. It already comes with batteries and haven't had to change them yet.

This a great bare bones brad nailer. It works great and hasn't jammed. Compared to my other brad nailer this gun is basic and does it well. It does have a jam free tool release and adjustable muffler. What I like about my other gun that this one does not have is dry fire lockout, depth of drive and the swivel air inlet. I used this Arrow nailer for a day and was able to live without those certain features. The gun is well built and feels solid. It is a bit heavier than my other gun but for using for a few things around the house is not a bad gun at all.

This is an excellent cable. It hasn't frayed at the ends like the oem apple cable. I use this in my car and the apple oem cables never lasted. Not sure if its the flat design of the cable but it works great and the cable seems like its made of quality. Charges my phone just as usual as the oem. The cable is the perfect length for my car.

Works really well on my kids. It has a nice fragrance that is not overwhelming. One of my kids has thick hair and I can use a bit more on him than my other son who has a bit thinner hair. Works great on both of them but have to use more on my kid with thick hair. A little bit goes along way. I use about half a dime size on my kids who has thick hair. It gives him no shine which I like and style it to the side. It is not strong but keeps his hair in place for the day. I use about a 1/4 of a dime size on my other kid who has thin hair. It is easier to apply and style when the hair is damp like after a shower and you towel dry it. Works really well and smells good.

This is a nice and simple to use mask. It is not too thick and doesn't go on thick either. It is easy to dispense. It has a little bit of a muddy smell. Not bad but might bother someone with sensitive smell. I can apply it to my skin pretty easy. It smears on your face fine with lno irritation. My skin is very sensitive and any application can irritate my skin at times. Not the case here. It washes off fairly easy with just water. I prefer to use a small skin shammy to absorb all of the product from my face. My skin feels real great after use and for the next few days. Great and easy to use product.

My niece loved this light. It is very soft and light. It's very easy to turn on and off with a flick of the wrist. Installing batteries was the hardest part since I couldn't find a small Philips screw driver to open the battery compartment. It's a soft enough light that my niece uses it to sleep with like a little teddy bear. It's led so the batteries will last for a while.

Both of my kids loved the LeapPad. They seem to enjoy the look of the LeapPad over my iPad. It is more fun for them to look at and to hold with their small hands. Setting it up was easy compared to other LeapPad devices in the past. It is much more faster and it responds better. The screen is way better and much more sharp than before. As for the apps the kids love them and they are much more educational. At the price it's great since its tailored for children and educational purposes.

This is a great charging case. It fits my iphone 6 just right. The slots are where they are supposed to be. It doesn't add that much bulk to the phone although without it the phone feels good in your hands but unprotected. The privacy features are great for those who are paranoid. I am one of those and that helps with your paranoia. The other great thing about the privacy features is that it helps protect and keep the lens dust free and clean. The phone lasts the whole day without having to charge it. I use the phone a lot especially youtube and hate having to run low and having sit on my counter charging. The charging case eliminates the battery issue and you can enjoy your phone more.

This an excellent book. I was more excited for this book than my kids. I've always liked building and creating things and this book makes it easy to do just that. It was easy to follow along with my kids. Projects vary and there are a lot of options. A great book for the parents and kids.

This was very easy to set up. We were playing within 5 minutes or so. Its a fun game to play while having a few cold ones with friends on a warm summer night. The game is pretty simple. The game piece itself is a good size and is nice quality. I would probably take it down and put it away if you want it to last longer. Highly recommend.

This system takes a bit of patience and I wasn't expecting instant results. I opened the package as it was neatly packaged and started reading every document included. Depending on your skin tone and hair this system may or may not work for you so make sure to check that before making your purchase. An important step is to avoid sun exposure unprotected two weeks prior and two weeks after a treatment. Once you familiarize yourself with how the system functions and read the user guide you will feel much more confident in using the device. You'll have to shave the area you want to treat. There was no pain experience for me but there might be a bit for some as some have mentioned but just make sure you set the skin tone hair color setting. With time your hair will grow a bit patchy. After more treatments you will notice less and less hair. My advice is to just follow the steps and be patient. Once you are done with the treatments you can enjoy smooth hair less skin sans shaving.

Cool design and cool features. I have to get up at 5am and getting up is a pain with an alarm. Sun doesn't rise until 6:30 or so waking up while it is still dark is tough. I have heard from friends about these waku up lights. It has made getting up early way more comfortable. The clock is not that big of a nuisance for me as some are making it seem. I assume some people like to have their room completely dark to fall asleep. I need a bit of light plus some white noise in the background. Falling asleep that way makes it easier for me and the wake up light makes is much easier to wake up. I don't use the sounds or radio for alarm. I usually have my phone set but I end up waking 20 minutes into the light going on and turn my alarm off. I can wake up without having the alarm going on and waking up the roommates. This a great product if you have trouble waking up before sunrise and you want something that simulates the morning sunrise at your preferred time.

This cleaning system from Philips is remarkable. I tossed my old one that was around a quarter of the price this one is. The old one was not rechargeable and changing the batteries was a pain to do. This one is above and beyond and you get a lot more for what you pay for. This one is rechargeable and comes with a charging pedestal. The timer that is built it is a huge plus. No more cleansing your skin for more time than you need to. You want to clean your skin and not irritate it. The variety of cleaning heads is great. My skin feels a lot better. It looks better and people have noticed a glow on my face.

This is really great shell keyboard for your iPad. It is built very well and it provides excellent protection from every corner for the ipad. The case itself is a bit heavy but that is because it provides excellent protection to the ipad. The pivot feature is excellent when you are showing someone something on the screen. Pairing the keyboard is super simple. Attaching the ipad to the case is also extremely simple. The battery life is superb and it charges quick as well. Overall a great case that gives your ipad a notebook laptop feeling with pivot feature and excellent protection.

This is a very well made oven mitt. I am a bigger guy with big hands and this oven mitt fits just right. It covers a good amount of your forearm too. The grip lines are really great and help in grabbing pots and pans with hot items with no worry of mishandling them. It handles the heat really well. My old cheap mitt worked fine but you needed to be quick when handling hot items. No need to worry with this mitt.

This a great bin with handles that packs flat. Looks great in our restroom. At first, it doesn't stay in its shape and tends to sag. Once you have something inside like rolled up face towels it will take shape and stay that way. It is made of thick material and it feels like quality. Doesn't scream cheap at all. Handles are great to move it around easier. Great bin and would recommend to anyone.

This is an excellent workbench for my kids. My kids were really excited to see this box. They helped me get everything out and helped me set it up. It took about 40 minutes since they were playing with every part imaginable. I am sure it takes about 20 minutes tops to set up but with the kids playing with parts then you know how it is. It is super simple and easy to set up. The directions are easy to read and understand. Everything is included in the box to set up the bench. Comes with included plastic wrench for the plastic bolts and nuts you need to set up. Some of the graphics are cardboard inserts and at first I thought they were not gonna last. My kids are almost gonna be 2 and 4 and they didn't really bother with messing with the cardboard graphics. I showed them how to use the lathe, nail gun, grinder and how to hang the tools and put the nuts and bolts away. Now they use the workbench and all their tools and put them away when they are done. Which is great since they are being organized and not just playing with them and leaving them all over the place. Overall a great toy for kids with an imagination. It is great seeing them pretend to use power tools that are safe for them.

I ended up using this on my Smokey Mountain smoker. The old one I had would wear out in one season. It would fit perfect but had to keep buying one every season. This one here fits perfect from top to bottom. Its a bit baggy from the side but height wise it is perfect. It falls right to the floor so when it rains to water bounces inside to touch the smoker. Compared to my old cover this thing is a high quality product. The old one was light and this one has weight to it. The material is heavy and thick. There are a couple of straps that helps in making the cover fit better. I think this one is gonna last a few seasons.

This probably one of my favorite lotions so far. It is not to thick and not to thin.  A little bit goes a long way. My sons skin feels so soft and his skin looks very hydrated. He doesn't get any rashes or irritations since its free of a lot of stuff. The lightly fragrant version is nice too. It has a subtle scent that lasts for the most day. Overall a great baby lotion without all those crazy synthetic and non-synthetic ingredients.

This is a great baby shampoo and body wash. It doesn't irritate my sons sensitive skin. It is a very low sud shampoo so it might seem like it is not doing its job of cleansing but it is. Don't use more to make it sud more since you will just waste the shampoo. I noticed that getting my sons hair very saturated with water before shampooing helps in creating a nice lather. It washes out nice too. His skin feels so soft and it doesn't irritate him either.

Great milk storage containers. You can pump directly to the cups or use an adapter. The adapter didn't fit quite right to our equipment so just poured to cups from our other pumps cup. They stack so they are easy to put away and take little bit of space in the cabinets. Now that I no longer pump I use these to store home made baby food. They are just the right size. They close and open really easy and they keep a tight seal. Very sturdy and very convenient.

0:24 MinsThis is a new version of vinyl that Silhouette America is rolling out. It is wrapped in clear plastic. The old version came in a clear tube. I prefer the old version. When I first purchased my cameo I was using the Silhouette branded vinyl. Worked flawless every time. It cost me more to use Silhouette brand that I decided to save money and buy a different brand. All that did was actually waste more money since it didn't cut well and never got the right settings on my cameo to use other brands of vinyl. So, I decided to go back to Silhouette vinyl and again no problems and it worked flawless all the time. Now, Silhouette came out it a new version of vinyl. The backing paper has Aslan, some other text and grid lines. When I use if for large cuts like large letters or numbers I have no problem with most of the time. Most of the time I do work that deals with small cuts and small details. The biggest problem is when I try to remove the transfer paper from the vinyl. As I try to peel the vinyl that is masked, the backing will come along with the vinyl. I posted some photos to show what I am trying to explain. This creates a headache and slows down the work flow. I have tried tweaking the settings and changing the blade. No luck. When I was using the old vinyl from Silhouette that came in the clear tubes I never had a problem. Which is why I paid the premium of using Silhoutte since I didn't encounter problems with it. Now this new version is reminding me of the off brand vinyl I was using. I hope they bring the old version back or someone can give me some tips or settings I can try.

A very solid piece of equipment. Installation is super easy and the instructions made it very clear. If you have the tools the installation will be quick. If not, prepare to ask for some loaners or take a trip to the hardware store. A stud finder is not necessary but it makes installation more accurate. Once you find the studs mark the spots and drill pilot holes. Then start driving the lag screw. A ratchet makes driving the lag screw much faster too. As far as the bar goes it is a solid piece of equipment. It feels and looks strong and I am sure it will last. I am about 5' 8" and I have no problem with headroom. I am sure it depends on your home or garage and ceiling height. I feel the bar is installed safely and I can use it without worry of it failing.

Great little vac and steam. I have two kids and it seems like I am always cleaning after them. I can vacuum and steam clean the floors very quick and have a nice and clean floor. We have wood floors and they look clean but after using this vac and steam for the first time I was wrong. The vacuum is great and picks up the tiny little crumbs the kids leave behind. After steaming I looked at the pad and was amazed at how much dirt there was. After the entire floor was steamed the wood was squeaky clean. My kids were running around at one point and it sounded like I was at a basketball game. Just read the directions and you will be good to go. I always jump into using things right away but I read the manual now. Overall a great vac and steam. Worked perfect for our small floor.

My kids love these. We also have the darth vader ones but sometimes they want something sour. I have two kids and they remind me each day to give them their gummy. These are pretty good too. Compared to other ones these taste good and smell good too. Forgot about the other brand we had before but the smell was pretty funky. My kids didn't mind but I did. These are great and the star wars theme is a nice touch as well.

My kids love them. I have two kids and they remind me each day to give them their gummy. These are pretty good. Compared to other ones these taste good and smell good too. Forgot about the other brand we had before and the smell was pretty funky. My kids didn't mind but I did. These are great and the star wars theme is a nice touch as well.

This was a nice and cheap set for small networking job. The only great thing about this was the network tester. Everything else sort of sucks. The crimper worked a few times. If it weren't for the tester I wouldn't have any idea the cable was bad unless you hook it up and see for yourself on the network. The crimper wouldn't crimp all the pins down. The connectors sucked as well. Once you were able to crimp the pins the retainer clip wouldn't hold once plugged in to the device like the router, etc. I had to lift the clip and then plug in and hope it wouldn't pop off. This is a nice set for a small job. The only thing you will be able to wanna keep is the network tester. Everything else I tossed out from frustration.
Great remote. Needed a cheap replacement and this fit the bill. Wish it was frustration free packaging. Directions were easy to follow. Had the tv programmed within a minute.

This works great to light up an led strip inside a small chest where I keep a few small tools. I have the battery box and led lights connected to a plunger switch. A soon as I open the lid the light goes on. Works great. When I close the lid it turns off. Not sure how long the batteries last to light up a 2.5 foot led strip. Haven't replace the batteries and the lights aren't on all the time. Overall a great battery box for certain projects.

Works great. You do need to pry the box open to make adjustments. At first this would trigger the light on just for a few seconds. I use this with an led strip in a storage shed. Works great and have no complaints.

Great safety glasses. I had some over sized all clear safety glasses. They were great but sometimes you are working and forget you have them on and go places. You can get weird looks. Now these are a little nicer and look better and can pass as regular glasses. As far as protection they are great. They cover my eyes pretty good especially from the sides. Very affordable protection for my eyes.

Gap quality nice cotton. We have taller toddlers, including one who is close to the height and size of a 6-7 year old. So we bought 11/12 and they fit great. Nice left over length in the legs but still snug.
I used this for a luteal phase and skincare regimen and the results are amazing!! I'm only mad because I did not buy this sooner.
MMF and Paula Prass make incredibly great thread count fabrics which are all colour saturated. They can be used for EVERY kind of creation. This seller is great!

This has the same consistency as aloe vera gel by coppertone or Alba botanical papaya enzyme gel. It has a nice feel but performance wise it will NOT give you the gentle (but extreme if used daily) that the ZIA fresh papaya enzyme peel used to before the company was sold an they ruined the formula with carrot oil. This is a mild exfoliant pre cleanser.
Great for taller little ones with larger bridge and slim ankles. Lovely colours and very durable. Will be buying more of this style.

We love this. The amount of letter work is great. This is not just  sticker book! It is a great educational tool. Great book though the stickers do not age well and may come off the backing due to age.

Update: The company kindly sent a second pair of scissors. Great service.This is a well made protect but I'm disappointed at how intrinsically dull the blade is. Safety wise this pair is a great option though as the scissors are injury proof. Seems like this would be far better on a short hair. On my long hair it feels like using school safety scissors from grade school 85% of the time. If the clump is sticking out or easy then things are fine but I especially bought it for hard to reach places. Would not buy again but an addition to the grooming arsenal nonetheless.

This insert shelf bust dress is a popular style lately. In past years trying to buy this style in vintage over a 26 inch waist was near impossible. Now due to the miracle of vintage reproduction it is available for most sizes. This fits like the Garden Ophelia but the fabric is lighter weight. In most other brands (Trashy Diva, PUG) the bust on this style runs smaller proportionately which is a pain if you are buxom. Kudos to Lindy Bop for actually sizing the bust up ALONG with the dress waist instead of making the shelf more or less the same size and depth as the mediums and larges. This is a great dress if you are buxom but may not work with you are not. If you aren't busty I'd say go by your waist because the dress has some stretch. If you are busty your bust will be very emphasized.
These are such cute and adorable pants. Fab for potty training as well as wearing under clothes. Fabric and stitching is very well done.
Great maker and the flavour means it is very easy to get kids to take this oil. Looking forward to trying a few more products from Nordic Naturals.

Great, great remixes as with the first EP though Super Amanda's voice is not as strong here as The Killing Machine ep (or perhaps not utilized enough as this song is more of a narrative than a vocal) to deliver the same impact but I like the vibe nonetheless. The Hemi Charger song is a Tura Satana tribute.

Five great tracks of insanely cool industrial remixes of the theme from the soundtrack of Hot Rod Girls Save The World. Super Amanda has a very low and powerful Nina Simone style voice which goes great with the B movie vibe but real the master here is D.A. who can mix down a dark industrial vocal like nobody's biz.
The overseas vendor was out but I still cannot recommend this bubble solution enough. It is hard to find outside of the bubblegun it comes with though. No better bubbles ANYWHERE!
These are lovely quality but tended to slip of the mattress edge. Still, for sheets not made in china I'm not complaining and I am happy with other sets by the same company.

I was very lucky to score an elusive size 13.5 toodler for children with a wide bridge and slim ankle. These will have give via the velcro for toddlers with very wide feet all around. Not ideal if it is wet outside but these dry great in the sun with paper trowels inside.

This is going to work best on over 40 skin which has used sunscreen religiously. It treats fine lines, large pores and can help with oil control. I do not think oily skin needs a second cream or serum over this.

Seller was top knotch so when these tuned out to be too narrow I was issued a return with no problem. She was in wonderful condition for a seconds but sadly far too narrow for my impossible to fit wide feet. Bummed because the shoes would have been the perfect rockabilly clogs.
Great trip back in time. The knob is a bit tough for little ones to twist but then that makes it interactive for parents. very sweet and innocent fun.

Have to return these as they are shockingly small. These are not the standard Kidorable/Kamik wider bridge last (foot mold) that they usually use. These I think were inspired by Hunters but lack the wider footbed while being inspired by the elevated design. Our children have worn the Kamiks with the dinos on them in size 11 but these run like a 10/9.5 in that design. Wide feet and tall toddlers should size up at least one. Our son wear a US12 but would have needed TWO sizes bigger in these.

Whereas Genefique gives almost overnight results, this is a product that needs a generous application and nightly use for about a month. It is more of a skin rebuilder than refiner. I like it much better than strivectin and idealist but compared to Avon Pro-erase I don't think I'll buy retail. As a gift or if you get free samples sure, but this is hugely pricey in it's full size. The two samples I bought from the wonderful seller were VERY tiny and the applicator. Consistency is like diluted toothpaste unlike Genefigue which is like an easily absorbed serum. I'd use this at the chin area or anywhere you have repeated acne marks and dryness but I'd never use this on the cheeks or forehead. Once again, this is a superior product but if you are going to buy retail there are MUCH stronger products for the same price as visionaire like Prevage or Brazilian 30% peel. Definitely try before you buy.

I am a big fan of NPR, especially Wait Wait Don't Tell me and Car Talk. I usually use TuneIn Radio as my go-to app for listening to NPR on my phone, but after finding this official NPR app I thought I'd try it out.DESIGNThe app has a very clean look with big buttons along the bottom and intuitive tabs along the top that allows for quick access to your listening history, currently playing and upcoming programs. If you click on the "hamburger" icon, you'll see additional features like sleep timer, feedback, donation and suggestions, which is a cool feature where the app recommends new things based on your past listening history. The overall design is minimalist and attractive, and on an almost three year old HTC One M7, the app runs smoothly with no delays or hiccups.ADD-ONS & PERMISSIONSThe permissions required by this app from my testing matches the list on the Amazon store page. They are overall harmless, including the coarse GPS location request, which is most likely used to find your local NPR station. All the read and write access to storage is most likely used for the extensive cache scheme used by the app to ensure smooth streaming. I noticed this while looking at the app size on my phone. It took up about 13MB, which isn't bad. But after about 30 min of listening, the app cache had accumulated about 38MB. I cleared this while the app was playing and it didn't show any ill effect.The only add-ons were Google mobile ads and Google analytics. I didn't encounter any ads while using the app, which was a pleasant surprise. So maybe the mobile ads module is just dormant or extraneous. The analytics module is so the developer can analyze anonymous usage patterns and tweak and adjust the app in future releases.POTENTIAL PROBLEMSThere were two issues. First, it's not clear how to exit out of the app. Pressing back doesn't do it completely, as the circle icon still shows up in my notification area. Took me a while to figure out - you have to click pause in the notification area control first to trigger the close button to show up. I hope NPR will make it easier to close in an update.Second, the app uses a lot of data. I think this is because it caches everything to ensure a smooth playback, which is great and I love it. But this might be an issue if you're on a limited data plan, which is most folks nowadays, and listening on the go using your mobile data.SUMMARYThis is a very well designed app, with a clean and attractive user interface and smooth streaming even on older devices. It's dedicated to NPR and nothing else. If you're a NPR fan, definitely check this out.

As an avid amateur photographer, I love my Nikon DSLR and my small lens collection. I, however, hate lugging my entire setup around. I still do it, mind you, but it’s certainly no fun especially when traveling long distances via air (case in point, my recent trip to Yellowstone). So, when VicTsing reached out with a request to test out their new 3 in 1 lens kit for mobile devices, I was very intrigued. Obviously, it’s not going to match up to my Nikon setup, but it’s not supposed to be given the price point. I was excited to see if it actually can add some extra dimensions to mobile photography, since nowadays phones are probably the most accessible cameras – and you almost always have it with you, unlike the Nikon.PACKAGING AND BUILD QUALITYThe kit came in an attractive package with a color user’s manual pamphlet. The fisheye lens is in one assembly, while the wide-angle and macro are combined in series in another lens assembly. VicTsing included two clippers, which is a nice touch as it cuts down dramatically on you having to constantly screw/unscrew lenses. There’s also a nice carrying pouch. The lenses themselves are made of plastic, which is expected. The threads on the lens and clips do fit nicely, and the overall build quality is very nice – better than I expected, to be honest. The instructions aren’t 100% clear, but I was able to figure it out after playing with it for a few minutes. I mean, who reads those instructions anyway, am I right guys? Nevertheless, I’ve attached pics of the package, lenses and the instructions. Notice on the package it says it fits HTC phones – more on that later.TAKING PHOTOS AND PICTURE QUALITYI tested the lens kit on the following devices:1. HTC One M72. LG Realm3. HTC Rezound4. Apple Retina iPadThe first problem I encountered with the phones was that the clip didn’t open wide enough for the phones with their cases on. I prefer slim Seidio cases than tough Otterboxes, so I was really surprised. I ended up having to take the cases off for all the phones before I could properly clip the lenses on. Well, all except one – the HTC One M7. The clip is just not long enough to reach the camera lens on the phone. I’ve attached a pic showing the discrepancy. Basically, this led to 1/3 of the photo’s left side completely out of focus. I informed VicTsing, as at the time their Amazon product page said the kit supports HTC phones. VicTsing’s rep promptly apologized and has since removed HTC from their product page. This is still not exactly true, since it does work fine with the older HTC Rezound. Just not the One M7, and presumably M8 and M9 since their camera lens location didn’t change much.I had no problem with the iPad, even with the smart cover on.As for the photo quality… well, these are plastic lenses, so I was pleasantly surprised by the resulting photos. I am attaching normal/wide/macro/fisheye shots – hopefully they give you a good idea of the field of view and quality. It was somewhat tricky to get the lens to sit perfectly flat against the devices, since the tiniest gap will result in out of focus photos and other aberrations. I found the easiest way to align the lens with the device’s sensor is to flip the phone or ipad over and look directly through the lens.SUMMARYIn the end, I think these are fun, cool shots and the kit gives me some additional options for mobile photography. The fisheye especially can be really cool if done right. The macro is surprisingly good, but you need to have perfect lens placement and very steady hands. The price point is great, and this would definitely make for a nice little gift for the shutterbug in your life. Just keep your expectations reasonable.Full disclosure: I received a sample for testing. I am not affiliated with the seller in any way, and my review is a genuine and unbiased account of my personal experience with the product. Rest assured, I have absolutely no compunction about exposing products that suck. Just my way of paying it forward for all the other good reviews that have helped me so far :)

This mini “floater” - not sure if the manufacturer was aware of the name’s somewhat unfortunate connotation when in a watery environment :) – is designed to hook up to your GoPro or other waterproof devices, or really just any small item that you would want to carry into the water with you. The hook has a quick release that allows you to easily detach the camera if needed. The entire contraption seems pretty well made. I took it to the pool for testing, and indeed it was able to stay afloat while attached to my GoPro 3+ in its watertight enclosure. The bright yellow band looks nice and definitely makes it easier to spot.The strap was a bit tight for my wrist though, and I have average to probably slightly skinny wrists. On one hand, it definitely feels securely attached, which is good. But it’s tight enough to be slightly restrictive, almost like a mini blood pressure cuff right on the wrist. There is a single button can be undone, which is what I ended up doing. With it undone, it’s more of a forearm strap, which doesn’t put the camera in ideal position for taking shots, but it’s quite a bit more comfortable. For this reason alone, I think this is really more of a 3.5 stars product. Since Amazon doesn’t allow half-star ratings, I decided to round up because the product does perform exactly as described, just not as comfortable as I would expect without unbuttoning.Full disclosure: I received a sample for testing. I am not affiliated with the seller in any way, and my review is a genuine and unbiased account of my personal experience with the product. Rest assured, I have absolutely no compunction about exposing products that suck. Just my way of paying it forward for all the other good reviews that have helped me so far :)

This is a standard issue vacuum wine preserver. The general idea is that you can preserve an unfinished bottle of wine for a few more days by reducing the amount of oxygen the wine is exposed to, which causes oxidation. Personally, I am 50/50 on the idea, since I feel like you’re also sucking out all the flavor and essence in the process, but that’s a fun debate for another day. The pump comes with two rubber stoppers. The product is made in China, and the package is very simple with virtually no instructions. A quick google search should help if you’ve never used this before. Basically, you use a stopper to replace the cork. Then you attach the pump to the top of the stopper and start pumping. There’s no way to know when it’s “done”, since it depends on various factors like the bottle size, how much wine is left, how hard you’re pumping, and maybe the phase of the moon at the time. Okay, maybe not the last one, but you get the idea. Generally though, you’ve achieved a decent vacuum when you remove the stopper and hear a loud pop.The product itself seems decently well made. The seal between the stopper and pump was good. The pump is really just a simple air-tight tube. It’s nice that it comes with two stoppers.Full disclosure: I received a sample for testing. I am not affiliated with the seller in any way, and my review is a genuine and unbiased account of my personal experience with the product. Rest assured, I have absolutely no compunction about exposing products that suck. Just my way of paying it forward for all the other good reviews that have helped me so far :)

When this light bulb was first introduced by Philips back in May, it quickly became somewhat viral due to the special introductory price of just $5 - for a two pack. This was unheard of for brand new LED bulbs without any utility subsidies. I bought two packs back in June when it became available at my local Home Depot, and I was so impressed that I ended up making it the primary bulb for my whole house.DESIGNThe bulb looks like a traditional lightbulb, with an almost perfectly circular plastic enclosure on top followed by about an inch of what feels like metal stem. It's rated to produce 800 lumens while drawing 8.5W with a color temperature of 2700K, which is closest to the good old incandescent soft white. The color rendering index (CRI), which is related to how accurate colors are rendered by the light emitted by the bulb, is 80 - this is about average. The bulb's main selling point is its low price point, and this is reflected in a couple areas. First, the rated life is 10,000 hours, or about 10 years at 3 hours per day. This is roughly half of what most other LED bulbs are rated for, which is around 20~22 years or 25000 hours. Second, the light bulb feels noticeably lighter than most other comparable 60W equivalent LED bulbs. This is due to the fact that there's no elaborate heatsink design. Instead, the only heatsink I can see is the inch of metal stem. I've attached a photo comparing this bulb with three other 60W equivalent LED bulbs. The weight is actually very comparable to the Philips SlimStyle, another Philips LED bulb with emphasis on affordability.The bulb is specifically labelled to be non-dimmable, suitable for damp locations but not suitable for use in fully enclosed luminaries.ACTUAL LIGHTING & ENERGY EFFICIENCY PERFORMANCEUsing a Killawatt to verify power draw, I installed the bulb in a standard floor lamp which places the bulb facing upward in an open enclosure situation. The bulb lighted instantly - some LEDs have a slight half second delay but not here. Power draw at the outlet fluctuated between 8.0 and 8.1W - a pleasant surprise as it's actually drawing less than the rated 8.5W. The power draw remained steady, sometimes dipping to 7.9W but mainly around 8W, at 30 min/60 min/90 min/120 min. At the rated 800 lumen output, this is essentially 100lumens/watt, which is very impressive and actually beats out all the other LEDs I have in my inventory, every one of which being at least twice as expensive if not more.Touching the lightbulb while it's on further supports its low power draw performance. After three hours of continuous operation, the plastic top part is barely warm to the touch. The white metal stem is hot, but I can actually keep my fingers on the stem for about 4 seconds before it's uncomfortable enough to force me to pull away. With other bulbs, I have to pull away almost immediately from the metal heatsink stem after 3 hours of runtime. This is really encouraging, as heat is the number one cause for failure in LED bulbs.The bulb is virtually silent. In certain fixtures, such as my bathroom and one older lamp, there is a very faint buzz if I press my ear next to it, literally about one or two inches away. This was a big improvement over my other affordable Philips LED bulb - the SlimStyle. Very nice.The color temperature is 2700K. This is a potential downside for me, since I personally prefer 3000K for daily lighting. This bulb definitely looks ever so slightly yellower compared to my 3000K bulbs. But at its price point, this is something I can overlook.The other potential shortcoming is that it's not rated for use in fully enclosed light fixtures. The main reason for this is most likely heat dissipation. Surprisingly, none of my other vastly more expensive 60W equivalent LED bulbs are rated for use in fully enclosed fixtures, including all the other bulbs shown in the attached photo. The only LED bulb in my inventory that's rated for fully enclosed fixtures is the FEIT 40W equivalent at 7.5W which I bought from my local Costco's through an utility subsidy. Therefore, I can't really hold it against this bulb - just be aware if you have fully enclosed fixtures, they might adversely affect this bulb's lifespan.Finally, this bulb is not rated for dimmers. However, I tested it at a friend's house with an actual dimmer, and it actually was able to dim down fairly smoothly, albeit with some flickering after about maybe 50% brightness. From other reports online, it seems like it's a hit or miss with dimmers with this bulb. Since it's not rated for dimmers, I consider this almost like a bonus feature if it works well enough for you.SUMMARYThe main selling point of this bulb is its very affordable price. The great 100lm/w efficiency is a very pleasant surprise. Combined with a virtually silent operation, this bulb has become my main bulb throughout my house. Of course, the shorter rated lifespan is somewhat of a concern. However, with its price point being so affordable, it's something that I can certainly live with. There's really no excuse to not try out LED lighting with the availability of this bulb.

Another year, another new iPhone! We preordered two new iPhone 6S this year – both 64GB rose gold, one for AT&T and one for Verizon (I know, it’s complicated when it comes to wireless plans in my family). Both were delivered on launch day back on 9/25, and after over two weeks I think I’ve had enough time to make an accurate assessment of the latest offering out of Cupertino.DESIGNBeing a “S” year model, the 6S is as expected a refinement of last year’s 6. It inherits pretty much the same physical layout – same 4.7” (750 × 1334) retina screen in a body that’s ever so slightly thicker/taller (by 0.2 mm) and heavier (14g or 0.4oz). It’s virtually identical, so much so that my significant other’s old 6 case fits the new 6S perfectly. So if you got old accessories from last year, most likely it will all still work fine on the new phone. The heavier weight is definitely noticeable at first, but you get used to it quickly after a day or so.The only new physical change this year is the addition of “rose gold” as a color option. Don’t let the name fool ya – it’s certainly very pink!NEW FEATURESThis year, the main new features are 3D touch, higher resolution cameras (front and back), faster processor and graphics performance and a couple other software refinement and features.-3D touchThis is the main event. Apple first introduced this concept with the Apple watch, when it was called Force Touch. Interesting sidenote - apparently they changed the name to 3D touch due to the negative connotation associated with “forcing” something, especially with the female customers. Anyway, this feature adds another dimension to the user interface by allowing the phone to sense different depths of touch. Basically, the phone is now pressure-sensitive, just like Wacom tablets but obviously not that many levels of sensitivity. I think out of all the features and changes, this is the most defining and important addition to the iPhone. It allows for a more intuitive flow in apps that support it. Currently, there’s only a handful, and most are Apple’s in-house apps. But it’s only a matter of time before developers start figuring out how best to utilize this additional dimension.-Upgraded camerasThis year Apple finally upgraded the cameras – both front and back. The front camera goes from 1.2MP to 5.0MP, a very noticeable jump. The screen now doubles as the flash for the front camera. All this should make all the selfie enthusiasts out there very happy. For the back camera, Apple bumped the spatial resolution from 8.0MP to 12MP and boosted the video capabilities with 4K video and slower slo-mo video at 1080p (now up to 120 fps vs last year’s 60 fps). In the process, Apple decided to go with a similar sensor size, which resulted in smaller pixel size (now 1.22 microns vs last year’s 1.5 microns). Apple says they used “deep trench” technology to deal with the increase in noise level associated with the smaller pixels. This is where the geek/photography enthusiast inside me kind of rolls my eyes slightly – this technology has been in place in other cameras and phones for a while now and is nothing new. It’s not something magical or revolutionary. That being said, the iPhone camera is definitely one of the best mobile cameras around. The response time is great with minimal shutter lag and shot-to-shot delay.
