I also wonder if those with issues used it more than others (it should still maintain its integrity despite this, in my opinion).At it's current Amazon price of $26.87 (with free shipping for a purchase totaling $35.), I think this is a good value for the money, I would expect this to be higher in certain specialty stores but probably lower or similarly priced at a Walgreens or CVS.This product was made in China.

I had high expectations for Kaui Hart Hemmings' "The Possibilities", since I was captivated by her prior novel, "The Descendents".  Unfortunately, I have rather mixed feelings upon my completion.Ms. Hart Hemmings is a talented writer, her characterizations are vivid enough that you can identify with them and see them clearly.  The story itself portrayed grieving and its five stages accurately.  The questions that the main character, Sarah St. John, mother to 22 y.o., Cully who died in an accident struggles to find answers are realistic.  She is portrayed as unproductive and adrift as she tries to return to her job as a public relations/sales promoter for Breckenridge ski resorts.  She is so stricken that she can't maintain her poise or civility.  Her only real friend, Suzanne is going through her own grief as her marriage careens toward divorce.  Their interactions are at times tense as they compare their wounds and compete for attention.  Soon Sarah discovers secrets that Cully had kept, one follows another which leads to the entry of Kit, Cully's girlfriend that no one but his formerly estranged father had any awareness.  Kit's big reveal won't be much of a surprise to most readers.  At this point, one feels like one has "seen" multiple times on "Lifetime" Channel and at least a few times on the Hallmark Channel as well as in a number of different novels.  Thus, I felt cheated since the story meanders along for awhile with everyone wondering about Kit's sudden appearance 3 months after Cully has died; sure I understand they are caught up in their grief but these intelligent, modern people can't suss out her agenda seemed farfetched.Ms. Hart Hemmings is so talented in characterizations and dialogue, it is truly a shame she didn't at least shorten the story a bit.  For me it stalled when Kit just shows up but nothing really happens until some time later.  While this plot device was intended to build suspense, it fails miserably.  Leaving readers frustrated at the key character's naivete.  Additionally, the ending leaves the door open for a sequel, which I probably wouldn't read.If Ms. Hart Hemmings continues to write about grieving characters, I hope she will put more effort toward a more imaginative plot.  I can only recommend this book if one doesn't expect it to be comparable to the originality that "The Descendents" delivered.

Naturint accurately portrays the color you can expect out of the bottle.  One of the great things that really impressed me was that other hair colors might portend to offer the color shown but when I followed the instructions and completed the time specified or beyond the color my results were usually much darker than shown.It was suggested for stubborn grey (in my case white hair) most of it still medium brown, was to leave product on longer.  I did and the color was beautiful.  My color was just like the picture, unfortunately, it was to light for my complexion.I was pleased with Naturint's customer service as well.I would highly recommend this product to those wanting to get the results they expect when reading color chart.

I got a sample in the mail some time ago.  I really didn't give it a thought until one day I ran out of my brand.  I was super impressed and remain so.  This shaver has three blades that can smoothly cut thick, wiry hair.  I have had a few slight cuts but primarily it was from pressing down to hard (which isn't necessary, as it glides smoothly).  It gives a clean shave and it doesn't irritate my skin!I have had great results and have used it many times since opening.You need to try this!

Night Blindness is a fast-paced novel that at times is quite gripping.  The protagonist, Jensen Reilly Ledarkis returns to her home to nurse her ailing father through radiation treatment for brain cancer.  Her return revives all her suppressed pain from the sudden death of her older, teenage brother, Will, with whom she was close.  As she faces the potential of the loss of her father, her guilt at failing to share a secret, as well as her disengagement from her parents after Will's demise, overwhelms her like a Tidal wave.  As she seeks clarity and to reconnect with her parents and her former boyfriend (Will's best-friend), Ryder, she must decide if she will remain hidden within her husband, Nico's shadow or reclaim the life she had hoped for in her youth.Given that I am reviewing an advanced reading copy, I am basing my opinion on what may not be a part of the book in final form.  There were times I had difficulty connecting to Jensen, I don't want to incorporate spoiler's, so I will leave it at that.  Also, situational ethics plays heavily into the story, that is, 'if it feels good do it'.  Unfortunately, other lives are impacted when we do what we want versus what we ought.  This is part of the reason I didn't connect with some of Jensen's actions, but not the only reason.On a positive note, key character's behaviors were entirely realistic given the trauma of Will's death.  Each person's grieving process was well-captured and heartbreaking, and these insights may be considered the book's strongest feature by some.Susan Strecker's debut novel is a compelling story.  She effectively built suspense by keeping secret the events moment's before Will's death.  I would recommend Night Blindness as a worthwhile read as most of us have experienced loss of someone dear.  That said, it is unlikely I will reread it.  I would however consider reading other story's by Strecker.

Sylvia True has written an outstanding account on the impact that sex addictions can have on partners and family members, some of which are quite unexpected.  Her characterizations ring true, each main character struggling with her own insecurities, the fear of the future and the underlying feelings of betrayal, alienation and raw personal shame as deep as that of those who grieve a loss of life or relationship of an immediate family member.  Each of the women deals with some level of denial and at times feels misunderstood by the addict as well as the others attending their support group.  What starts as a grasping of straws to survive another day evolves into most of the women developing coping skills to face their unknown future and mutual support and compassion for each other.There wasn't a wasted word in this debut masterpiece, though I would have liked it to have been longer, the ending on the whole was satisfying.  Ms. True develops her characters with an artist's sensitivity and clarity.  Anyone who has struggled with a partner with this condition will identify with stages of grief and the questioning of how if their own reaction's influence the problems that ensue.  Ms. True is a therapist and it is obvious that she has vast knowledge of this type of addiction's manifestations and repercussions.I was absorbed from the very beginning.  The women's pain was palatable and likewise, their healing process and friendships were encouraging.  I would not hesitate in recommending this book for it's honest insights as well as its flowing storyline.  This is a must read for those emotionally impacted by this problem as it offers powerful validation in addition to its well written prose.

Patricia Harman, author of "The Reluctant Midwife: A Hope River Novel" is a well executed story of intertwining narratives of two primary characters, as they experience great hardships of the Great Depression in a coal mining region of West Virginia.  As the story unfolds we come to appreciate the frailties of Nurse Becky and Dr. Blum and their personal and career challenges.  Harman's characterizations are vivid and intriguing.  One does not need to read the first in this series to understand the situation or character dynamics.The story flows fluidly from Nurse Becky's journey from working as a surgeon's assistant to transitioning into work as a midwife when her close friend, Patience, the region's midwife becomes temporarily bedridden.  Soon, her wonder overtakes her fear of delivering newborns often without guidance, and gradually her clinical detachment crumbles away.  Later, she is employed part-time as a nurse working at a clinic for CCC, a forestry program created during FDR's administration to get young unemployed men trained and equipped for jobs in public works.  Becky efforts enable her to grow into an individual with greater compassion and empathy for others as drama unfolds.  Likewise, through her dedication to Dr. Blum, he also transforms for the better.When I selected this book it was with a slight reluctance.  I wasn't sure I wanted to read the graphic birth scenes I anticipated.  Instead, I found Becky's anguish matched my own and while the situations were descriptive, they weren't overly detailed that I wanted to skip that section, in fact, I found her nurse's notes detailing the events were fascinating as well.  The terminology when used was always explained, so I learned a few facts, too.I looked forward to the time I could next pick up this book and I was saddened as it ended.  However, based on the ending, a third story is obviously in the works.  I have ordered the first in the series not because I have unanswered questions, rather, I enjoy Ms. Harman's creative story telling.  This is was a pleasurable read and I emphatically endorse it.

Frances Whiting delivers a thoughtful, humorous drama encompassing a variety of relationships in Tallulah de Longland's young life.  "Walking on Trampolines" explores the adaptability one must maintain when life's unexpected curves challenge the established equilibrium.  Through Tallulah's (Lulu) commitment to her family, friends and boss, we observe that those closest to her rely on her to point them True North, however, when she commits one irresponsible act, she looses herself.  Her struggle to forgive herself and in turn others will be her turning point.  The challenge is can she do it?The story is full of well drawn, flawed characters which include her 3 close girlfriends, her first love, her dysfunctional family and an arrogant, obnoxious boss who takes on the role of confidant, friend and benefactor.  The first portion of the story explores Lulu's unlikely friendship with wealthy, sophisticated Annabel while attending Catholic school as a preteen.  Once Lulu becomes romantically involved with Josh, they all become inseparable.  Lulu never suspects their betrayal until she catches them de facto.  Lulu is crushed and suffers from long-term depression and suspends all her future plans.  After several years working in her father's plumbing business, she is forced from her nest and works as a Personal Assistant to an infamous national radio personality.  When his belligerent attitude and unseemly language fail to have their intended impact a truce is met and a great friendship evolves.  This projects us into the second half of the story as Lulu comes to terms with her strengths and frailties.  When she finally acquires knowledge that self-acceptance delivers, she charges full on to a life worth living.This is much more than a typical coming of age story, it is also a story of finding one's place in the world.  I tore through the book in two days, the story was vibrant and the characters were fresh and realistic.  The writing was fluid.  I highly recommend this story to others as a read worthy of your time.

I used VELCRO Brand - Sticky Back for Fabrics to shorten the torso section of two different pairs of pants both cotton, it worked great!Sometimes pants that fit most of my body are made to large for my short stature.  Even though I had hemmed the leg bottoms on my sweat pants, the upper portion was :baggy in the drawers".  Alas, my solution in form of VELCRO!  I affixed the VELCRO to the top portion of the outer band at the navel area, the opposite location at the back and at both seams at the hips.  Then, I placed the opposite VELCRO so it would attach exactly with one turn down of waist band.  Viola, no more loosey goosey for me!I did the same with a dressy pair of cotton pants and had great results as well.There was no way I could have sewn these by machine or hand to make them appear as nice as they did when they were completed..

Author Amy Scheibe delivers an intensely driven plot focused on religion, racism, conservatism and politics in this riveting story. The initial set-up was a little slow but it quickly captures your interest as you observe the sharply contrasting main characters. As events unfold their ulterior agendas are slowly revealed driving the protagonist, Emmaline (Emmy) Nelson to question her role. When she refuses to accept the plans made for her upcoming nuptials, chaos ensues.This story is a dramatic thriller. Several characters actions are increasingly more sinister as each attempt to manipulate their community to garner the power they covet leads to increasing community mayhem. The question is how far will they go to accomplish their plans? Why is Emmy's compliance a part of their strategy? How can she remain safe and convince them that she won't be intimidated to do their bidding?This book definitely has movie potential. It is riff with community drama. It is quintessential in its portrayal mid-western politics and culture in a small farming town. In a few minor instances it reminded me of Jane Smiley's "A Thousand Acres: A Novel" in her portrayal of family politics and power of land ownership. This is a keeper, it will be something I will reread in the future. Don't let the title fool you, this is a story that you will ponder even after you finish.

Mary Hogan's "Two Sisters: A Novel" is largely drawn from her personal life.  I didn't know that until after I finished the story but while reading felt fairly certain this was based on someone's personal experience, it was too realistic not to be.  The trauma created by the family's secrets are compelling and the fluidity in which it is written was exquisite.  The characters had great depth and their flaws were obvious as the story evolved through interactions and situations and not just summarily given, which in my opinion is the sign of an excellent storyteller not just a formulaic writer.While I raced through the book in less than 24 hours, the novel ended to tidily and thus I have deducted a star.  WARNING: Minor spoilers ahead.  My first quibble is that Muriel, the protagonist is very conflicted by the labels and treatment she received growing up and continuing into her adulthood.  Her personal revelations on her role in the problems and the other family members  contribution to these issues was very unrealistic to me; it was almost as if she woke up one morning after her 22(?) years of mess and sees the complete picture with 20/20 vision.  Additionally, another character, who is mainly responsible for her suffering and shame realizes her own flaws and repents to Muriel for the pain she has caused.  In my experience (and I have a gold star in this arena), people who compulsively lie rarely change their stripes and they typically refuse to be held accountable (I'm not saying it never happens).  While the healing that occurs was a nice way to end the book, it didn't really correlate with the personalities  or dynamics of those involved within the nearly 30 years of drama and deception.I would definitely recommend this story.  The prose was beautifully written and quite vivid.  The characters were exceptionally drawn and dynamic.The plot will appeal to a those who enjoy drama.  Most people will either identify with at least some of the scenes personally or have a connection to the dynamics on some level.

This really is a "Silent" Alarm Clock.  I love picture background.  You can see the arms in the dark of night.  It does sound loudly in the morning.  Two things I wish were added: 1) AM and PM because sometimes I need to sleep more than 12 hours; 2) More than one alarm setting, it is so loud I wake with a start, a softer alarm would be a great addition.All in all, I am very pleased.  It is very straight forward in set-up.  You don't have to simultaneously press 3 buttons to get one action, whew!It is a great value for the price.

I was so excited to get a cheese grater like those in restaurants.  It was very easy to put together but as others have mentioned there are some issues.1) I use Cabot Cheddar which comes in a bar, it got "rounded out" looking like a hardcover novel with the covers far ahead of the pages.2) It delivers very fine slivers of cheese meaning you have a lot of melt able cheese but it is a bit of a clean-up; not a big deal.3) I can't disable to clean, this is a big deal.  I have attempted multiple positions and angles and I can't the handle and then attempted remove the really sharp blade structure.  I don't know if it is my badly injured rotator cuff which weakens me or my arthritic hands but I can not disassemble it to clean after use.

This story is what I consider outstanding psychological thrillers are made off.  Eve Dalladay is not what she appears but as the story unravels via flashbacks, Natty missed the little cues.  Natty is a classically insecure personality with great naivete about how the world really operates.  She is very dedicated to people pleasing which is why her hotel is such a success.  However, this inability to see people as they really are is the reason she never realizes that she is being set-up.  For those people who read or watch a lot of television or movies in this genre, she may be considered weak or stupid but this is her personality make-up and there are plenty of people just like her.Author, Paula Daly has written a complex story, which unravels insights with great timing.  Her characters are well drawn.  She has a good understanding of narcissistic sociopaths as to their thought patterns and behaviors.  If you have ever had the misfortune of knowing one, you will relate to Natty's feelings of frustration, despair and betrayal.The evidence is in: this book encapsulates the horrors of being the victim of a sociopath and subsequent results.  If I were to meet Ms. Daly, I would ask if she ever personally had dealt with a sociopath?  This is one of the best books I've read in this genre in at least a year.  Then again, I've had several sociopaths in my life.

Stanley Bostitch Personal Heavy Duty Stapler Value Kit is nice value for the infrequent user such as myself.  My staples were cleanly in place without any issues when stapling large documents.I found it fairly easy to use (there were instructions otherwise it would have been a bit of a challenge as it wasn't the most obvious place).  I had a bit of a challenge getting the stapler compartment closed once the staples were in place as they raised up as it was 90% closed this happened at least 5 or 6 times until using my left hand, I pushed the staples down while pushing with my right hand to close it.  I consider this a design flaw. Other reviewers comment on these issues as well and some state the loading mechanism breaks and then the stapler no longer functions.However, since I am not going to be a daily user or perhaps even a weekly user, I will report back if it does indeed break.  In the past, I have been happy with my other Stanley Bostitch Staplers but I have used other brands that I am equally satisfied.All in all, I am pleased but since there are a lot of unhappy customers, I can recommend it based on my limited use.

Probiotics are known for aiding digestion and absorption of important nutrients which in turn aids in healthier passage of fecal matter more specifically it is helpful in stopping diarrhea and gas.  Good stuff, huh?  Well, it gets better...the better you absorb nutrients in your food, the better your entire body can function as it gets what is required to work at optimal level.  Thus the microflora impacts anywhere mucous membranes are exposed to the environment such as the skin, respiratory tract and genital-urinary tract.I was excited that I could offer these chews to my dog as a treat.  Unfortunately, they aren't very chewy they are almost hard.  I have found this to be an issue with many of my Vetri-Science products -my dogs get Canine Plus Senior daily arrive dried out 90% of the time, although Vetri-Liver Canine Chews are moist, however, my one dog refuses to eat them. This chew has 286 million microorganisms per chew which seems like a lot.  However, the Vetri-Science Vetri-Mega Probiotic capsules has at least 5 billion microorganisms per capsule (this is substantial compared to other brands) and is obviously more than 10 times more than the chew!  However, I don't know what is suggested for a dog and I don't know if the size of the dog is a consideration either.The Vetri-Science Probiotic chew has 9 strains of probiotic plus FOS while the Vetri-Science Probiotic capsule has 8 strains.  Both are very good, as the type and number of strains mean they are more effective.  The chews have dried skim milk as one of the last ingredients which if your dog is lactose intolerant may be an issue.Neither the Vetri-Science's Vetri-Mega Probiotic capsules nor the chews require refrigeration which saves me space since many probiotics do require refrigeration.My elderly dogs do like these chews, they didn't care for the capsule being sprinkled on their food.  Based on their tiny size, I am instructed to cut the chew in half.Price wise as of this writing (Amazon frequently adjusts prices), which is currently at $19.64 per package (just 9 days ago it was $16.99) so it is currently $.33 per chew.  While the capsules compared which price hasn't changed from 9 days ago stays at $22.64 for 120 or $.19 per cap almost half price.If you have a picky dog, you might want to purchase the chews but the value of the capsules plus the substantially higher volume as far as Probiotics makes it a better value overall particularly at the current prices.

The Sterling Silver Multi-Color Stone Key Pendant Necklace is a lovely gift item for yourself or friend.  The delicate design suggests sophistication.  The stones appear true to color shown on your monitor (at least they did on mine, your results may vary).  They are quite brilliant and it will match a variety of clothing selections. The bottom portion appears as a pretty lattice work adding to the elegance of the piece.  I like that the loop for the chain is placed behind the pendant allowing the eye to focus on the intricacy of the design and the bright stones.  The Sterling Silver chain is simple but classical although a little to small in size and length.The size is a bit smaller than it appears on a standard 15" computer monitor.  Length wise the pendant is 15/16" or 27 millimeters approximately.  Across at it's widest point is 7/16" or 13 millimeters approximately.This is a beautiful piece of costume jewelry (the stones do not look real), however, I wouldn't hesitate to wear this to a party or a dressy day at the office as its design ads flair and refinement to solid colors particular a black or navy dress.  Really, the pendant is an inexpensive wardrobe must!  A nice piece to travel with as if it were lost or stolen, you wouldn't have to worry about insurance costs.

This movie tried to incorporate many messages into its plot with some success.  The acting by some of the persons was forced and came across as to extreme (particularly the women that is the innkeeper).  However, other key players were much more believable in their parts especially the brother and sister, who ran an orphanage.  Which makes one wonder if it was a result of script or direction given as opposed to the skills of those playing their parts.The sequence of events that lead a successful sports event to be stranded in "Middletown" seemed so contrived that I almost didn't finish the movie, however it improved greatly as the story progressed.  The sharing of the those running the orphanage as well as that of the Pastor, played by Steven Curtis Chapman were encouraging, informative and cohesive contributions to the primary plot.I am not sure this would capture the attention of the lost, which is its target audience and that along with the other concerns are the reasons that 3 stars are awarded.While I would recommend this as wholesome family entertainment (I have NO idea why Parental Guidance is suggested, when witchcraft is prevalent in cartoons and this was nothing a 4 year old hasn't heard).  I am not sure I would want to see it a second time.  That said, it delivered an uplifting message and that is more than you can say about 99% of the movies that are released.

The fountain of youth for your hair has been created!  I have color treated hair which leaves it dry.  Additionally, I take multiple medications that further impact it.  After two uses, I noticed softer, healthier appearing hair.  As an added bonus, my hair does not feel at all greasy or oily like some shampoos leave it.I think the price is within reason as well.  Please note that this is a review for the shampoo only - I clicked on the link for the shampoo but I see the conditioner is posted when I wrote the actual review.  I do intend to try the conditioner but it may not be necessary except when blowing drying or curling which dries the hair, since I already have great results from the shampoo.I caution that we all are unique in our body chemistry so this may not work for everyone - as we can see, some others didn't like it.  It is even possible that the formulation will change at some point in the future (I have experienced this with two different shampoos that I originally liked only for the formulation to be altered and no longer have the results I anticipated thereafter).So, if you aren't satisfied with your current shampoo, I recommend you give this a chance.

I am a curvy female.  I went by the chart posted and selected the size based on the inches shown.  I was unable to fit into the size recommended for me.  When I opened the package, I had great misgivings and I did attempt to try it on unfortunately, I couldn't get it past my hips.  For those of you that are heavier and most particularly those who are curvy, chances are that you will find the recommendation doesn't accommodate you if stick with the suggestion stated on the size chart.  I thought that since this had the cut away area for the bra, that I wouldn't have to worry.  I noticed some other reviewers have stated that the straps are too thin for comfort (they are 1/2" wide); I can definitely see how the straps would become uncomfortable after an hour or so of wear -please note they do have plenty of fabric to adjust to your torso but again if you are curvy it may still be uncomfortable.  Add to that it has a hook panel at the middle of your crotch and you must really be committed to showing off a more slender you.  Personally, I am not a fan of crotch panels.Please note that this is a well constructed garment and I would recommend it to those who are not plus size to go one size higher and enjoy its benefits.  For us plus sized girls, perhaps Maidenform will decide to add additional sizes?

Wonderful blending of Spearmint and Peppermint along with a few other ingredients, this version has become one of my all time favorite teas.I typically have 40 different tea varieties in my home at any given time, I consider myself a connoisseur.  I often mix teas to come up with new taste options but the Moroccan Mint is better than my mixing of Traditional Medicinals Peppermint and Spearmint in my teapot.This is a moderate delivery, of course, the longer you steep the more intense the flavor.  It is a balanced flavor since the spearmint is the first ingredient.It is perfect for after meals since the benefits to digestion are an added bonus to a great flavor combination.  I like the pleasant mint after taste which lasts for several minutes.  This is definitely something you want to try if you enjoy mint tea.

I used to live next to a cider mill, while this is tea, it is a delightful taste experience.  The hint of cinnamon really entertains the palette.  If you like apples, this is a great tea option especially during the cooler months when hot tea is preferred.I even drink this in the summer iced and enjoy it as well.  This is a tea worthy of trying.

Ms. Jennifer Allee has done an outstanding job of presenting a family drama with a heart.  Monica will do just about anything to reconnect with her long lost daughter even when it means bodily harm and humiliation in front of millions.  Unfortunately, sparking a connection with Jess is as hard as creating fire without flint.  Allee does an outstanding job of keeping the reader wondering how Monica is going to win Jessica over after 20 years apart.We ride a roller coaster of emotions as Monica is given the opportunity to meet her estranged daughter on a show much like the popular reality show "Survivor".  Monica's initial reticence gives way to the hope of love conquering all; though once on the island she realizes that her daughter is all about the money.  What Monica doesn't expect is the rekindling of her long lost love with Jessica's father, Duncan when he unexpectedly shows up, and she is equally perplexed by the fact that the host makes his own play for her affections.  What a chaotic stew this chef finds herself in the midst of!  The reader can't help but want her to finally find her happiness because she has been denied for so many years.  As she considers her own self rejection and unconscious rejection of others, forgiveness becomes an option.  On the other hand, the reader can empathize with Jess, after all, she had a happy childhood with parents that didn't give her away...I loved reading this story, the author skillfully takes us for a 30 day adventure on a tropical island and makes the days fly by.  This is one of those stories that you don't want to end.  At times it is predictable but it has its surprises too.  It never dragged.  This is definitely a book to add to your pile, so what are you waiting for?  Put it in your cart already, before Amazon sells out!  Might want to pick up some extras to give to your friends in your book club, too?Note to the readers of my review, I do not profit in any way from writing this review.  I have had several close friends over the years deal issues relating to their birth mothers and some of the feelings they expressed are much like those exhibited by Jessica's character.  I liked the fact that this was a Christian book that wasn't in the least preachy.  It offers the matter of adoption instead of abortion as a loving choice made by a lovely young woman.  Its message was positive and inviting that would appeal to all ages and both genders.  I think this would make a nice addition to a church library as well since it is accessible to young readers 13 and up, just like the show Survivor appeals to all ages.It truly earned it's five star rating, if I could give it more stars I would.

These pads offer excellent area coverage.  They are very absorbent and I was surprised at the level of competence, when needed they delivered beyond what I would expect from most brands with the exception of perhaps "Always"!No complaints that the typical user might have.  The backing is plastic which isn't exactly healthy but of course, there is no skin contact.  My research is limited but I have read that popular brands are treated with a lot of chemicals, I am not sure that these pads are not treated because all we know is that the cotton is organic.I would buy these again, although I do think the price is high for the quantity sold.

Walter Shaw worked for the phone company.  When the lineman was discovered to have some talent, he was promoted to engineering and got his degree.  The Bell system was so corrupt that it was able to stop him from getting any credit or financial reward for his incredible genius.  Many of the services we have taken for granted where actually created decades earlier by Mr. Shaw.  He became frustrated that he couldn't get recognition, he decided to go off on his own.  If you remember what happened to Tucker with the automotive industry then you can quickly see where this story heads.Word gets out about Shaw's brilliance, the mob keeps getting caught running numbers because their phones are tapped by the FBI.  Walter comes to their rescue inventing call-forwarding which makes the call untraceable at that time.Eventually, the Bell system prosecutes Shaw for using their phone line to test an invention,  Walter goes to prison for several years.  In the end, Bell continues to haunt his life in an attempt at thwarting his every creation.  He died a pauper.This excellent documentary highlights the key events of the telephone's history starting after World War II to the late 1990's after deregulation.  It is another revelation on the power of corporatism against the lone individual.  This is a documentary not to be missed.

Ms. Bailat-Jones is a gifted story teller.  Her writing is vivid and flowing.  Her protagonist's voice gives us insights into the culture of Japan and into the human spirit.Unlike many synopsis that publisher's offer to whet your appetite for a book that doesn't truly reflect the book's drama, this was by far the most accurate I've read, unfortunately it offers too many spoilers in my opinion.What I did love about this story is Alec's abiding love for his wife despite all the disappointing ways she neglects him.  You feel his anger and his bountiful forgiveness as though you are experiencing it as well.  Likewise, it is her deep despair at their impending parting that drives her to act in ways that are totally out of her character and her own expectations of herself. The role of storyteller, Azami adds balance to the emotional pull of the couple.I would recommend this to those who like drama genre.  This tale is a bittersweet journey juxtaposed against a typhoon that pounds the island.

Being a child of depression era parents, I have reused plastic bags for years, my favorite is Ziploc Freezer bags in their various sizes.  These bags are as good or better than Ziploc Freezer bags for reuse in several ways.The seal is super tight keeping air out that means the item remains fresh like it was when placed in the bag!  You get a much tighter seal than any Brand Name plastic bag.  When lunch time rolls around your sandwich that tastes like it was just made!  I buy special bread without preservatives and it drys out just sitting out after 30 minutes, but this keeps it fresh for more than a week, which is pretty exceptional.These are also thicker than anything currently on the market,  (I doubt Ziploc wants me reusing their bags but I find their brand is currently the thickest).  The downside is that its shape and thickness makes it a little more of a challenge to remove all air.  Also, it isn't as long as most freezer or storage quart size bags.  Thus, I have deducted one star.These are easy to clean with a soapy sponge.  Then just hang them upside down over a cup or plastic bottle to air dry or towel dry.  They are ready for the next day.A heads up on their appearance, the bags are not clear as shown, the plastic is opaque but you can still see what is inside.I recommend these for anyone looking to save the environment (every effort makes a difference) and a few bucks.  The downside is that these are a challenge to open and I have carpal tunnel and arthritis and it was a challenge to get open but I find that to be true with most bags be it potato chips or Ziploc.

I know this is a prequel novella and just an intro and not the full story of Fiona and Greg but honestly, after reading this, I think Greg and Fiona are my favorite book couple ever.  I am totally, 100% in love with Greg.  I feel like I want to go back and re-read all the Knitting in the City books and every single mention of Greg because I need more.  He is so perfect.  I really don't like the term swoon-worthy but I don't know how else to describe the feelings I get from Greg.  I love all the witty banter between these two, the debating and the arguments, the way they each hold their own values and opinions.  The chemistry between this couple is the best I have ever read - and I can't wait to get more of them!  I don't think I have ever been more excited for a book than I am for Happily Ever Ninja after reading this novella.

4.5 starsWow! This book had me on the edge of my seat trying to solve the mystery of who really killed Cassandra and if Beau was ever going to get out of prison. There were twists and turns I didn't see coming. I couldn't put this book down once I started - it was fast-paced and intriguing. I loved all the characters - especially Leo and Cora and I can't wait for the next book in this series. I really loved this fast-paced and suspenseful book! I have only one minor complaint but that's more of a personal preference. I can't wait to read more by this author!

This was such a good story!  When Calla's tuition check bounces, she's forced to return home to visit her estranged mother, the same mother who wiped out her bank account.  When she gets there, she finds out that her drug addict mom is actually on the run from a drug dealer she owes a bunch of money to.  With nowhere else to go for the summer because of a lack of money, she decides to stay in town and work at her moms bar.  Jax is the first person Calla meets when she enters the bar and they hit it off right away.  Jax wants Calla and doesn't seem to care that she has a scar running down the side of her face.  When the drug dealers that Calla's mom owes money to come looking for her, Calla is caught in their sights.This was really suspenseful and I honestly hated Calla's mom - no matter what she went through in the past she was an awful mother.  I loved Jax and how he brought out the best in Calla, showing her that she was beautiful and her scars do not define who she is.  He was incredibly sexy and so sweet with her.  Calla was a great heroine.  She has had a really rough life but she is strong and driven.  I loved the build up between Jax and Calla - even if it drove me crazy at times.  Although this is a 5 star book for me, there was something that bothered me but it was a minor complaint so I'm sticking with 5 stars on this one and adding it to my favorites list.  I can't wait to read more in this series!

Julia is a high school math teacher and during holiday break, she takes a vacation by herself to Brazil. She recently got out of an 8 year relationship with a safe guy and there is a lot in life she hasn't experienced. When she checks into her hostel, she meets Blake. Blake is on a extended vacation from Australia where he is a writer for a television show. He caught his girlfriend cheating on him with his best friend and they happen to be the actors for his hit tv show. He needed to get away and plans on being free and enjoying his trip. He didn't plan to meet Julia and find a connection with her but as much as he pushes his feelings away, he can't fight what is meant to be.I really enjoyed this story. Blake and Julia had really hot chemistry which provided some super steamy scenes in this book. I only have a few tiny complaints but overall I really enjoyed this book and look forward to reading more by this author in the future.

Chloe and Cage have been having sex for the last 2 years. Anytime Cage is in town, they hookup. When they are apart, Cage can't keep Chloe out of his mind and he wants more from her - a commitment and relationship. Chloe doesn't do relationships. She saw how much her mom was hurt and never wants to put herself in that position. Even if she loves her hookups with Cage - she isn't ready to give in to the one thing he wants from her - romance.This was a short, sweet and sexy story! There was a lot of sexy scenes in this short book and they were pretty hot. Chloe got on my nerves a bit with her pushing away and I wasn't a fan of Cage's request that Chloe commit to him when he wouldn't commit on a place to live. Overall, I did enjoy this book and recommend it to anyone looking for a short and super sexy story!

Cherry and Taylor were high school sweethearts until Taylor enlisted in the army without telling Cherry and left her. Now Taylor is back in town and he's the new sheriff. When Cherry's apartment catches on fire things go from bad to worse when she gets a call right after letting her know her cousin and her husband died in a car accident leaving her their son, Sam. With a family that doesn't think Cherry is capable of raising Sam, her family promises to fight for custody and Taylor steps in faking an engagement with Cherry to give her more stability. Little does Taylor know, the little boy that he is helping Cherry protect is actually his son - he got Cherry pregnant before he left town and she gave the baby up for adoption to her cousin.There was so much drama in this story. Cherry has an awful family who seem to be more concerned with saying hurtful things to her than finding a way to help Sam through the death of his parents. I enjoyed this story, I liked the second-chance romance between Taylor and Cherry although I think Taylor should have had to grovel a little more for walking away from Cherry all those years ago. Overall, I did enjoy this emotional story and look forward to reading more by this author in the future.

Ethan has wanted Allie since the moment he saw her. She's turned him down repeatedly but when Allie's apartment catches on fire and her and her sister have nowhere else to go, she asks Ethan for help. Ethan is glad to help Allie and has her move into his home. He knows that they have some serious chemistry, if only Allie would give in. The shelter Allie runs is in danger of closing and Ethan volunteers to help her save it, but Ethan doesn't realize the very shelter she needs to save is the very business deal he's trying to win. Ethan has to decide what's more important - what he feels for Allie or a big business deal.I really loved this sweet romance! Allie and Ethan had great chemistry. Allie is such a great heroine - she has such a great heart and takes care of everyone. Sadly, she's been let down so many times that it takes a lot for Ethan to gain her trust. There were a lot of really sweet moments in this one and I really liked this couple. My only tiny complaint is that I would've liked more steam - there was only a couple steamy moments and with the chemistry these two had, I would've liked a little more. Overall, this was a really sweet story and I can't wait to read more by this author in the future.

When Gen's young co-worker dies from chocking on a mint, she decides that life is short and she wants to complete her bucket list from when she was 15. Gen is blind and has lived under the constant protection of her brother and parents- never letting her live an independent life. When at her regular Thursday night bar, she decides to check off #1 on her list - Kiss a stranger. Gen kisses a guy at the bar but it turns out it isn't a stranger - it's her brother's best friend who she has been in love with since she knew "what went where". Chance made a mistake 10 years ago that almost got Gen killed and he's been forced to stay away from her but with one kiss, he knows he'll do anything for her - including helping her complete her bucket list.I really liked this book. I really liked the heroine, Gen. She was blind but she wasn't afraid to live life. She was strong and intelligent. Chance was her perfect match - somebody who let her live her life and had faith in her. He never treated her like she was disabled. I loved this couple! My only complaint is that I really wish this book would've had an epilogue.

This was such a sweet book! Told in 7 different POV's, each character has a connected story. I did not read the first book in this series but I read the second (and loved it) but I did not feel lost at all while reading this - it can totally be read as a standalone. Still, I would suggest What I really enjoyed about this book was that it wasn't something filled with a bunch of silly drama or couples breaking up. Most of the couples were already established but had things pop up in their relationships that they have to work through, I loved that this wasn't angsty, just a cute, sweet romance. I loved all the couples in this book and I loved the epilogue. I think the characters all getting their own POV made this a really fast-paced book. I really enjoyed this book and can't wait to read more by this author!

Tessa fakes having a boyfriend when she goes home to visit her family. She figures if they think she's in a relationship, they won't pressure her to leave New York and move home to her small town of Cutter Creek. While camping with her family, she meets Logan. Logan is in Cutter Creek to start a new life after losing his business. He's looking forward to small town living and is happy to have left the city. Logan and Tessa start off on the wrong foot but the chemistry between them pulls them together. The problem is Tessa can't wait to go back to the city and leave her small town behind but Logan loves the small town and doesn't want to leave.This was such a fun and light story! There was a lot of humor that had me laughing out loud. I loved the initial meeting between Tessa and Logan. They had instant chemistry from the start. Logan was so sweet - great book boyfriend material. I really enjoyed this book and recommend it to anyone who is looking for a fun, sweet romance!

I LOVED this story! Seth just got out of prison after being locked away for a year. He was trying to protect his sister but was charged with assault and put in jail. When he gets out, he has to complete community service. Avery's dad is running for mayor and has a zero tolerance policy he is running on so when his own daughter gets caught trashing her cheating boyfriends truck, he wants her to be punished to show the voters he means what he says about zero tolerance. Avery has to complete 300 hours of community service picking up trash on the side of the road. Avery and Seth have a really fun first meeting - and it's not at the community service they are going to be completing together.There was so much I loved about this book. It was steamy, sweet, had some good banter and I loved the characters. These two had amazing chemistry from the first time they meet and I loved their relationship development. My only complaint about this was that I didn't like the little drama at the end and I really wanted an epilogue. I'm so excited to see Ryan's book is next - I'm hoping we get a little more Avery and Seth in his book! I really loved this book and I can't wait to read more by this author!

I LOVED this book! What made this book so special to me was the hero, Caleb. 18 months ago, Calebs wife of 2 months walked away from their marriage without even saying goodbye. What does Caleb do? He spends those 18 months searching for his wife and during that time he stays completely faithful to her, even though he has no idea why she left. When he finally finds his wife, Snow, he does everything he can to win her back. He fights for his wife and convinces her to give their marriage a chance. Caleb was willing to do whatever he had to do to prove to Snow that their marriage was worth saving. Caleb made this book a 5 star read and was the ultimate book boyfriend! I highly recommend this book to anyone who loves a totally swoon-worthy hero that you just can't help but fall in love with!

9 years ago, Tawny had a one night stand with Lucky. The next day he left town and made it big in the rodeo circuit. Lucky didn't know that his one night stand resulted in a daughter. Lucky's daughter has leukemia and needs Lucky for a stem-cell transplant. When Lucky finds out about his daughter, he loves her and becomes an amazing father. Tawny has been in love with Lucky forever and now that he's back in town and a part of her and her daughters life, she has to watch him love another woman.This book had so many things that I normally hate in a romance novel but Stacy Finz has this amazing way of telling a story that I just couldn't help but really enjoy this one! Sure, I felt like my heart was ripped out a time or two and at times I just wanted to punch Lucky in the face. I loved catching up with the characters from the previous books in this series and I can't wait for the next book!

Holly is a hard working single mom. She devotes her life to her son and hasn't had much time for herself. Dating, men and relationships are the furthest thing from her mind. She notices her co-worker Ray, how could she not with his handsome good looks, beautiful brown eyes and sweet personality, but she is overwhelmed with the long hours she works and just trying to get by. When Ray suggests they go in together on a lottery ticket, Holly is hesitant but agrees. When they hit the jackpot, neither of them are prepared for how much their life changes.I really loved this book! Ray is the sweetest guy! This was so much more than a story about two co-workers winning the lottery. Holly's life is complicated. Her ex is a controlling jerk and she had the strength to leave him but he still has control over her. Ray is dealing with the recent loss of his mom and trying to fulfill the promise he made to her before she died. I enjoyed the amount of steamy scenes in this book, especially for how short this story was. My only complaint is that I wish there would've been some Ray and Drew scenes (Holly's son.) I hope that maybe this author will turn this into a series - I would love to read Ray's brothers story!

This is one of the best books I have read this year.  I honestly couldn't put this down. This book evoked so many emotions in me from sadness, anger, hatred, despair, love and happiness. This book had me laughing when I least expected it and it had me crying like a baby. This is a book that I physically threw across the room at one point and ended up hugging it and crying at the end. Any book that can make me so invested in the characters that my husband has to remind me several times, "Babe, you know this isn't real, right?? It's just a book." deserves 5 stars. I can't go into specifics without spoiling the book but I will say that I loved each and every character in this story. There were times they made me mad or frustrated me but they were fantastic, complex, beautiful characters. This is one of those books that will stay with me forever. This is going on my favorites list and is a top book of 2015.

This is such a sweet romance! Savannah comes back to her hometown after the death of her mother. She plans to take over her family legacy and run the Bed and Breakfast. She doesn't know that the B&B is actually in financial distress and Logan Park is working for a company to help take over the B&B. Logan was the best friend of her deceased boyfriend, Will. Savannah has always had feelings for Logan but didn't know he felt the same for her. After Will died, she spent time with Logan and they got closer but then he left without a goodbye. Now that he's back and Savannah is in town, they find out some feelings never go away.I really enjoyed this super sweet romance. I wasn't sure how I felt about Logan at first but really loved him by the end of the story. I loved the epilogue for this story - it left me with a huge smile on my face. I highly recommend this one to anyone who loves a sweet romance!

When Rochelle signs up for a dating show so she can raise some money for her domestic violence charity, the last person she expects to see is her ex-boyfriend and love of her life Grant Drake. Grant has been chosen to be the bachelor and Rochelle is supposed to be competing to win his love. 10 years ago Grant broke Rochelle's heart so she will do anything to get herself kicked off the show. All the antics Rochelle comes up with, just show Grant that Rochelle is still the girl he fell in love with years ago.This was such a fun and light story. There were quite a few laugh out loud moments. I really enjoyed this one and look forward to reading more by this author in the future!

Angelique is returning to work after beating breast cancer. While she was battling the disease, she catches her fiance and co-worker having sex with her secretary in her office. Her law firm gives her a case that should be an easy win for her to get her back to work and get her out of the office. They send her to Red River and if she wins the case, she could be destroying the whole town. Blake is Red Rivers town doctor. He's hired a lawyer to go up against Angelique to save his town. The more time Angelique spends in Red River, the more she gets to know the people and she has to really decide if she should take a chance and go with her heart, or should she put her career first.I'm going to start with my small complaints about this book first - it was a little slow at times and Angelique did drive me a bit crazy with her focus on her career. Other than those two small complaints, this book was really good. Angelique is such a strong woman - to overcome cancer, her fiance cheating on her, and her recovery. She struggled with her body image after having lost so much and having a mastectomy and reconstructive surgery. Even though the subject matter was a little depressing, this author did a really great job of incorporating humor into this story. The panty-stealing dog was hilarious. Also, this book had some really hot sexy scenes. I loved Blake - he was such a great hero. This was a really good story and I look forward to reading more in this series and more by this author!

After Georgia's mom dies - she creates a list of ways to be brave. There are things she's always been afraid to do but decides it's time to start taking some chances. When her list leads her into situations she wasn't expecting, Georgia finds out how strong she is and how brave she really is.This was such an emotional YA story. There are so many issues addressed in this book from bullying, suicide, death and drugs. I knew this was an emotional book going into it, just from reading the description but I was really surprised by the way this author was able to address these issues and how real this book felt. Personally, I related to this book because when my own mom died, I had a hard time and didn't feel like myself for at least a year afterwards- it was the worst time of my life. I made some poor decisions, I struggled with who I was and I was an adult. For Georgie, loosing her mom as a teen, I wasn't surprised by some of the choices she made and the situations she put herself in. My heart hurt for her and I really just wanted to give her a hug. I loved the way this author brought this all together at the end. I really enjoyed this book and I recommend it to anyone who loves YA.

Natalie is living life in fear. She's a writer who has an anonymous stalker. She's been receiving threatening notes and lives in fear of leaving her house. She doesn't let anyone in and she never goes out. Her cousin, Logan, hires a security company to look into the threats Natalie is receiving. Jake owns the security firm Logan hires. He's a veteran who was injured in the line of duty. When he meets Natalie, he feels something for her that he's never felt before and he'll do anything he can to protect her.This is the first book I have read in this series and I absolutely loved it! Jake was so swoon-worthy. He was so patient and kind with Natalie, doing everything he could to keep her safe. The sexy scenes in this book were really hot. I loved the chemistry between these two characters. There was a lot of suspense in this story - who was threatening Natalie and why?? I really loved this book and can't wait to read more by this author!

A decade ago in college Lilliana lost her virginity to the big shot quarterback. She has spent years hating him because of how he treated her afterwards and to make matters worse, he doesn't even remember her. Alec has been back in Falcon ever since suffering a career ending injury and being betrayed by the people he trusted the most. He's hard and doesn't let people in but there's something about Lilliana that won't let him stay away.I loved this book. Alec is the towns building inspector and Lilliana is rehabbing her historic family home so she has to spend a little time with Alec when he comes for an inspection. What happens when he shows up and she's not expecting him is one of my favorite scenes in the book. I loved the chemistry with this couple. My only small complaint is that I wish this one would've had an epilogue more into the future but only because I wanted just a little more of this couple. I loved this series!

I've re-read this book more than ten times and it's just as good as the first time I read it.  This is one of my all-time favorites because it has everything I love in a good book - it has a sexy, sensitive, rock star hero, a funny heroine, lots of great supporting characters, a little angst and drama, and a lot of hot sexy time.  This book will forever be one of my favorites(my signed paperback of this book is one of my very favorite possessions) and I can't recommend this book (and this entire series) enough.  The audiobook is also so good with great narration. Fantastic!

I LOVED this book!  This book had two things that I normally hate in romance novels - #1. a second chance romance with a long separation  #2. flash back scenes.  Normally, those two things would ruin a book for me but the way this was written was brilliant.  This might be my favorite Kristen Ashley book ever.  I cried, I laughed, I swooned.  I hated Logan/High and then I fell in love with Logan.  Millie was fantastic, she gave up everything for the man she loved.  I wouldn't have made the same choices but it was easy to understand why she did what she did.  There was so much going on in this story -there was angst, drama, suspense, humor and amazingly hot sexy scenes.  This was just so good, I already want to go back and do a re-read.  This was my favorite of all the Chaos books and I highly recommend it - even if you don't like MC books - this is a great story!

When Bella's sister and her husband die in a car crash, they leave behind two little boys that are going to need someone to take care of them.  Bella always promised her sister that she would  take care of her nephews but Noah also promised his best friend that if anything happened to him or his wife, he would take care of their boys.  This puts Noah and Bella in a position where they have to co-parent two little boys  who just lost their parents.  Noah and Bella haven't gotten along when they've been around each other in the past but when they start receiving letters, everything changes..This was a super emotional story that was really well written. I liked both Bella and Noah but my favorite thing about this story was the letters.  There were parts of this book that made me cry but there was also a lot of love in this story.  I had a few tiny complaints  but they are mostly just my own personal preferences.  This was a really sweet, emotional romance and I can't wait to read more by this author.

This was a short and sexy novella. Holly is staying with her brother at the beach while he recovers from a car accident. Zack is on leave from the military to attend a funeral. They meet and have instant chemistry which leads to sexy times. I did enjoy this story. Zack and Holly were hot together. There was a little drama and mystery but I did have a hard time connecting to these characters, maybe because of the length of the story, the fast pace or how much was packed into this short story.

Holly and Roth are best friends. They live across the hall from each other, play video games together and are so close they finish each others sentences. Both Holly and Roth don't want commitment. Neither of them want to settle down with marriage and family but they are constantly being set up by well-meaning family members and friends finding their perfect match. Because they are tired of the set-ups, they agree to an arrangement. Holly and Roth will each be each others plus one for events - in a pretend relationship. What starts out as friends helping each other quickly turns into a friends with benefits plus more situation.There were a couple things I really liked about this book. Holly's family was funny and good supporting characters. This book had some good steamy scenes. Holly and Roth had a really sweet friendship. The things I didn't like about the book are minor issues like I thought the characters seemed immature at times and I really got angry at Roth at one point but overall I really enjoyed this story and look forward to reading more by this author.

This is the first book I have read in the Legal Affairs series and even though this is a standalone, after reading this, I want to spend the whole weekend reading the whole series because I loved this one so much. This book was fantastic! The heroine, Leary, was a kick-ass female. She was tough, smart, kind and knew how to work her charms. Reeve was the ultimate match for Leary. He could hold his own with her and when these two got together it was smoking HOT. I even loved the law aspect of this one, the case they were arguing was really interesting. This book was fast-paced and I couldn't put it down once I started. I loved this book and I can't wait to read the other books in this series!

Damian is an undercover agent for the US Marshals. While undercover, he shows up at a hotel managed by Tabitha, while trying to take down a drug ring. Tabitha is use to being attracted to bad boys but prefers bad boys with more of a conscience, unlike her ex-boyfriend who runs a drug ring and is forcing her to do things for him to keep her brother safe. Tabitha doesn't know Damian is really an undercover agent named Parker and Damian doesn't know that Tabitha is in a dangerous situation.I loved this book! One of my favorite things about a good romance is the chemistry between the main characters and I loved Parker and Tabitha's chemistry. The attraction between them was so strong. Parker is a bad ass but he was such a sweet guy. The suspense was fantastic and I really felt like this book mastered romantic suspense - there was enough of both romance and suspense that I couldn't put this book down. I have read all the books in the US Marshals series but I think this was my favorite because of how much I loved the hero Damian/Parker. This can be read as a standalone but I have really enjoyed all the books in this series so I suggest if you like this one, to read the others in this series as well. This author does a great job of writing interesting characters with great chemistry and suspense that will keep you turning the pages. Highly recommend this one!

Anna is the new librarian in town.  She's quiet and conservative, she dresses like a grandma and doesn't want attention.  Cowboy is a sexy fireman, he can get any woman he wants and when the quiet librarian doesn't return his advances, she catches his interest.I am really torn on my review of this book.  I really loved this authors first book but this one missed the mark a little for me.  I liked the mystery and suspense in this story.  There were some twists and turns I didn't see coming.  I liked the witty one-liners and banter with some of the supporting characters.  I also really liked that we get to catch up a little with Jake and Emily from Rules of Protection - even though this was a standalone, it was nice to catch up with some of the characters from the previous book..  The issues I had with this book had more to do with the relationship between Cowboy and Anna. I really struggled with their relationship and it made the book slow for me, even with the suspense.  While I did have issues with this book, I think many others will like it and enjoy this story.  Even thought this book wasn't a favorite for me, I look forward to reading more by this author in the future.

Cassidy Jones is female cop in a male dominated job. She's constantly trying to prove herself because she's one of two female cops on the force and not a member of the good ol' boys club. When a local mobster ends up murdered, Cassidy is chosen to go undercover at his strip club to find the killer and get herself a promotion.There were a couple things I really liked about this book. The heroine, Cassidy, was absolutely hilarious. I loved her inner monologue. She's tough but also doesn't take herself too seriously. She's good at her job and doesn't take any crap from the guys at work. I also really liked the suspense. There were a few twists and turns I didn't see coming. This was a fast-paced book that was full of suspense and mystery. There were a few minor things that I didn't like about this book, in particular I felt the romance was really lacking, not just because there were no steamy scenes but also because there was so much focus on the crime aspect, I didn't really feel a romantic connection. I really look forward to reading more in this series and seeing what's going to happen next with Cassidy Jones.

I LOVED this book!  Roxie is a chef to the stars in LA.  After making a big mistake involving butter, her uptight client fires her and takes all her referrals with her.  Her mom asks Roxie to come take over the family diner while she goes on a reality show.  Roxie doesn't want to go back to her small hometown but agrees to take over the diner for the summer.  When sexy, sweet and handsome farmer Leo stops by the diner to deliver some nuts, they have instant chemistry.  Roxie doesn't do love and she's only there for the summer but Leo catches her attention and maybe can make Roxie change her mind about her hometown.This book had everything that I love about an Alice Clayton book!  It was hilarious, laugh-out-loud funny.  My face hurt after reading this because I smiled so much.  The chemistry between these characters was perfect!  From the first time they meet, I couldn't wait to see how things were going to progress between them.  Also, the sexy scenes in this book were HOT!  Super hot!  The supporting characters were fantastic (like The Chad Bowman.)  I loved everything about this book and wished I could've slowed down my reading because I didn't want it to end.  I absolutely adored this book and I highly recommend it to anyone who loves a funny romance!

I LOVED this!  Sweet, sexy and incredibly funny - this book had everything.  I am in love with Jake Becker!  There is nothing hotter than a guy who is good with kids and I loved Jake's interactions with Chelsea's nieces and nephews.  This was laugh-out-loud funny but also had a few sad and serious moments but overall this was just a really fun story!  The audio version of this was also really good!  Highly recommend!

I really liked this book!  At first, I wasn't really a big fan of Blake.  He seemed like an ass and he wasn't very nice to Hadley but he ended up being one of those jerks you love.  This story is really suspenseful, it grabs your attention on the first page and there were twists and turns I wasn't expecting.  I really loved the connection between Blake and Hadley.  There was a lot of sexual tension but they had a very sweet romance.  Plus, the sexy scenes were super hot!  I really liked this book a lot and can't wait to read more by this author!

This was such an emotional story! Zoe is lost. Her younger brother, Wyatt, died and she's having a hard time dealing with his death. It's more like she's not dealing with his death and is masking her pain. When her friend Zach (Spock) shows up at Wyatt's funeral, he is the only person that can help her through her grief.I really enjoyed this book. There were a few tears, a few laughs, a good amount of steam, a little angst and a lot of friendship. At first, I wasn't sure how I felt about Zoe but as the book went on, I really felt she was a brilliant character. Everything from the issues she was dealing with, her guilt over her brothers death and the way she was hiding herself made her a really complex character. I felt like she was a really strong heroine, even if it didn't seem like it at times. Zach was amazing and he was the perfect match for Zoe. Maybe it's just my own personal preference but I really appreciated that the way this author handled the separation between these characters. Overall, I really enjoyed this book and I hope maybe this series will continue - I'd love to read Delores's story!

I LOVED this book! Wesley Holt is a former marine who suffers from PTSD. He was married to his high school sweetheart who cheated on him and left him while he was at war. He doesn't want to take a risk on love again so he keeps to himself. Wes goes to the local diner every morning to see his secret crush and favorite waitress, Carlie. Carlie is a single mom who moved to town 2 years ago. Carlie has secrets, she was in an abusive marriage and did things in her past that she's not proud of. When her past catches up with her and her ex-husband comes to town trying to steal their son, Wes will do everything he can to protect Carlie.There is so much I loved about this book. Wes was the perfect hero - he's such a good guy. He's been hurt and is afraid to fall in love again. He's never done casual relationships, he's protective and he's really good with Carlie's son Tyler. I absolutely loved the connection between Wes and Tyler from the first moment they meet and that was the exact moment I fell in love with Wes. Carlie was a fantastic heroine - she's been through so much in her life but she never feels sorry for herself. She just wants to keep her son safe. I loved Carlie and Wes together and the chemistry between them. This was such a sweet romance but still had a little suspense and action. This is the first book I have read by this author but I can't wait to read more!

I absolutely LOVED this book!  Grace and Merrick have both been through so much and are fantastic characters.  I loved the build-up in this book!  I was hooked from the first page and didn't want this book to end.  There were moments that made me cry, a few laughs and lots of swooning.  Grace and Merrick are dealing with different kinds of grief, they are each damaged in different ways but are able to find comfort in each other.  I loved this book - it's a top pick of 2015 for me and has one of my favorite epilogues ever!  Highly recommend!

This was a fast-paced story, starting from the first page. Undercover cop Jake escapes from prison to try to clear his name. Lucy happens to be in the wrong place at the wrong time and get's pulled into Jake's problems. What starts out as a kidnapping, turns into more between Jake and Lucy. I really liked the romance between Jake and Lucy - Jake was a good guy even though he had to do some things he didn't want to. I also really liked the suspense in this story. Although I didn't feel like there was a lot of mystery, there was a lot of action. There were a few things I didn't like about this book but overall, I did enjoy this book and look forward to reading more by this author.

4.5 starsMason isn't good in social situations. He doesn't know how to talk to people and at times, he can be quite blunt. Camilla gets a job working for Mason so she can pay off her law school student loans. On her first day, Mason is attracted to his new employee and let's her know by bluntly asking her to have sex with him. Camilla really has her work cut out for her if she's going to teach Mason social skills.I really enjoyed this book. Mason displays a lot of the characteristics of Asperger's syndrome with his high intelligence and difficulty with social skills. He has a hard time with communicating how he feels but it's obvious he feels something for Camilla. I think this author did a good job writing Mason and his difficulty expressing himself properly. My only complaint about this book is that I thought Camilla was a little too hard on Mason at times and I didn't like a certain decision she made towards the end of the book. Plus, I would have liked a little more time with them as a couple and I really wanted an epilogue. This romance in this book was very sweet and there were quite a few sexy scenes. Overall, I really enjoyed this book and highly recommend it to anyone who likes a unique hero.

Logan had a near death experience and thinks about the one moment in his life that he would love to get a second chance. 11 years ago, he had a one-night stand before he went to prison for a year. He thought about Abby for a year while in prison to help him get through his time, she was his fantasy girl. He decides to look her up and he shows up at her door. When Abby was 18, she had one wild night of unprotected sex with Logan that resulted in a pregnancy he knows nothing about. She came looking for him when she found out she was pregnant but he was in jail. She never expects him to show up on her doorstep 11 years later.There were some parts of this book that I enjoyed - it was really steamy and I absolutely adored Logan's interactions with his daughter. There were also a few things I didn't like but overall, I thought this was a light, sexy story. Looking forward to reading more by this author.

I really enjoyed this book! Melody is in a rough place in her life -she's just been demoted at work and has no money to pay her rent. She's questioning if she should stay in the city or give up and move home. When she gets locked out of her apartment and has nowhere to go, her neighbor Aaron lets her in even though they didn't have the best first meeting. Aaron is a country music singer trying to get his career back on track after going wild. Melody is the perfect person to help rehab his image.This was a really fun and light story. Aaron and Melody were great together. I really liked both of these characters! There were also some really good steamy scenes in this one. I really enjoyed this story and would recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and sexy story.

This is the first book I have ever read where the heroine is a grandma. Beth and Clint are both in their late forties and have been dancing around each other for a while. I wish I would've read more books in this series because I did feel a little lost at the beginning and I thought it started out a little slow but once this story got going - there was suspense and drama with some pretty hot sexy scenes. Beth wasn't my favorite heroine but I adored Clint. Overall, I really enjoyed this story and will probably go back and read more books in this series.

Lena is a single mom on vacation for her brother's wedding. While she's at the pool, she meets the very handsome and rich Elliot. Elliot is Lena's soon-to-be sister-in-law's brother. Elliot is kind of a playboy but he's tired of that lifestyle. He wants to do something with his life and to have a purpose. He has no idea that just by meeting Lena and her son Tyler, he'll find the purpose he was looking for.I really enjoyed this fun and light read. Elliot was adorable with Tyler and I loved the time they spent together. There were also a couple steamy scenes and a few laughs. This is the perfect story if you're looking for a good single parent romance!

Mia has had a crush on her brother Blake's best friend Drew for years. About a year ago, Drew betrayed Blake and there were devastating consequences. When Drew finally returns to school, he's scared and not the same boy he was before. He has no friends and no confidence. Mia still sees the same boy she has crushed on for years and when they are assigned to the same class project and have to spend time together, they rekindle a friendship. They shouldn't be together but they can't fight the feelings they have for each other.I enjoyed this book but it was a lot more depressing and sad than I was expecting. My feelings were kind of torn on Drew at first but my heart just broke for him. I can't imagine having to live with the kind of guilt that he carried. Mia was a good heroine, she had a good heart and was very sweet. There were a few small things that bothered me about this story but overall I really enjoyed it and look forward to reading more by this author.

This was so good!  The conclusion to Sebastian and Shae's story was beautiful!  There was so much in both of their pasts that they needed to overcome to get to their HEA.  I felt so many emotions when reading this - anger, frustration, sadness but most importantly, love and happiness.  Shae and Sebastian may be one of my favorite book couples ever.  The writing was captivating and I didn't want this book to end.  I can't wait to read more books in this series - especially Austin's story.  This was a fantastic book and I highly recommend it!

A couple of months ago, this beautiful book showed up in my bookworm box. I have never read anything by this author before but have had a couple of her books on my TBR. I wasn't sure I was going to like this book because I'm normally not a fan of rock star books but I absolutely LOVED this book! It's so hard to leave a review for this and say all the reasons I loved it because they are spoilers but I will say that I loved Sebastian, I loved Shea and I loved the supporting characters. I'm so glad I waited to read this until the 2nd book came out because this is a massive cliffhanger and I can't wait to see what's going to happen next! Fantastic!!!

Loved this book! I think this might be my favorite Lauren Layne book yet! I loved the heroine, Penelope. Pen is a tom-boy, she knows sports better than most men. She is funny and sweet. Cole was a great hero. I loved the banter between them and the amazing chemistry they had. They could've been enemies fighting for the same job but instead they became friends. This book made me laugh out loud with some of the witty and hilarious dialogue - not just between Cole and Pen but also the supporting characters. There was so much I loved about this book and I can't wait for more of the Oxford men and in particular Lincoln's story! Highly recommend!

Darker the Release picks up right where Sweet the Sin left off. Caleb and Kelly are still keeping secrets from each other. Kelly is still keeping her identity a secret while looking for the proof of who killed her father and Caleb's involvement in the murder. Caleb is keeping secrets from Kelly, things he's afraid of her ever finding out and leaving him. The more time they spend together, the more real their feelings grow and someone is bound to get hurt when the truth comes out.I really loved this story! I am a sucker for revenge themed romances and this one totally hit the mark for me. Caleb and Kelly are both characters that are complex and I was torn about how I felt about them for most of the book. Some of the decisions they each made were questionable and at times were frustrating. I couldn't wait to see what was going to happen and where this story was going to go. The sex scenes in this book were smoking hot and so good! Caleb and Kelly had a genuine connection and were very passionate together. My only complaint is I would've liked a little more for the epilogue but I really loved this story and can't wait to read what this author writes next.

Neve starts writing letters to Rory, a soldier stationed in Afghanistan. Her letters are a little naughty and a little getting-to-know-you.
