Neve's letters help get Rory through his tour in Afghanistan and when he comes home for a ten day leave, Neve shows up to help him fulfill one of his fantasies he mentioned in his letter. After a misunderstanding that has Neve running away, Rory knows one night wasn't enough with her and wants to spend more time with his pen pal.This story was a lot more complex than I was expecting. From the description, I thought this was going to be a light and fun story but it wasn't. Rory and Neve both have complex issues they're dealing with. I was really frustrated with Neve at times and didn't understand why she made some of the decisions she did. Rory was awesome - he was really funny and sweet. I loved the letters between the two of them and how they got to know each other before seeing each other. My only problems with this book is that there was so much going on with these characters, it was overwhelming at times. Also, I didn't like the way her past played out. Overall, I really did enjoy this book, it dealt with some hard issues but it was also a really sweet romance. Looking forward to reading more by this author.

Reid owns ten auto body restoration businesses across the country. He's successful and driven. When he notices he's losing customers at his Miami location, he goes to check out their competition. Reid is not expecting his competition to be the hottest woman he's ever seen. Rusty is part owner of West Restoration. She loves working on cars. She had a really bad experience years ago with a guy and because of that, she doesn't date. Reid wants Rusty's business but he also wants a night with Rusty. Rusty doesn't want a man and she doesn't trust them anyways. She would never put herself or her business as risk for a man.I loved this story. Rusty was a kick-ass heroine. She's successful in a career that is rare for a woman - she restores cars. She's smart and tough, This book had fantastic sexual tension with the best payoff! This was super HOT and had really great steamy scenes. I really loved this one and can't wait to read the next book in this series!

Marcus Rosemann comes from money. When he opts out of joining the family business and instead starts his own advertising firm, his dad is angry and wants Marcus to fail. His dad wants Marcus to come back and join the family business and settle down with a suitable wife. What does Marcus decide to do? He wants to push his dad even further by finding the most un-suitable woman imaginable and bringing her as his date for the charity ball. To do this, he's decided to blackmail Rose into being his date.I really enjoyed this story. Rose was hilarious and a fantastic heroine! She's about to turn 30, she's funny, smart, helpful and kind. She has such a good heart and wants to save the planet and rescue animals. Between her Thursday night dates, her quick wit and her love of fun clothes, she became one of my favorite heroines. I loved the way this book starts and I loved the chemistry between Rose and Marcus from the moment they met. They had great banter and amazing sexual tension that was pretty hot. My only complaint is that I really wanted a little more Rose and Marcus as a couple. Overall, I really enjoyed this book and look forward to reading more by this author.

This. Book.  This is one of the best, most heartfelt and amazing stories I have ever read.  I am so embarrassed to say that when I first started reading this book, I actually had a hard time understanding the poverty that Kyland and Tenleigh live in.  I thought there was no way in this day and age that people actually live like that in the US.  Then I turned to google and looked up poverty in Appalachia and I cried for an hour.  I went back and read more of this book and I couldn't stop thinking of the pictures I saw.  This book has had such a huge effect on me and is something that will stay with me forever.  My heart broke for what these two characters went through.  This story is so beautifully written it was so easy to love these characters and want them to find a way to make it knowing the odds were against them.  Kyland is the ultimate book boyfriend and I absolutely adored him even when I didn't like him. This is a top pick of 2015 and going on my all-time favorites list.  I loved this book!

I really enjoyed this book.  There were some parts where I thought it was a little slow but overall I really enjoyed the story.  I really liked that this was a complete story with a fantastic epilogue and I wasn't left with unanswered questions.  For the most part, this was a light-hearted romance but the last 20% took me by surprise.  I love the way this author dealt with that particular situation and it really reinforced my love for these characters.  I really enjoyed this book and highly recommend it!

Rory Kavanagh was a legend in the MMA. He was one of the top ten fighters in the world until he had a career ending injury. He's had a hard time dealing with the end of his career and he's turned to things that are bad for him instead of dealing with what he lost. Clare is new to town. She has her own secrets and is running from something. Clare isn't looking for a relationship but she can't deny how Rory makes her feel.This book started out a little slow for me but once I got into it I really enjoyed it. I'm not a big fan of fighter books but this one was different than the other fighter books I have read. Rory is a good guy that had a tough break. Clare also has been through a lot. Rory has an amazing family and I'm so glad this is a series where we'll get more of the Kavanagh family! I love the animal rescue part of this story. There were a couple small things I didn't like about this book but the good out-weighed the bad with this and I really enjoyed it. I'm looking forward to reading more by this author and more about the Kavanagh family.

I LOVE this book! This story starts out with Liz and Landon getting engaged. To celebrate their engagement, they have sex but it's only mediocre. After being together for 4 years, Liz feels like their sex life should be a little more exciting so she forms a plan. Her and Landon will abstain for sex for the next couple months leading up to the wedding to bring the passion back to their sex life. Landon thinks there's no way Liz will be able to stick to her plan so he makes it more interesting by wagering that whoever holds out gets to pick out their honeymoon location. This was laugh-out-loud funny but also incredibly sweet. I adored this couple! Landon is one of the sweetest and most romantic book heroes ever. I love the idea behind this story and that it wasn't angsty, it was just a fun, sexy, and really hilarious read that made me laugh, smile and swoon. There are some real life issues this couple faces and I love how they faced those issues together. This was absolutely perfect and I can't wait to read the next book in this series. I highly recommend this book to anyone who loves a sweet, sexy and funny romance!

I loved this book!  I have a secret obsession with jerk heroes.  I love when the leading man in a big is a huge jerk but as the book progresses, we get to see his softer side.  Dean is the perfect example of this.  When Dean and Lily meet, Dean is a huge ass.  He is rude and arrogant.  Lily was the perfect match for him because she wasn't about to take any crap from him and totally knew how to handle him.  This book had some really funny banter and amazing chemistry between Lily and Dean.  There was also some serious sexual tension between these two!  This was a funny, light, fast-paced story that made me laugh and fall in love with Dean Harper.  Highly recommend!

Paris is taking a break from Hollywood where she is an actress on a popular soap opera. Her brother asks his best friend, Cooper, to stay with his sister for a week as her bodyguard. What starts out as strictly business, quickly turns into more.This book was super hot and there was some really great chemistry between Paris and Cooper. I'm not a huge fan of celebrity type romances but I really enjoyed the forbidden aspect of this story - a best friend's sister/boss-employee romance. I really enjoyed this story and look forward o reading more by this author.

I loved this book so much!  Tristan and Elizabeth's story is not an easy one - they've both suffered an awful loss and are trying to find a way to navigate a world without the people they loved.  They find something in each other that can help them breathe and heal.  This story is raw and emotional but mostly it was a gorgeous story about loss and love.  This book touched my heart and it's a top pick of 2015 and now one of my favorite books of all-time!  Amazing!

I LOVED this funny, sweet and romantic YA story!Paige is known as "Perfect Paige" - she gets good grades, she's fourth in her class, she is going to be a doctor like her parents want, and she plans to go the college her parents chose for her. She does everything that's asked of her. When she finds out she's failing calculus and needs help, she literally runs into Ben. Ben is super smart, he's third in their class, he works two jobs to help support himself and his single mom, and he's hoping to get scholarships for college because he can't afford to go without them. Ben is doing really well in calculus and offers to tutor Paige but in return he wants her to help him transform into the type of guy her best friend would notice. Paige's best friend Zoey is gorgeous and all the guys like her. Ben just wants her to notice him - to know that he is somebody. At least, that's what Ben thinks he wants.There was so much I LOVED about this book. The writing was fantastic, the story was fun but also interesting, the characters were awesome, and the romance was so sweet. I adored Ben and Paige. This is one of those books that I just didn't want to end. I love the way the author told this story, there's no bad guy. It's just a really sweet, fun, heart-warming romance and I can't wait to read more by this author! Fantastic!!!

Wow! This book was amazing! Lucas Titan is a billionaire. He's also a huge jerk. He wants people to think that, he doesn't care. He's hard and focused on work. Yve Santos left an abusive marriage to a rich man and swears she will never date another rich guy. She doesn't ever want to depend on someone else, she wants to be totally self-sufficient and achieve her goals on her own. Yve can't fight the chemistry she and Titan have and when she needs someone to have her back, she sees a whole new side to Lucas Titan.This book blew me away. The writing was completely captivating. From the first page, I couldn't put this book down. It's told in dual POV which I think really added to the story. I loved being inside Lucas Titan's head. Yve was a kick-ass strong heroine who fought for what she wanted and was determined to make her own way and be her own success story. I love a strong heroine and Yve Santos was a very strong heroine. Her perfect match - Lucas Titan. He was amazing. The chemistry between these two characters was some of the best I've ever read. There was a twist I didn't see coming, great suspense, fantastic characters, and incredibly hot sexy time. This is a top book of 2015 for me and also going on my all time favorites list. There was not one thing I didn't love about this book!!! Highly recommend!

This was a really sweet story about two people who are closed off and alone.  It's told almost entirely from Nathan's POV.  Nathan is kind of a loner, not letting anyone get close to him.  When he gets a new neighbor next door and smells her cooking, he strikes up conversation, gets a plate of food and they start up conversation all without even seeing each other.  I really enjoyed this story and how Nathan and Kourtney met.  There were a lot of things to like about this one, it was sweet and the second half had some really good sexy scenes.  Nathan was a good guy but had secrets.  Kourtney hasn't had an easy life and she has self-esteem issues.  She's short and curvy and was made fun of her whole life.  At times, her insecurities were frustrating and the story did drag on at times but overall I really enjoyed this book and look forward to reading more by this author.

I was a little nervous going into this book after reading about Hop in Motorcycle Man.  I was a little worried that I wouldn't like him but I'm so glad I gave him a chance because he was nothing at all like I was expecting.  I loved Hop and Lanie.  I loved how these two never gave up on each other.  This was such a sweet and super hot romance.  Loved it!

I LOVED this book.  I was a little worried going in, knowing Shy was the way Shy was but I loved him so much.  The connection between Shy and Tabby was so sweet but also really hot.  I can't wait to read more in this series!

I LOVED this book!  LOVED IT!!!  Tack and Tyra were perfect.  This book had everything I look for in a good book - it was sexy, had some humor, a little bit of drama, a super sexy alpha male, great supporting characters, action, suspense, flawless writing, great chemistry between the characters, and a story so good I could not put this book down.  I loved EVERYTHING about this book and it's going on my top favorites of all time list.  I can't believe I waited so long to read this!

Aubrey is going on a road trip to California to start a new job.  She meets Chance who helps change her tire in exchange for a ride to California.  They take a road trip together and the two of them together are hilarious.  This was laugh-out-loud funny and I loved this story.  Chance is one of my favorite book boyfriends ever.  I really enjoyed this book and hope for more collaborations between these authors in the future.

4.5 starsCain and Violet were childhood friends. Cain has been in love with Violet forever but put his feelings aside because his best friend was also in love with her. Cain felt like his friend would make Violet happy so he stepped away. Violet and Jeremy happy together until Jeremy died in the war. Years later, Cain is back in town and he's still in love with Violet but doesn't think he should be with her - she will always be his best friends girl. To fight his feelings, he pushes Violet away but he has a really hard time staying away from the girl he loves.I really enjoyed this story. There's something really special about this author's writing - she has this great way of adding humor to her books when you least expect it. A swearing bird - hilarious. This book is loaded with hot sexual tension - I couldn't wait for these to to finally get together. This is really steamy but it takes a little while to get there. I loved these characters and the storyline - a friends to more romance. My only complaint about this one is that Cain did annoy me with how much he pushed away. Overall, I really enjoyed this story and can't wait to read more in this series.

From start to finish this book had me hooked and I couldn't put it down. Holly and Kane are partners in a jewelry heist - they are undercover for the agency they work for. Kane and Holly have worked together before but they have different styles. Kane is a guy who likes to always follow the rules and goes by the book. Holly is more impulsive and goes with her instincts, which sometimes gets her in a little bit of trouble. When Holly and Kane have to pose as an engaged couple to get close to the necklace they need, they can't fight the attraction between them.This book was so good! Everything about this book was perfect - there's suspense, action, sexy times and mystery. The romance was really hot. Kane and Holly together had amazing chemistry and sexual tension. I loved these two characters! I really loved this book and I highly recommend it to anyone who loves a suspenseful romance!

This was a sweet, sexy, and slightly angsty romance. I had a really hard time getting into this story but it eventually picked up and I did enjoy it. Declan is a sexy Irish musician who moves to Las Vegas to make some money to pay for something important to him. Melody is an intern for an editor and she is in Las Vegas, staying at her dads hotel while at a romance writers convention. She's been messing up at her job and has no confidence in herself because of her dyslexia. There were a couple positive things I liked about this book such as how hot the sexy scenes were but I also had a few small issues such as how long it took me to get into the story and I really didn't feel much connection to the characters. Overall, I think this was a sweet romance and look forward to reading more by this author.

I really enjoyed this fast-paced, suspenseful romance. Lily and Cooper have really great chemistry. This book was the perfect mix of suspense, drama, and romance. Sometimes when I read a suspenseful romance, I feel the romance aspect can be lacking with the focus on suspense but this story had a nice mix of both. The suspense had me on the edge of my seat and I couldn't put the book down. Lily and Cooper were also really sexy together and there was really good sexual tension. I really enjoyed this book and I recommend it for anyone who loves suspenseful romance!

Romance writer Jessie James is known as the outlaw. She is a top selling romance writer for her publisher. 6 months ago, Grayson took over his family's publishing company. One year ago, he had a one night stand in Vegas at a writers convention with the outlaw. He didn't tell her his real name and now he's her boss. After a misunderstanding, both Jessie and Grayson don't like each other but can't fight their attraction to each other.I enjoyed the idea behind this story and this author's writing. It was fast paced and fun. Grayson and Jessie kind of had an enemies to more type story which is one of my favorite kind of romance. I enjoyed this book but I wasn't crazy about Grayson. It's more of my personal preferences but I just couldn't connect with his character. This was a light, easy, sexy read.

I really enjoyed this sweet and sexy romance. Nick and Marianne are opposites. Marianne is kind of geeky and shy. Nick is a playboy who doesn't do relationships. When Nick needs a fake fiance for a promotion at work, his sister suggests Marianne. I really liked the chemistry between these two and the sexy scenes were really steamy. The story is predictable but this is the perfect book if you are looking for a light and sexy romance.

I have only have had to use it once, but it worked like a charm. It gave me the code and I was able to find the causes online. Worked well for clearing the codes as well. No complaints whatever. I am guessing by the prices of some of the products compared to this one, those other products must fix the vehicle for you or come with a coupon for unlimited flapjacks at Denny's or something.

Stuff has saved me hundreds. If I would have know it existed I would have never been buying the diluted stuff for the same price. The products you buy at Home Depot or a similar store are usually <0.1 percent and cost around $10 dollars. This is the exact same chemical but concentrated so it kills all the same bugs. If you aren't smart enough to wear gloves with the diluted products you definitely want to wear them with this liquid. Do not get it on your skin and mix only in a well ventilated area (such as outside on a non-windy day). Can't believe with a product like this out here anyone, including myself, would ever purchased the dilute chemical ever.

The product itself is great and works well. I use Dry-Z-Air everywhere i need a dehumidifier. My issue is the price. This is just Calcium Chloride pellets. If you buy them as a Dehumidifier it is $3-$5/pound such as this product. If you buy it as a Snow & Ice Melt it is $1/ pound. I personnaly purchased a 50 lb Ice Melt product on amazon for $50 including free shipping. This was the one though it is at a differnt price now, but I am sure you can find others. http://www.amazon.com/Excel-Snow-Ice-Melt-bucket/dp/B008OE55M2/ref=sr_1_14?ie=UTF8&qid=1415449191&sr=8-14&keywords=ice+meltThe calcium chloride pellets for ice melting were the exact size and quality of Dry-Z-Air pellets (because chemically they are the same and could even be manufactured in the same plant for all i know) There is no different in performance either. I was spending about $8/month for my 2 Dry-Z-Air in my motorhome. Now I am spending $2/month. Again, I love Dry-Z-Air, but don't like the price they charge. Hopefully you will save hundreds with this information

I have purchased this twice now for two different girls and they both have loved it. I have received thank yous from the parents of both children on how much their daughter enjoys it. Would highly recommend this for any little girl as a gift.
Cheap and arrived quickly in good shape. It's a cord that does its intended purpose and I don't know what else to say about it.
Good sharp scissors, have held up well to daily use over the first few months. Purchased as a great deal during one of Amazon's "lightning" deal.

Love Charlie soap and it works great with my soften water and HE washer. I use a half scoop on a standard size load and it cleans just as good as any name brand product. I never had any detergent allergies so I cannot comment on that. Just bought the large size to keep my cost down, but this will probably last me 5 years.
Appears and feel like it is quality built. Purchased for building retaining walls, and I have no complaints about the hammer.
Always high quality gloves. Purchased these because this is the brand we use at work in a chemistry lab. Love the quality of them at work so I wanted to bring that same quality home.
Nuts were received in good condition and fresh. Pretty strong salt flavor for only 50mg per serving. The balance of the mixed nuts has been equal with no one nut dominating.
Great unflavored whey protein. Dissolved well. I use it in green smoothies and add it to oatmeal. I have zero complaints and highly recommend the product.

Hard to find a gum with low ingredients and an sweetener that hasn't been linked to health problems. I have tried both this one and Glee gum and although I would recommend both, the flavor on this gum last a lot longer. I use two piece as a serving, and the flavor slowly drifts away over an hour.

Love this product. Used it to clean up an old Toyota Motorhome engine and it didn't disappoint, although I had to change my oil every couple hours of operation as this product just sloughed off grime from my engine. Now the engine runs much smoother and a slight perceived increase in performance (I have no numbers) and mpg (~11.5 increased to ~13mpg). I was also have trouble with ethanol fuel ruining my lawn mowers carburetor. Started to run really rough and stall every 5 seconds or so during operation. Since using this product this summer the carburetor has really improved, still runs a little rough but it hardly ever stalls anymore. Those two experiences lead me to purchasing this 32oz size bottle. I put one in each one of our daily vehicles to be used when we fill up at the station. I have no doubt it will help keep my engine clean and prevent ethanol breakdown from ruining my engines.
Solid construction and the extra length gives me a lot of extra torque without having to hammer or put on some sort of ghetto extension pipe. No complaints and I would recommend highly.

Great tasting pita chip, and the 8-ounce size bag is especially nice. I don't have to worry about the chips going stale before consumption with the smaller size. I received the bags in Oct 2014 and they do not expire until July 2015 so I have to assume it is fairly fresh stock. The taste is naked as stated, just tastes like dried pita bread, and I works well with hummus or guacamole to add the necessary flavor. I like them without dip as well, but the wife prefers a little more pzazz.

I like the product. The floss is comparable to the thickness of your normal string floss so it fits between teeth fairly easily. Most picks are either extra thick for more strength, or bordering on razor wire for a strong thin pick. So it really is a "comfort" floss in that it is easy on the gums. My only complaint about the product is that the quality has not been consistent. I have place three different orders of this product the first and the last one were great. The middle one was a much lower quality and the floss kept stretching a break during use. With the good quality pack I use one pick per flossing, but with the low quality one I was probably averaging 1.5 picks throughout the bag (some time I would have to use 2, and sometimes only 1). I am hoping the issue was only a one time occurrence, and at this time recommend the product.

Good price, and much better tasting than you typical bargain brand. Similar quality as name brand Tums. Keep in mind these extra strength are double the normal chew. Your normal chew is 500mg and you average extra strength is 750mg, but these "ultra" strength chew are 1000mg, so you may want to only take 1.

Did not use this as an ice melt. Do not read this review if purchasing for ice melt. I own Dry-Z-Air dehumidifiers which use calcium chloride pellets to collect water from the air. Dry-Z-Air sells their own pellets but charges much more for the same chemical component. I purchased this for about a dollar per pound including shipping as apposed to the five dollars per pound for Dry-Z-Air "special but exactly the same" pellets. No noted change in performance between the two, and the size of the pellets is identical.
Very well built and solid for the price. I think a paid almost the same for my flimsy plastic 24" level years ago. I would highly recommend purchasing this level.

I don't use this stuff everyday, but I couldn't live without it during the following occasions: something is in bloom, working outside (e.g. weeding or mowing), or during excessive/thick mucus production. Do not use this during congestion or nasal cavity swelling as you will just put a bunch of water in your cavity that will increase you chances of a ear/nose infection. I use bottled water and microwave the water in the container for 30 seconds to get it at the perfect temperature. I would recommend starting at 10 seconds and increasing the time until you find out what is best for you and your microwave.I like buying these packs because it is the cheapest way to get the product, but I also get to use alternate bottles so I know that they sit dry for over 24 hours. Highly recommend this product for anyone, but specifically those with routine sinus issues.

Probably the best baby book out there. It is a very long read, but you have 9 months so time is not a huge issue. I is not insulting or attacking like some other popular baby books out there. It still the the facts and best practices and covers almost everything about pregnancy.
Purchased this one because it was one of the products that did well in third party lab testing. It also leaves no fish taste for either me or my wife. Great product and highly recommended.

My wife always like these, but I didn't read the label until recently and she didn't know what she was reading. I have always had concerns because gelatin matrices do not prevent oxidation. (If you need a experiment leave on of these out on the counter and see how long before it dries out compare to a liquid gel cap. You will find the capsule hold liquid much better meaning less moisture is going out and less air is getting in). So I was always concerned that my wife was not getting much antioxidants from this and it was essentially a mineral dose. That was until I found out 95% of this thing is just processed sugar. Just each a jolly rancher and drink a glass of hard water and you will likely be getting the same nutrition. There are much better products out there, and we will no longer be using this product.

Where as Diablo I and II were for hardcore gamers at there times, this one has abandon that path and is made more universal. Its left the highly unique character development of Diablo II and gone for a model more like God of War. Just hit lots of buttons and kill everything. They also stole the landscape and characters of Diablo II with little creativity applied to this game over the last one.Know that all the negative details are out of the way it is still a great game. The online play is easy and fun. I have played many hours of it, and look forward to playing much more. Total time to get through the whole store once is probably 12-18 hours.

Bought an old motor home and it was running well but very rough. Started running this product through it every other tank and I have currently needed to change my oil every 500 miles as it is knocking all the debris lose in the engine. The motorhome is running much better now, and my average MPG is up from 10-11 to 12-13ish. It worked so well that I am now using it in my lawnmower fuel to help save  the carburetor from decomposed ethanol gunk. Running much smoother now.

Way overpriced, but it does help keep our small RV much cooler. I never realized how much heat radiates through a closed vent until I got this unit. After installing on one vent the air around it was cool mid day. When I put my hand over to a closed vent not using this insulator, the air was very hot. I will probably but 2 more of these for my other vents eventually, but I don't know if the cost is fair at this time.

About a quarter of the packs were stuck together. Though it is possible, it was hard to separate the affected packs without breaking them open and making a mess. They appear to work well, but do not do nearly enough deodorizing. I have small ~20 gallon grey and black tanks, and these could not successfully keep down the odor on our 2 week vacation. The product works fine, but I was expecting better performance.

Purchased a old motorhome that appeared to have the original spark plugs in it. 25 years left the threads a little rusty, and on one occasion prevented a new spark plug from full insertion. This unit helped save me, especially a lot of money. It cleaned out the holes and thread successfully. Most importantly the majority of the debris is directed outside the engine compartment which makes clean up easier.Some tips I would recommend is to go slow, I ran the unit through the treads a half dozen times. The first few times I did not fully spread the tap and then the last few time I ran it through fully open. I also kept lots of lubricant on the tap to help with debris collection. (I use WD-40)

Fit my old Ventline units perfectly. Not the easiest thing to install, but be patient and slowly work it into you existing unit. I haven't had any issues with leaking or raising/lowering the unit since I installed it.

Very high quality parts and I would highly recommend these. I didn't realizes just how bad my craftsman parts were until I purchased these parts along with some other similar quality. They help create a very tight fit that makes working much easier and saves time and frustration.

This game originally came with my Wii some 5 years ago. The wife and I enjoyed playing it together, and whenever we have company over who have kids their kids are seen enjoying it as well. This particular copy I ordered for my 3 nephews from 6 to 10 in age. They all love it and I recommend it for anyone with a Wii regardless of you age.

Bought this for my niece who is called Emma Bug. She live 1000 miles away, but in my annual visit home she always points out the lady bug on here blanket. I decided this would be the perfect gift to give to her and it turned out to be a success. From what I hear she carries it around everywhere and I even got a letter from her, though it was just scribbles on paper. A must buy if it fits the desire of your gift recipient.

No skin problems for my dogs with this shampoo. They come out clean and it rinses out easily. I don't really notice the smell on my dogs, but its okay that my dogs smell like dogs. I am a fairly simple dog owner and I have nothing bad to say about this product and would recommend anyone to give it a try.

Bought this along with other items for my wife's athletic training course. As I am normally the subject of her practice wrappings, these scissors help me sleep at night as I don't have to worry about here possibly jabbing scissors into my skin. They easily cut through layers of athletic bandages and I have no complaints. I cannot yet speak as to if they maintain there edge for an appreciable length of time.

We received one back in 2009 for our wedding and it has survived well over a dozen parties with all kinds of non-alcoholic and alcoholic drinks. Liked it so much we bought another one as our parties grew in size. Occasionally the plastic nut inside comes lose and needs tightening, but I just check it before willing the dispenser up each time. The spigot is plastic so you can go gorilla on it, but our first one has survived hundreds of cracks with no issue. I do notice that the spigot is different between my 2009 one and the one I have purchased in 2013. The 2013 one hasn't been used more than a couple time so I can't really say if it has been improved or made worse. You can get a better dispenser with a metal spigot, but they cost over twice the cost of this product. That price difference just doesn't make sense to me and so I purchased this one.Pros+Cost much less than similar products+Works well with no leaks in 4 years of use ~5 times a yearCons-Spigot is plastic-Spigot could be closer to the bottom of the dispenser

I would disagree that this would be good for a communication major as previously stated. I am taking a Small Groups Communication class which requires this book. This book is terribly basic, and covers nothing in depth to any useful degree. It gives you a lot of the PSY 101 feeling of deja vu. Between PSY 101, Business Ethics, and Writing for Professional I feel all the material in this book has already been covered in those class. I just read the bolded words and move on to the next chapter. If you are fairly early in your college career you may have to actually read this book, if you are further along and see a course with this book you are probably in for a easy ride.

For the price this stuff is pretty good. As already stated this is pretty soft and more fabric like then most athletic tape. Think of it as a quality somewhere between an Ace Bandage and normal athletic tape. The softness does make it easier to work with in my opinion and I think it breathes better as well with a good under-wrapping. The box arrived quickly and undamaged with all the rolls in good conditions with plenty of stick.

Ordered from Magic Matt's and he is sending an inferior product. He refunded the money, but he is still selling on this posting. The one I received from Matt's has fewer LEDs and is not very bright. It is not the Nite Beams brand and it strap is almost impossible to tighten. I bought from him because his ships here in America (a few days) rather than from China (a few weeks). I don't know if the product from China is the bright quality one shown in the picture or not.

It would have been nice to have the spring as pictured, but it is not there. I am still happy with the product and recommend purchasing, but do realize if you want a spring you will have to buy it separately or purchase a different cable that does include it.

I am not sure what the deal is with all the low quality ones people are receiving, but i am on my 3 amazon order and every single on is the same quality as the ones I have bought at Costco and Von's (Safeway). This is the best toilet paper I have ever been able to find, and I see to reason to leave it any time soon. Yes it is more expensive and doesn't last as long as 1 or 2 ply because of its thickness, but it is remarkable soft and gentle. Unless you have a backside of steel, treat yourself to this product as save some money elsewhere. Of my list of things that people should not buy cheap: your mattress, your daily shoes, and toilet paper come to mind.

Got this to house my bro's new Kindle, and he is very pleased with it.  The pen is a nice addition, especially if you have big fingers.  It is leather, with cut-outs for the on-off switch, volume control and speakers.  When you close the case a concealed magnet clicks shut, it looks like a book, and would store nicely on a bookshelf.  I like the fact that the device automatically "wakes up" when you open the case, and turns off again when you close it. I had to look at the product picture to figure out how to fold the triangular easel.  With the easel in place, you can view the Kindle at a nearly upright angle, or turn it around so it is mostly reclining.  Plus there is a handle. Recommend.

Good basic knife that I purchased for camping trips. I probably won't.be able to kill a bear with it or fling it straight into an intruder's throat, but I feel safer having it, and it is sharp enough for unexpected odd jobs, and has already earned its keep doing the chopping, slicing, and paring for food preparation.

We love these!  They are so bright and cheerful for a toddler. I got them for my nearly two and a half year old grandson, and their universal appeal will carry them on to his baby sister. The soles are nice and flexible, but not too thick which is probably good for that "barefoot feel" so helpful for new walkers. I only wish the velcro version of this model were easier to find. This was a great purchase for a great price.

I bought one of these a couple of years ago from some retailer, and I couldn't remember which one, but of all the toys, dolls, and lovies I have bought for my grandchildren, my granddaughter loves this one the best. I noticed hers was getting a bit ragged, so went looking for another, knowing how traumatic it is for a little one if s/he loses his or her favorite lovie. For my son, this little one's father, it was a very specific teddy bear, and we had to hunt down a replacement a couple of times when it was lost, or he would not sleep. So I am getting this one ahead of time. Thanks!

This "wireless portable router" is indeed a slick, small and portable unit. As it turns out, however, I do not have the kind of device that works with it. My bad. But I am holding on to it to give it a try in the future.

Quercetin is a potent antioxidant and touted to be beneficial for many health issues, including cardiovascular health. This alone is a good reason to take such a supplement, however, it is difficult as an individual to test its effectiveness for one's heart. Others have reported improvements in such things as allergies and joint pain. Since I have been taking this product, I have not noticed any changes in my health, however, I do not feel that I can penalize it for the purposes of a one-month review. Since I, too, have problems with allergies and joint pain, and because of the excellent reputation of this brand, I have ordered a larger bottle of Jarrow Formulas Quercetin, so that I can give it what I consider a fair test. It will certainly be worth the money if it does work. I believe that two capsules a day for sixty days should be sufficient to prove whether it will make a difference. I will re-visit this review with the results of my test.Update: I've been taking the Quercetin regularly for several months, and I have noticed a big improvement in my allergies. It did not do anything for my joint pain, however.

I really like how this thing is built--it is heavy, and seems very sturdy. I do not think it will rust or break easily. You'll need to hang it on a stout branch, and fortunately I had one low enough to hold it, because it would be fairly hard for me to lift it high by myself once it has five pounds of bird seed in it. It takes black sunflower seeds only, by the way. It's kind of messy filling the thing because as you pour the seeds down the top of the feeder, many of them escape through the holes. So do it outside, or be prepared to sweep up the excess. Attractive feeder, both to the birds and to the human eye. Looking forward to observing birds.

I choose this book because I want to do some traveling and exploring in some of the most beautiful natural wilderness areas, including our national parks and forests. My experience is limited; I have only visited about eight out of the 58 total National Parks, and several of those were very cursory, so I am not knowledgeable enough to say how accurate this book is. In fact, a few of the 32 Parks featured and the additional 26 mentioned in the back section were mostly unknown to me. I found them all to be delightful in one way or another, and certainly worth knowing, so for this reason alone--to discover the Parks in print and pictures, this is book has great merit. The second service the book provides is to inspire one to get out and really take the time to get to know the National Parks. "Secrets of the National Parks" has inspired in me an even greater desire to get out and see and experience as much as I can. Last but not least, of course, is that the book is intended as a guide to some of our National Parks, and in particular, how to find places of beauty and even solitude that may be off the beaten path.  This summer I will begin to put this to the test.As I indicated, the subject matter is interesting, and I found the writing to be good and even engaging in many parts. Still it is not so quick to read as a novel, so I ended up spending longer than I had planned getting through the book.  The photography is top-notch, my only complaint is that I wanted more!  You can't expect that four to six photographs can do justice to represent parks that are tens of thousands of acres, so I often found myself on the internet looking for more images and maps.  Each of the featured parks is covered in a six to eight page chapter, including photos and maps. Within each chapter, there are numbered sections about each of the so-callled secrets--usually descriptons of the well-known, or must-see parts, along with some lesser known trails or sections and what they reveal. The numbers then correspond to points on the map, which hopefully will prove their utility once in the field.Rather than discuss all or even several of the Parks, I'd like to adress a few comments to the Theodore Roosevelt National Park (bbl)

This toy is just adorable and appears to be well made and durable. Best of all, the moving parts--the head, tail and legs--make a ratcheting sound that little ones love! I gave my one year and two year old grandchildren the First Friends Tiger and Monkey for a birthday party today, and they really are having a good time with them. These animal friends are small enough to go everywhere with the kids, and very appealing to them.

My two year old grandson was delighted to get this toy on the occasion of his sister's one-year old birthday party. One of her gifts was the Tolo First Friends Tiger, and both tots love both the critters. My grandson immediately began turning all the articulated joints (including the tail, which spins all the way around!). He seems very happy with the little ratcheting noises that the head and arms and legs and tail make when you turn them. An added bonus: someone discovered that if you press the monkey down on his feet, it will make a cute squeak. My grandson played with the monkey and kissed it repeatedly at the party. This toy is solid and sturdy and will get lots of use. Grandma is happy with this purchase!

Author and artist have done a good job in presenting a basic outline of Oprah Winfrey's life as a young child--where she came from, what her life was like, and what SHE was like. Oprah was barely even an afterthought in her mother's life, and she landed into the materially impoverished, yet strict and godfearing world of her maternal grandmother, Hattie May, whom Oprah called, "Mama". She had chores to do, and she learned them well, yet she made up her mind early on that she would not "need" to rely on hard manual labor in the future. She went to church with mama, where the young girl learned to recite scriptures and speak in front of the congregations. The other children made fun of her for this. But Oprah didn't care; she knew that when she grew up, she was going to be PAID to speak. Mama taught her to read before she ever went to school, and Oprah even wrote her teacher a note on her first day of kindergarten telling her teacher that she did not belong in that class. The teacher skipped her up to first grade, where Oprah finally found a friend. I wish the book had gone into a little more detail about this part of her life; it seems a bit abrupt and brief. It only gives the smallest hint, really of the first part of her life, and the rest of her life, I learned from reading online, was also interesting. Hopefully someone will write a longer biography for young children, as I think it is a story well worth telling, and that Oprah is an inspiring role model for all children--boy or girl, black or white.The illustrations are colorful prints from realistic acrylic paintings. I like how they fill every page from top to bottom and side to side. The words are printed over the illustrations in either black or white, depending on how dark the picture is. The print is agreeably legible. It makes for a nice gift book, and I am thinking of getting a copy of this for my neighbors who just adopted a baby girl.

Paired with my excellent Logitech lighted keyboard, this thing puts my Note tablet at the perfect viewing height for me to sit comfortably at my dining table and type away every bit as easily as I can on my desktop, only I don't have to go upstairs to the loft office. Plus I get to do all the tablet-y things like taking pictures, and I can grab the tablet really quickly and stuff it in my purse as I head out the door. It is exactly what I needed and it has increased the utility of my Galaxy at least ten-fold.  Very pleased with this item. I as going to buy a folding easel to make it easier to type, and I probably still will just for travel, as this product does not fold up, but the height and angle are so superior to a plain easel and make for no stress or strain use, that I feel as if I have gotten a new computer in the house!  The only draw back is that it does bounce slightly when touched, so it is not ideal for lots of screen touch use. Works best with a keyboard, or if you set it on your nightstand to watch a movie in bed. I like that!

I have terribly dry eyes and I regularly use a variety of eye drops regularly, including prescription ones, but I've always liked having my Rohto Z! eye drops in my line-up. No more! They used to be so cool and refreshing, but now they are cold and painful. I think they have mentol in them. Now why would you put menthol in a mucus membrane?  Anyway, all the writing on this newest Z! is in Japanese characters, so who knows?  I hope I can get my money back. Sticking to my Theratears, Systane, Genteal, etc. drops now.

I've been bitten by a bug. Suddenly I want to go camping, traveling, hiking--to be outside. I got the tent, and the other stuff. I got some good boots. I thought about getting some trekking poles for balance and to relieve strain from my joints, but, really, I don't know much about them, so I figured for now, I couldn't go wrong with this cool big stick. My Brazos stick came much faster than I thought it would, in fact, it came in time for me to take it on my first camp-out in Texas, which is cool, since Brazos are made in Texas, so it came from Texas to Oklahoma, and I took it back to Texas. Or something. Anyway, I am SO happy with my big Texas stick, and one thing I didn't realize is how handy it would be at night, because I've discovered that my balance isn't all that great when I can't see my feet. Who knew?  I ordered the 55" one recommended for my height, and it seems right. The leather strap goes around my wrist, and I'm in business. Sometimes I stick it under my armpit and steady myself with it.  Thank-you Brazos for my new wooden friend!

These are my first ever hiking boots, so I'm not very experienced, but I did quite a bit of research, mainly online, before ordering these boots. My primary objective, with the limited amount of hiking I will be doing, is to protect my ankles, as my joints in general are wobbly and prone to dislocate, and I want to be safe on the trail.  The Vasque Breeze boots feel very sturdy, and, if a boot could keep me from injuring my ankles, these would do it. I actually prefer the freedom of just walking in shoes--as I said I am not used to hiking boots, so they seem a bit confining right now, but hopefully I will get used to then and be safer than I would if I hiked in lower shoes.  I like how they hold my feet in a very straight upright position, though, as my feet have a slight tendency to turn outward.I compared these Vasque boots to a pair of similiarly designed Merrells which I had ordered first. The Merrells are softer and a tiny bit lighter. I liked those a lot, but I  have a narrow foot and the Merrells, which only come in B width were just too baggy in the toe box for me, so I found these in the AA width, and ordered one half-size up, as recommended and they fit perfectly once I put them on with thick hiking socks.I think the Vasque boots look sharp and have a quality look from top to bottom, inside and out, even if they were made in China. (What isn't these days?).  Looking forward to many miles in my sturdy Vasque  boots. See you on the trail!

Note that this "Playbook Farm" is marketed for ages three and up, and, as such, is quite appropriate for pretend and interactive play for post-toddlers. Once you open the box, the red ribbon allows you to pull out the folded-up play book/mat. Taking the book from the front, you can open the pages thick cardboard pages to SIX complete pop-ups, with a simple story line that winds along a path. Each and every pop-up is delightful and well-executed, with animals or moving parts, but the story line is merely suggestive, in my opinion. With this pop-up, the play's the thing! Take the little card-stock figures of people, animals and vehicles out of the envelop in the front flap of the box cover; open the little stands on the bottom of them by pulling apart the two sides, spreading and folding them out; and let them dance along the path, making up words, sounds and songs!  There is also a very simple story printed along the backs of the pages, and this might actually be a good place to begin if you are reading it to a very small child to get them interested before they start to grab the pop-ups.I read this to my grandkids who are almost one and two and they were highly interested in it, as well as the little play pieces and the pop up details. I'll show it to them a few times in the next couple of years before I let them have to to sit and pretend play with together. I've never seen a book with pop-up pages that you can unfold into a large mat before (open carefully as you see which way to turn each page), so this is pretty neat! All the pop-ups from the story combine together to create the whole farm on the land (the mat). They are: 1. a house with a rooster on the top, 2.a large tree with a fenced in area for animals, 3. A horse standing in a wheat field. (I know, what?), 3. A windmill with a working fan, 4. a chicken coop--very cute, and 5.some pigs in their field under a tree.The paperboard play pieces include: a truck driven by a male, a red tractor driven by a female, a farmer standing with his pitchfork, a spotted cow, a spotted pig, a red rooster, a cute goat, a wooly sheep, and a border collie. The animals are wonderful, but they really NEED a bunny and a kitty! They are in the story, and it would add so much for the bunny to hop down the lane, and the kitty to meow and slink around. I think I shall have to make my own before I give it to the kids.Apparently this is the first in a series, as the back of the back states: "Coming in September 2012: PLAYBOOK PIRATES!" . Arg! Hold onto your hats!

This book is different from my other sketching and drawing books in at least two respects: its quality and its teaching. The quality of the book is evident in both the materials used: it is 260 heavy colored pages bound within a nice hardback format, with easily legible text and beautifully printed illustrations; and the writing is well organized and pleasing to read. The teaching concept behind the book could easily serve as a course of study for a semester long class with plenty of material to thoroughly cover the subject of urban drawing. It is not a slavish copy-this drawing type of method book, nor is it one that overly emphasizes drawing mechanics such as shading, perspective and techniques. At first I thought it was really too advanced for me, because I was thinking of something along the lines of an amateur drawing journal, which is becoming quite popular these days. There are plenty of good books along those lines, too. But after studying the book more closely, I found that this book, while certainly applicable to any professional artist, illustrator or designer; still has much to offer the serious hobbyist who wants to learn to make this style of street and urban landscape drawing.The idea behind the book is to show how aesthetically pleasing freehand drawings can be made in our modern world of highly accessible photojournalism, and, especially, computer generated types of creative work. That, in fact, the rise of this type of machine-aided art has given place for freer, more creative styles of rendering work. Author James Richards works almost exclusively in line drawings--both black pencil ones as well as black marker ones--with the addition of color from Ad Markers or Primsa Color Pencils and sometimes hard stick pastels. His drawings are often very detailed, yet have a quality of freedom and spontaneity and movement. Very classy work! He annotates everything, and advices his students to do likewise. You can find a list of suggested supplies near the front, and I've ordered a few of the black markers, as I already have Prisma colored pencils and good, thick Prisma Art markers. A sketchbook with flat, smooth paper will also be helpful. I'm sure my stuff won't look so professional, but I'm going to try out his tips. They are inviting. By the way, Mr. Richards has included several guest authors from various backgrounds with their words and artwork, so you do get that variety.As to book contents, there are three major parts, with one to four chapters each, and the chapters are further organized into smaller sections. PART ONE: LEARNING A LANGUAGE: Chapter 1: The Freehand Renaissance (Art and Technology, etc), Chapter 2: Nine Keys to Exploratory Drawing (Simplify Tools, Simplify Message, Work Small, Simplify Technique, etc.), Chapter 3. Elements and Entourage (People, Vehicles, Trees, Shrubs, etc), Chapter 4. Creating Believable Worlds (Perspective: what you really need to know, Creating Depth, Building up Color, etc), PART TWO: URBAN SKETCHING: Chapter 5: Urban Sketching as Creative Fuel, Chapter 6: Capturing the Place (Tools, Subject, Editing, etc); PART THREE: CONCEPT SKETCHING. Chapter 7: Capturing the Idea (Sketching over Digital Bases, Sketching over aerial Photographs, etc), Chapter 8: Digital Sketching--Drawing without Limits (The Vision, The Reality, Gallery, etc). Along with the two-page table of contents are thumbnail sketches to give the reader an idea of the contents.I like this book because it has a unity of concept and also a feel of a comprehensive whole. I don't think I'll be able to draw like James Richards, but I get what he's saying and it's very good.

I know that this leather case is designed to fit the Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1, but, on the basis of another review here, I thought I could get it to fit my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet. It does not fit. I checked and Samsung does make a different version of the same product for the Samsung Note, so if you have the Samsung Note, don't make the same mistake I did; look for the one that specifies "Note".As to the product itself, it appears to be a decent tablet case, especially if you are looking for something that will both protect your tablet, as well as provide an easy way to set your Galaxy up to view it at any angle. When you open the case, the left side has a series of five sets of grooves, with four grooves in each set. There is also a black stretchy band on the left side to use to secure the case over the tablet when closed. Sewn into the inside of the right side of the case is a four-pronged holder apparatus into which you can clip your case. (It is a little bit too small for the Note). I like the fact that the apparatus is made of a tough, yet flexible black plastic-type material. The right, tablet-side of the case swings forward and the bottom edge can be placed along any of the grooves giving you the choice of anywhere from nearly 90 degree upright viewing to a much lower slant--about 45 degrees. The interior has good static-friction to prevent the tablet from slipping once you adjust it to the desired angle. The left side of the case has an oval hole which will allow you to use the camera without removing the device from the case. Handy, well made item for the Samsung Galaxy Tab 2-10.1 inch.

Myositis is the name for a group of rare muscle inflammation diseases. Autoimmune types of myositis cause muscle weakness, pain and debility, and result in a depletion of L-carnitine.  Therefore, taking supplemental L-carnitine can be quite helpful to patients with myositis. Other alternative therapies include: Co-enzyme Q10, creatine, and calcium/magnesium supplements. Polymyositis, dermatomyositis, and inclusion body myositis are the main auto immune types. Perhaps this will be useful information if you have one of these unusual muscle diseases.

This is my first experience using silicon bakewear, and it went pretty well. The product is lightweight, flexible, but sturdy. As a loaf pan it is longer and narrower than the traditional metal or glass loaf pan. The directions indicate that the pan is to be prepped by running hot water in it or washing it in the dishwasher and then coating it in butter before the first use. After that, no butter or coating is needed. We made a loaf of pumkin bread in it after doing the hot water and the butter, and it baked just fine, only bulging out somewhat in the middle because the silicon walls were too flexible to completely support the weight of the batter. Once finished, it popped right out of the pan, easy-peasy. No crumbs or mess, and the finished product was moist and tasty. A good addition to the typical kitchen bakewear.

I got the tan Sleepyhead Bunny and the light blue one for my grandkids, who are nearly one and two years old. I think they are perfect for this age; no removable parts to choke on or get lost. They are machine washable on cold inside a pillow case. The bunnies are so cute in their stripey pajamas, and the velour material that makes up the rest of the bunnies (the feet, hands and head) is super soft and cuddly. Wonderful baby gift; can't wait to see how they like them!

The table comes folded up in a very small blue canvas pouch which features a carrying strap. I purchased it for car camping basically to hold the cookstove. It could be a bit larger for that in order to hold the stove and a couple of accessories. It is able the right size for an individual place setting, and the micro table would be a perfect dining table for a person who is sitting on the ground or on a low seat such as a beach chair. It would be nice if they were sold in packages of multiples for this reason, as the costs add up quickly. On the positive side, though, I do believe that the table is durable, and should last well and not wear out.I like my GSI micro table; it is small and light and it takes up very little space in my car. Currently I use it to hold my utensils and accoutrements while I'm sitting on my lower style camp chair and cooking on the open fire. It holds up to 20 pounds. If you are sitting on the ground or on a low chair, such as a beach chair, this table will also make a perfect little dining table for one.

Subaru Forester + Sportz Dome tent = win at car camping. I spent a great deal of time deliberating which "SUV tent" to purchase, and finally decided that the Sportz by Napier brand looked like the best bet. They have several choices, and I finally decided to get the "small one" because I was planning some solo camping or trips with DH. Only after I ordered this one did I find the excellent company website sportzbynapier, where I found that their dome style is for "hatchbacks and CUVs", whereas the others are for SUVs. (except the truck ones, but that is obvious). So I guessed right.  Maybe knowing this will save someone the trouble of trying to decide.I just got the tent today, and had my son who has lots of tent camping experience, basically set it up for me for the first go round, so this is a preliminary report. Overall we decided that it is a very good tent, well thought out and with good features, extremely tall and plenty roomy. We wish that the company had waterproofed the tent, but at least they did include instructions for that, so don't forget to do it. It has an extra rain tarp that shuts the thing down quite tightly, but the windows of the tarp roll neatly back out of the way, so might as well set it up that way to begin with, then you will be prepared in case the weather turns bad. He set the thing up in a few minutes on the first try without instructions. I believe it will be challenging for me to do it alone, but the process is pretty straightforward.Car-to-tent camping is a great idea as I can sleep off the ground on my new perfectly fitting Coleman SUV mattress; and I can stow all my gear in the tent and have it out of my way, but close to me at the same time. I'll have plenty of room to hang out or do whatever in my tent, and, if you have a group, you'll have room to sleep four in it nicely, too. It is over seven feet tall, but you can see that it is designed that way because it stands next to your car with it's wide open hatch and the connector sleeve has to go up high over it. It cinches nicely around the car for a good fit. After we got it set up, we dragged the tent over to my son's big family SUV--a Nissan Pathfinder--to see if it would also fit there. It didn't. So if you have a "real" SUV, get the other style by Sportz. The Dome works well for Subarus and other crossovers and hatchbacks.  Happy trails!

I got this for my grandson when he was maybe six months old as an oral stimulation alternative for him. He was the type of kiddo who always wanted to mouth and chew on things. It worked pretty well. Now he is 19 months old, and his mom and dad use it to brush his teeth. He looks forward to having his teeth brushed with it, I found out when I babysat him tonight. Granted, it does not look all that much like a toothbrush, but HE knows EXACTLY what it is. I could have died laughing when I was brushing the little guy's teeth, and he started making a krrrrrrrrrrr sound in the back of his throat like the sound his mom and dad's (electronic) toothbrushes make.  :)

When I could not find Nizoral shampoo in the stores, I searched for it on line, but it was SO expensive that I decided to give Regenpure, since it also contains ketoconazol and is MUCH less expensive. I'm glad I did. I am 100% satisfied with this shampoo. My head and hair feel wonderfully clean and fresh, without being overly dry. My hair comes out soft and shiny, yet my normally oily, itchy scalp is really clean. That oiliness contributes to the overgrowth of a type of yeast that feeds on lipids, I have learned, and has caused a decades long problem with itchy, burning, painful sores on my scalp. Tar shampoos, selsun blue, and other shampoos have had only limited success. This is the first product that heals the burn and with the pleasant side effect that my hair feels clean and full and soft. Glad I found it.

My daughter in-law wanted a flowering teapot, so I choose this one because I like the shape and the infuser and the included tea-flowers. She is very happy with it and uses it a lot. When I was visiting the other day, my son made me some green tea in the pot, and it worked nicely. The "flower" is basically made by taking a bunch of whole tea leaves and weaving them or fastening them together with cotton string in the center, so that when the dried leaves soak up the hot water, they expand outward in a flower-like effect. A pleasant addition to making and drinking tea, I think.

I gave this to my granddaughter a few days ago, and her eyes lit up as I showed it to her and told her about her new (first) dolly. It is a small doll, very good size for a newborn, and it is perfect for my little granddaughter to cuddle. The velour fabric is even softer to the touch than I expected, and the doll is stuffed to the consistancy of a very soft pillow, yet not floppy. My granddaughter clutches her dolly every night now whenever she goes to bed. I checked it over carefully before giving it to her, and everything is stitched nice and neat. I am pleased with the quality of the item, and I do believe it will hold up well to repeated play and washings. It has detailed instructions telling how to care for it so that it will be allergy free, including putting it in the freezer for a while before washing (!)--I presume this helps kill dust mites?  Anyway, I recommend "Buttercup" as a sweet and safe first doll for any young child.

I got this book because I really love horses, and reading them is as close as I'll ever come to knowing what it is like to own one. Two good things about the book are that it is short, and the narrative flows nicely.  Susan Richards went from a miserable childhood living with her grandmother to a horrible marriage to an abusive, alcoholic man whom she did not really take the time to get to know well enough before jumping into matrimony. On top of that, she had "saddled" herself with alcoholism. I can't personally relate to this. It's hard for me to understand why someone would get so mired in self-abuse of that sort; maybe if you have been or are an alcoholic, it will speak to you.Anyway, she was fortunate in the fact that her grandmother, much to Ms. Richards surprise, left her a large fortune when she died, and with that she was able to buy a wonderful property in the adorondacks, complete with horses, etc. But she went looking for "the one" horse that truly spoke to her spirit. I can believe that; I've had my own heart animals at times, and I think horses and humans connect on a very deep level. She was searching for a special Morgan horse and she found Georgia. Georgia was a green, but quite strong-willed young mare. Perhaps training her, riding her, loving her gave Susan the will and strength to finally get rid of her abuser and also the alcohol abuse. I did not like that she did not take the horse with her when she left him; apparently she had to get away, and it was not possible to bring Georgia with her. Getting the horse back proved to be extremely costly and time consuming because of her ex's vindictive ways.Altogether the book was not bad, but I didn't like hearing about her disastrous personal life so much as I did reading about her relationship with Georgia. For example, the parts where Susan nursed Georgia back to health were quite moving to me. The author really did a good job of capturing the spirit of this magnificent, though at times headstrong horse, and her writing style is clear and enjoyable.  She really did come through some hard times and overcome a lot, but I feel there is a certain over focus on herself and her hard times, and I would have preferred to hear more about the horse and their relationship.

I liked this chair better than I thought I would. It actually looks pretty good--at least the fluffy top part, which resembles a down coat in texture. It's pretty comfortable to sink down into--just don't expect any lumbar support. I did not have any trouble opening it and getting it set up, and re-folding wasn't too hard, either, except you have to be sure to wrap the velro strap part around the TOP, puffy part, or it won't work. Once I got that straight, it was AOK. BTW, it all fits inside a clear, plastic, zippered case. The case has two handles, and it is possible to hike it up on your back and put one handle over each shoulder. I wouldn't carry a long way to a picnic or something; it's a bit hefty for me. I plan to store it in my garage and get it out if I need extra seating for entertaining either inside my house or out on the patio. This folding club chair would probably work nicely for a dorm room.

Egad this thing is massive! It' so over-the-top compared to the hardwear in  my house and my rentals, that I am at a loss to know what to do with it! I meant to get the locking handle to use for an exterior door, and that would have been great, but I don't have a closet in my house or something that I need to monitor in this fashion. I would not recommend it for the door from the house to the garage, because I consider that to be an exterior door, and I like to keep it locked.

This is the basic model of the Oral-B electric toothbrush, so it only has one speed, but really that's all you need. I have an earlier version of the "Oral B Professional Care" toothbrush from a few years ago, and it still works. It looks a little different style-wise, but the performance is identical. It was also made by the Braun company in Germany, and therefore I trust the quality and expect it to last.As I said, it runs at one speed, but, in addition, it has a tricky little timer thing that helps the user brush for the recommended two minutes. You start brushing wherever you like, then concentrate on just that particular quadrant. Each thirty seconds the motor makes a slight hesitency sound which cues you to move to the next quadrant. After two minutes it makes a longer hesitency sound, and you are finished.Besides the handle, you get one brush head and a stand that has an attachable unit for storing up to four brushes. I like how that is designed and that it has a cover to protect the brushes. The included brush is compact and round and does a great job getting into tight corners and getting teeth clean all over. The included brouchure depicts four other specialized heads that you can buy if you prefer. I plan to order a set of four basic brushes from amazon.I definitely can recommend this Oral-B electric toothbrush by Braun based on both my prior experience with the brand as well as my testing of the current model. At the current price of about $50, with an additional $20 rebate it is an absolute bargain. It carries a two year limited warranty, but will probably last several years.

This Moshi iVisor is the first screen protector we have tried for my husband's Kindle Fire, and it is pretty much just as stated in the description. It is easy to apply, just like in the video. It appears to be a tough enough protective cover, at the same time, it does not interfer with the touch control of the device. It is just as easy to remove as it is to apply, and the instructions state that it should be removed and cleaned regularly, suggested once a month. The visual clarity of the screen is slightly affected by the iVisor, and it has less glare when viewed indoors. (have not tested it outdoors yet. We also ordered a new case for this Kindle, and the screen does not interfer with it, either. Worthwhile product for protecting the Kindle Fire screen.Pros: simple to apply  appears to be tough and durableCons: price seems a bit high  slight degradation of image

I ordered "large", as I generally wear size 12 or 14 tops at this time, which the correct size according to the size chart. I couldn't even get the thing over my head and try it for a tight fit. Absolutely toooooo small! Unfortunately I missed the "free return" deadline, also.

I enjoy reading memoirs of people from all sorts of backgrounds, and, esp with disabilities. This book about a seriously disabled boy was quite well written and gave me a lot to think about. The author, Ian Brown,  is a Canadian journalist, and one thing that it made me think about is that the services for profoundly ill or disabled people in Canada are in many ways seriously lacking. Another thing I think is that I am glad that he wrote this book so that people who have not had experience with disabilities of this sort can get a really good, up close look at what it is really like. I glad for this and for every other book that opens up this world to the "rest of us". On the other hand, it is also useful for those who are traveling down a hard road with a handicapped family member, so that they can see there are others out there, and that they are not alone. For example, after the family was finally able to get a placement for their son, Walker, Mr. Brown, took a journey to find other families who had children with the same syndrome in Canada, the US, etc. I read quite a bit about that on the internet after reading this book, and it was pretty interesting. Sorry, it has been a while since I read this book, so I'm not going into a lot of detail, but I did read it (mine was an advance reader's copy) immediately and mostly all at once. It was engrossing.

This book made quite an impression on me; I read it several weeks ago, and so I may not get as many details down here as I would like to at first. The most salient part of this book to me was the story of the author's mother got cancer and died a slow, horrorific, tragic death. This was a middle class (probably upper middle class) family where the father became a practitioner in the Christian Science Church, meaning that he had the job of praying for people so that they would get well instead of going to doctors. They take a very literal view that the physical world is not real and that illness or any other "bad" thing is merely illusion because we are all "god's perfect children", and if you can just get your thinking straight, you will get well.  The father in the story was a very literal, I guess you could say faithful follower of the CS faith, and because of that he had very much influence over the family and how they did things. I was very saddened by what happened to the mother. One of the reasons this affects me so deeply is because I believe that the patient's narrative is vital in medicine and in understanding what is wrong and what is needed for them. To ignore the patient's naerrative, the person's story of what they feel, what they suffer, is to deny their reality, and therefore tantamount to denying the person as a person. I have a lot to say about this subject, but for now, I just want to say that this book was very vivid and maybe too traumatizing for me.

George Sullivan has written quite a books for young people, including numerous historical biographies. This one is the story of Charlie Stratton, born in 1838 in Bridgeport, Connecticut, who received the stage name of General Tom Thumb from PT Barnum. Charlie was a cheerful, even rambunctious little boy who enjoyed amusing his parents and the guests of the inn that they ran in that coastal town. His parents only concern for the boy was that he stopped growing as an infant; in every other way he was perfectly normal. When Mr. Barnum discovered the lad while visiting the inn, he was completely captivated by him and was sure that Charlie would have a good life and be a big hit in Mr. Barnum's entertainment business. Eventually he prevailed upon the parents to allow him to take Charlie, now Tom Thumb on this adventure which became his live.I found this book to be quite readable and also enjoyed the photographs and illustrations. There were pictures of his town, of him dressed in various costumes, of adverts, maps, and much more. A longer section was devoted to his famous wedding to Lavina Warren. The book tells about Lavina's life, and also many other people who Charlie met and worked with along the way. The author's portrayal of PT Barnum, his successes, his challenges, and his hoaxes was honest yet sympathetic. Barnum promoted and even exploited Tom, but Tom also led a good life, got to travel around the world, meet kings, queens and others, and he became immensely rich in the process.This book would appeal to many readers ages 10 and up who like to read about history, biography or just like to learn something new. The book immerses the reader in a world that is often exotic, and always interesting. A worthwhile read.

I really enjoyed Martin Lemelman's memoir of growing up in an ethnic Jewish neighborhood in Brooklyn, New York, the son of immigrant parents. I really got a sense of the culture he was raised in and of his family, with all their strengths and flaws. I like reading all sorts of memoirs of people whose lives were different from my own, and getting a sense of the variety of experiences that people can have in this world. Lemelman's pencil drawings added much to the enjoyment of the book. I liked it so much that I also ordered and read an earlier memoir that he wrote called "Mendel's Daughter", which is a wonderful and sympathetic story of his mother. I got a great deal on this by ordering a used hardback copy of it. I recommend both of these books for anyone who enjoys memoirs, graphic-formatted stories or is particularly interested in Jewish-American culture or WW II survival biographies.

These are billed as "boxer panties", but they actually don't have much of a leg at all, so they are more like square shaped underpants. The white fabric there are made from is smooth and comfortable and it stretches very well both vertically as well as horizontally. They are from polymide--a kind of nylon microfiber, which is supposed to wick away moisture and dry quickly. However, I prefer wearing natural fibers from renewable sources. I also purchased a similar product from this company in pink which is made from 93% cotton and 7% spandex, which I like. From the hang tag, which is nearly impossible to read even with reading glasses, I learned: They are made in Mexico. Instrucciones (j/k--I'll give the English version): wash dark colors separately. Hand wash, cold, with detergent or soap. Do not wring. Hang dry in the shade. Do not iron.Enjoy! :)

I wouldn't call these undies "boxers" really, because they really don't have much of a leg part at all. They are, rather, square-shaped panties. If you are looking for something to prevent chafing, this is not what you want. Also, the back of the pants is too short to cover the booty. Anyway, I did get used to the fit, and the fabric is quite comfortable. I got the pink ones, and they are cute enough, even with the zigzag waist band that another customer found objectionable. There was a long hang tag sewn in the back, which I removed. By this I learned that they are made in Mexico. To find out more, I had to get out reading glasses and even then the print on the tag was still VERY small and hard to read. Here's what it says, as far as I can tell (it is also printed in Spanish, though): Wash dark colors separately. Hand wash, cold with detergent or soap. Non chlorine bleach when needed. Do not wring. Line dry in shade. Do not iron.Enjoy!

These liners do fit rather snuggly, hugging my very curve and bump. The waist band is about an inch or so above my navel, and the lower hem ends a couple of inches above my knee. There is, indeed, no tag, and I see no laundering instructions, so I am going to wash them medium (permanent press), and dry on low. I don't think they will shrink much with just 43% cotton, but with 14% lycra, I don't want to wash and dry them too hot or roughly.
