Glen now has three biological daughters and treats Rhea differently which makes her resentful.  Rhea has taken to drawing and saying the male body part all the time and saying inappropriate things in front of Nathaniel, such as will you two be having sex?  Theresa never corrects her and really seems clueless as a mother, acting more as a big sister. (ex: Theresa wakes a cranky Rhea up to go to school and won't buy the "I'm sick" routine.  9 year old Rhea says, "I hate you, you bitch." It's troubling to watch.  Theresa is not any more mature in her conversations with Nathaniel and her inability to understand their relationship.Then, there's the over use of the f-word, oral sex, stalker behavior and inappropriate words for a 9 year old daughter. There was some editing issues with misspelled words and redundant articles, but nothing you can't eventually figure out.Would I/Did I buy it? Yes (.99)Would I read it again?  NoWould I recommend it to friends? No

I thought I was lucky to get Fight With Me and Come Away With Me for .99 each one day and quickly downloaded both.  I now believe that there is something like TOO MUCH sex for a book.  I compare it to eating Oreo's.  The first two are delicious, but the more you eat, the more nauseous you get - no matter the variety of ways you try to eat them.  Nate and Julianne go at it like rabbits and honestly, it is not love, just lust that is based on nothing but looks.Nate and Julianne are playboy beautiful, rich, smart, exceedingly athletic, beautiful, rich, beautiful, athletic, beautiful.  Did I say they are perfect in most ways the common folk are not?  They are UNBELIEVABLY blessed physically, financially, mentally, etc.  There is just no way to identify with these two, especially Jules who has an several orgasms EVERYTIME she and Nate go at it and that is AT LEAST three times a day. She is Wonder Woman.  I was starting to get bored when these two were together no matter how many variations of sex they tried - and they tried them all in a three week period.  All they ever did was tell each other how beautiful the other one was and how much they wanted the other.  I sure hope neither of them gets in an accident and mars those good looks because I doubt the other one would stick around.The slim plot of the book was the fear of what would happen if these two were discovered together by those at work because of the no fraternizing policy.  Nate was totally devoted to and protective of Jules so there was no real drama with jealousy; actually there was no real drama over anything - just sex - A LOT of sex.  Twice there was a reference to "making love" but Jules barely put up with it; she wanted it fast and hard all the time.My ending feeling for these two was sadness.  Their relationship seemed so shallow and missing love.  I guess that makes sense as these two are both (MMA) fighters and lives reflect this defensive style.  They are mistaking lust for love and sex for affection.  Their story reads like a two month one night stand.Obviously there was descriptive sex and the f-word which seems the only way to the sex these two had.Would I/Did I buy it? Yes (.99)Would I read it again? NoWould I recommend it to friends? No

Over a year ago I thoroughly enjoyed the first in this series, Fate Fixed (The Erris Coven Series) and was on a sequel watch for the Blood Twist.  How I missed it when it was released a couple of months ago is beyond me.  Blood Twist is just as good as the Fate Twist and thankfully, it gives a great review, and then carries on from where Fate Fixed took off. Blood Twist was suspenseful, intriguing, and sometimes disgusting. I loved seeing Lexie and Torin again and Braden and Liz were just as wonderful to read about.  IF you like Fate Fixed, this one will not disappoint!Lexie's mom needs a cure to her werewolf disease her horrible husband gave her before being killed by his eldest son.  Braden is determined to trade his life for the cure, but is talked into taking Lexie's best friend Liz with him.  He is un-explainably attracted to Liz, but knows they have no future together as he is going to die and he has never dreamed about her.  Braden is not really Liz's usual type, but she can't help the pull of attraction she feels toward him.  Thinking she is going with him to retrieve the cure, she is surprised when she meets up with another coven of vampires who are human blood drinkers.  She also meets Braden's Brother Riley who didn't make it through the change without drinking human blood.  He wants Liz and his brother to stay with him and make a new coven together.Death is also a character in this story and his parts are completely disgusting.  He licks up blood and eats his kill slowly.  He is determined to have the succulent blood of Braden and has waited almost 12 years for Riley to lure him to their nest.  I really liked the alternating POV's that included death, Braden and Liz.While not as romantic as Fate Fixed, it is still compellingly written and full of great characters and action.  It would be appealing to those who enjoyed The Darkwoods Trilogy (The Mayfair Moon (The Darkwoods Trilogy #1)) by J. A. Remerski or who read the first book in this series and liked it. There are small editing problems such as missing words or misspelled words (accept for except), some profanity (some f-word, sob, etc), paranormal eating of humans and reference to sexual situations.I am looking forward to the next in the series called Soul Kissed which I think willfeature Lexie's little sister Elle and her werewolf love Nicolai.Would I/Did I buy it?  Surprisingly, a free downloadWould I read it again? YesWould I recommend it to friends? Yes

UPDATE:  Great, A New Cover, Now Get A New Title!! (smile)This is a wonderful story that is only ruined by its BORING cover and UNINTERESTING title! Do NOT let that prevent you from buying this book.  It is sexy, mysterious, suspenseful and ROMANTIC.  I was so hesitant to start this story because of its boring cover, but once I started, I didn't want to put it down. (Suggested alternate titles: Climbing Over To You, Challenge Her, Crazy For You. Honestly, ANYTHiNG would be better!)Danny (Danielle) is the baby daughter of the Bennet clan and wants to pursue dream of going to Columbia to get her degree.  Her father refuses to pay for it, so she applies for a job from the rival Cahill family.  Austin Cahill knows that she is a Bennet and has hired her to seek revenge on her brother Derek whom he thinks is responsible for his fiancé's death.  At one time, Derek and Austin were best friends determined to end the long standing feud, but actions, rumors and distrust won out and separated them for the last 15 years.  When Danny showed up on his work site, Austin had no idea he would fall for her hard.While I LOVED the romance of Austin and the feisty Danny coming to fruition, it was the personalities of all the characters that really had me enjoying the story.  Danny's brother Derek was a great brother, friend and lover, Melanie, his girlfriend, was also Danny's best friend and was a real spit-fire.  The guys on the work site who gave Danny such a hard time before making her one of their own all had distinctive likeable characteristics and really fleshed out the story.  They all were a really great cast of characters, so when one of them is fatally wounded, I was heartbroken and lost some of my enthusiasm for the story.  I am sorry, but it is true.  I don't like tragedy in my stories and this one reminded me of Chasing Nikki (Chasing Nikki #1).  I just didn't see it coming.  Despite the tragedy, J. A. Dennam does not let the reader wallow in sorrow for a long time and the book ends on a positive note.So, most of the story had great editing, writing, characters, love story, rival families, plot, and dialogue and I HIGHLY recommend it as a delightful read.  But the last bit was sad and left me less excited about having read the story.  I still love it enough to recommend it to my best friend who is WAY less sensitive than I am. (smile)Descriptive sex, some profanity (f-word, etc)Would I/Did I buy it? Lucky to get it as a Free DownloadWould I read it again? Well....Would I recommend it to friends? Yes

Typical fan response: review wasn't even up 3 minutes before it was hit.  Why can't fans understand that not all reviewers will give their favorite authors 5 stars and that just maybe others would like to hear a different point of view?  AND that the helpful review button is for those without a vested interest.I have to say, I was kind of disappointed in this story because it was just too unbelievable, sticky sweet and wrapped up WAY too nicely which is ironic coming from an author who calls herself a "hardcore realist".  I suppose if I had read this story before Slammed and Point of Retreat I would be more lenient, but Hoover's stories are now just too "perfect" with very little realism.I didn't hate this story; in fact I loved parts of it like when Holder told Skye that he "live her" - a combination of "like" working towards, but not yet, "love" - that was imaginative and beautiful.  I also liked how the story unfolded by being mysterious one minute and romantic the next.  I loved Karen and Skye's relationship with their "I'm not getting pregnant, Mom. Only terribly high and cracked out." She laughs and hugs me. "Good girl. And wasted. Don't forget to get wasted", and the trust they had in each other.  But the poetic and imaginative writing that captured my attention in Hoover's previous works was corrupted by the unrealistic PERFECTNESSWhat I didn't like was how PERFECT Holder was, I mean, come on, he was 18 or 19 years old and he said and did everything as if he had a PhD in psychology.  It was UNBELIEVABLE and made me roll my eyes and groan to read one more sentence of his god-like answers of comfort.  It immediately lost its grittiness for me and the drama became just that - drama.  Then the inter-lapping of lives and circumstances all wrapped up so neatly that no one appeared to even need therapy just seemed implausible and sappy.  Don't get me wrong, I didn't want a sad ending, just a believable one!I hate that I feel this way about a book that so many have obviously LOVED, but after rolling my eyes for the eightieth time, it was hopeless (literally).  This story was going to be a chore to finish; and it was.  It took me four days, but I did it.Indie authors are writing the life out of abuse, suicide and bullying and giving their victims' PERFECT saviors (which they claim they can because it is FICTION).  Well, FICTION does require some realism to make it believable and enjoyable or at the very least relatable.  Maybe a savior does come along, but he is NEVER perfect and THAT is what makes him human.Would I/Did I buy it? Yes (3.99)Would I read it again? NoWould I recommend it to friends? Sure, obviously I am in the minority

So, I really, really enjoyed Just Remember to Breathe (Thompson Sisters) and immediately downloaded this next in the Thompson Sister's Series!  I don't know how Charles Sheehan-Miles writes such a romantic, dramatic, heart-felt story, but he is excellent at it and can count me as a fan.  This is saying a lot, because I DO NOT LIKE to read romance books by MALE writers.  I usually find their female characters missing any depth of emotion and the loves scenes, shallow.  But not this author! (honestly, I had to check his author page to confirm he was a guy; I was so impressed).Just like her sister Alex, Julia Thompson was a wonderfully fleshed out character that was just as emotionally wounded as Dylan was in JRTB.  She ran away from relationships after being betrayed and abused by her family, her best friend and her first love.  She was unable to trust, to love and to be loved, so when Crank, the lead singer of the band Morbid Obesity fell hard for her, she panicked and ran.Crank had his own emotional scars that kept girls at arm's length.  Oh, he would sleep with a different one any night of the week, but he was careful never to make any commitments to any of them.  He was the first one to be shocked by his intense feelings for Julia, but was quick to accept that he wanted her and only her.  He was tired of "being alone in a crowded room".  Crank's home life was filled with a loving family that had trouble with mental illnesses that caused strained relationships and absentee parenting.  The result was a rebellious Crank who was finally tired of being angry.Julia and Crank were puzzle pieces meant to fit so perfectly together.  It took awhile to realize they were part of the same puzzle, but when they finally come together, the picture is perfect.  This is a beautiful love story involving two bleeding souls who heal themselves and each other.  I loved it and will be anticipating the next installment in the Thompson Sister's Series.Would I/Did I buy it? YesWould I read it again? Yes!Would I recommend it to friends? Yes!

Listen, if you love reading Bride Magazine and House Beautiful, then you will love this book.  As the title would suggest, this book is about PLANNING for a wedding and it goes into DETAIL about the cake flavors, wedding dress styles, furniture to buy for the new home, etc.  I have to admit, my personality is the same as Joie's on this (she let Riley plan it ALL) so I skipped those parts (which was a good portion of the book. Additionally, Riley and his boyfriend's romance, which we really saw blossoming in book two, is the main feature in The Wedding Blitz and I am more a fan of Joie and Hawkins' dealing with her pregnancy or Lizzie and Warren's messed up life after his sister died.  Now that would have been interesting to read!Honestly, I loved, loved, loved book one, Foolish Games, thought Time Out was just OK, but am so glad that The Wedding Blitz was free (Prime membership).  I love the character's personalities, but NOTHING really happened in this story and I was really disappointed that there was no adventure in this one. Yes, there were some twists and some new characters, but no real drama.  I know I will be bombarded by "not helpful" votes by Speigel fans everywhere, but I would want an honest, non-biased opinion if I was paying for this book and if your are not a Bride Magazine fan, you will probably find this book flat.Would I/Did I buy it? No Prime MembershipWould I read it again?  NoWould I recommend it to friends? Maybe to Readers of Bride Magazine

Sorry, I am just going to have to be in the minority on this one as I like an alpha male and Seth is not even close.  To be honest, I didn't really like any of the characters in this story and although it was similar to Rock Me by Cherri Lynn, the characters were just not as likeable.Seth is, in my opinion, a wimp who is incapable of fighting for Devi.  He listens to what everyone else tells him to do and just lets things happen.  Devi isn't any better because she is too forgiving and accepting of Seth and lets him come in and out of her life.  The casual kisses Seth is always giving her are just creepy.  Seth's My Misery Muse band members are immature and selfish and Devi's friends are just awful, blaming her for Seth's departures and the eventual bad press. Finally, I have yet to meet a two year old able to talk that maturely and have so much understanding.There were parts I did like: family loyalty, faithfulness, good parenting, Drake's possessiveness and readiness to defend his sister, and the alternating POV's give it more flesh and helps the reader know what is really going on, but there wasn't enough drama to keep the story interesting or reasons enough for Seth's departures.The story involves rough sex, body piercings, tattoos and drinking/drugs use by a band member.  Language (gd, f-word), descriptive rough sex and some editing problems (missing words, bad spellings, etc)Would I/Did I buy it? Yes (.99)Would I read it again?  NoWould I recommend it to friends? Sure

The product description sounded really good, so for .99, I thought I would take a chance on this author I had never read before.  It is always a risk, but this one paid off for me and, in the end, I thought it was a deal.  If you liked Unmaking Hunter Kennedy  by Anne Eliot, or Rock and a Hard Place by Angie Stanton, then this story will appeal to you also.Beautiful, high school senior, Natalee (Nat) has just meet the rock brothers Demetri and Alec from the band AD2 who are now going to her school.  She has an immediate connection with the brooding older brother Alec, but Demetri goes for her first and she foolishly relents to his advances.  The boys are on a year hiatus from performing to finish school and take a needed brake, but they have more secrets than they are letting out.  When Nat realizes her feelings for Alec won't go away and that Alec appears to like her too, she becomes confused.  Add to that Demetri's inability to stay sober or loyal and his constant suspicions that Alec holds Nat's affections and you have TROUBLE.Nat is a fun character to read about and the brothers, though troubled, are swoon-worthy.  While they both are in love with Nat, only one truly is right for her and the other one gets his own story called "Pull, A Seaside Novel" next.  There is not a lot of high emotional drama, just a good, funny at times, scary at others story.  The secret the boys are hiding is bad and hurtful, and it seems to be repeating itself in a way.This was really fun to read even if it was the overdone story of a girl falling for brothers.  Rachel Van Dyken is an entertaining writer who kept me turning the pages way past midnight.  I am normally not a triangle fan (especially brothers!) but since there was no sleeping around (which I think is really gross when brothers are involved), I was ok with it this time. Triangles are still not my favorite, but I really enjoyed Rachel Van Dyken's writing and would read more from her in the future.No Swearing or sex; but there was intense kissing, drug and alcohol use and sleepoversWould I/Did I buy it? Yes (.99)Would I read it again?  ProbablyWould I recommend it to friends? Yes

This was a somewhat depressing story about a young girl who has loved only two men in her life and one more than the other.  After breaking it off after three years with Tommy, Megan is back home working at her family's law firm.  Her long time love, Shane, suddenly needs a place to stay and cannot stay at his girlfriend, Allison's place.  Naturally, he turns to his long time friend Megan and she agrees, knowing how difficult it will be to live with the guy she is in love with.  Of course, they finally get together, but he is called away at all hours of the day and night and after her house is vandalized, her mother's house is broken into and her policeman brother is shot in a drug bust, Megan is starting to think something might be up.  Then her ex boyfriend and FBI agent Tommy tells her Shane is bad news but she defends him and throws Tommy out of her house.  Just one bad thing after another happens.***Spoiler?***My main problem with this book is that we are told that Shane loves Megan but never see any evidence of him doing anything other than using her.  He is not an honorable guy to begin with and his apathy towards Megan's love life over the years and his own flaunting of girls in front of her does not predispose one to believe that he has always loved her.  This makes the book a lot less romantic and really just a book about a girl who makes bad choices when it comes to men.  Honestly, Megan is just clueless (so are a lot of other characters if they didn't know Shane was dealing drugs) and purposely ignores her instincts.  I found this frustrating and disappointing.Would I/Did I buy it? Free DownloadWould I read it again?  Probably notWould I recommend it to friends? Not Really

Do you ever look at the reviews and wonder if everyone is giving a story five stars because of the subject matter (no one wants to look like they approve of abuse/bullied/suicide)?  After reading the first couple of chapters, I wanted to return this book for a refund.  The characters seemed identical to the ones in Tiffany King's book, Wishing for Someday Soon: abused, neglected and sarcastic (but not suicidal?) girl is rescued by handsome, athletic, caring and rich boy in true Cinderella fashion.  Add suicidal and you have the same story.I know suicide, abuse and bullying are really hot topics right now and a lot of YA books are addressing this serious issue.  In this book, King blames religious hypocrisy, homophobia, sexual deviancy by so-called religious leaders and bad parenting. The hero, Dean's family represents perfection  (I have never seen a family that perfect- except on TV) and Madison's family represents dysfunction (which is the fault of religious hypocrisy).The story is somewhat mundane (think afterschool special) as we watch Madison who was bent on killing herself, come out of her shell, leave her suicide partner James behind and blossom into her own person because the hot Dean (and his perfect family) pays attention to her.  Oddly, Dean, who should be super popular because he is a star basketball player, never seems to have anyone around him but Madison and there is no jealous girl wanting to do Madison harm.  Madison is suicidal because she was brought up by parents whose religious hypocrisy prevented them from showing her love?.  While religious hypocrisy and parents who rule their houses with "the stick of religion" are a fact, her mother Donna's problems are way beyond her religious convictions.  Ironically, while Madison's father (who by the end of the story has since rejected his religious ways and declares that he never loved Donna) is given a clean slate, poor Donna is left in her religious hell and culpable for all Madison's past abuses.Maybe it's because I am a mother that I can see Donna's inability to love Madison as she should to be more than just bad parenting and religious fanaticism.  Obviously, Donna has been damaged herself and could benefit from her own story being told. My guess is that Donna's own father abandoned her and she was sexually promiscuous as a teenager trying to find her father's love in random men.  When she got pregnant with Madison, she resentfully married the father and turned to religion to find forgiveness and acceptance.  Unhappily married to a man who didn't love her, she escaped from her life by seeking approval within the church and keeping herself from the joys of motherhood she didn't think she was worthy of because of her past behavior.  We all have history's that shed light on who we are and why we behave the way we do.  Madeline's own behavior would shadow a lot of her own mother's just from genetics alone.  So while Donna honestly needs help, it is not her religious beliefs or actions that are to blame for her bad parenting, but her own life experiences and bad choices.So yes, I know I am going to get a lot of zero votes from Tiffany King's loyal fans (the first 14 reviews I read were from self proclaimed "I will read anything she writes and love it" fans, but I do not think this story is worthy of 5 stars.  Blaming militant religious practices, rehashing the same story and adding a suicide watch to it and making her "savior" too perfect to be real, made this story un-enjoyable and a disappointment for me.Would I/Did I buy it? Yes (1.99)Would I read it again?  Probably notWould I recommend it to friends? Sure, I'm obviously am in the minority

Not only is this such a beautifully crafted bracelet, it also provides pain relief too.  I am a writer and a photographer, so my wrists and fingers get quite a workout at times and I have noticed that the past couple years I have developed pain in my right(dominant) wrist that have set me back for a week or more at a time and wearing it on my right wrist has provided a lot of comfort in the past month.I am a little curious though on how it works, as the accompanying literature lacks the 'science' behind it.  Do you wear it on the affected wrist and it only benefits that wrist? Or that side of the body?  Does it benefit the body as a whole? And if so, how?This bracelet is constructed very well, though it would be nice to see it in an inch or two larger.  Not everyone is blessed with nice, small petite wrists. I prefer my bracelets to sit mid-wrist, not just below my wrist bone.Other than these few 'minor' details, I am really impressed with this bracelet, and have given it five stars and my recommendation.  From literally out of the box in the nice velveteen pouch to a month later, I am still being 'wowed' by this bracelet!I received this complimentary in exchange for my honest review.

This is too adorable!  It will fit a newborn to a year-old size baby girl perfectly.  It is the perfect photography prop for a photographer or for parents too. This is the second time I have purchased this particular deodorant from Kiss My Face and I have had the same experience.  I love the benefits of it but it smells moldy, musty, and mildewy!  Smells disgusting and putrid!  Has anyone else had this issue?  I have never, ever had a deodorant smell this bad right out of the box or a Patchouli scented product smell of this.  I have tossed this after the first couple of uses because the strong smell of mold & mildew and it makes me think that I am dirty after putting it on.  I cannot help but think it must be the product only because I have bought the product from two totally different, unrelated sellers on two totally different, unrelated sites.  If anyone else has experienced this, please reply.But if it smells great to you and you also reap the benefits of all day freshness, please don't let this one review deter you from purchasing this deodorant!  Kiss My Face has high quality, trusted, and organic products that I would recommend everyday till I am blue in the face to use.  This is the only product I have ever had an issue with and it is just on the scent.  Kiss My Face is truly one of the top 5 leaders in organic and natural toiletry products.  They are also a great value too.Thanks.

The sound quality is amazing on here but that's all I can really comment on as the instructions were printed in Chinese or Japanese or something and I don't know anything about microphones.  What is that circular thing?  What are the other parts on the microphone that aren't on a standard microphone?  I can almost guarantee that 99% of the clientele that will purchase this microphone are going to be English speaking individuals.  Instructions need be printed in English because more of the world's' population speak English, you are selling on Amazon US and selling it in the United States, regardless or not of the origin country of the microphone.  I would love to be able to make full use of it, but since I cannot read  the instructions, it will probably end up being shelved.I received this product complimentary in exchange for my honest review.

I didn't notice any weight loss nor size change whilst taking this product although I did notice that my appetite did decline. Maybe you need to take more than one bottle ??? The flat cable is just amazing because it doesn't tangle and I can mold it around things or I can even shorten it up if I don't happen to need all ten feet at that time. Having two in one pack at this very inexpensive value pack is just amazing because I can have one in the living room and one in my office so I don't have to worry about transporting cables or remembering to bring one out, etc. Plus these cables charge just as well if not better than the one that originally came with my phone. These would make great gifts too because it never hurts to have backups, especially for the kids. This is definitely a great value and not one to pass up.I received these complimentary in exchange for my honest opinion.

This comes in 8 8x10 pre-cut squares so if you don't want to use it as a wall planner or simply don't have the space, you can divide it for wherever you wish to post it or use it in an entirely different manner. I love these socks.  I wear a women's size 11 and these socks fit great.  I really like how they come in darker colors because not only do I love darker colors but they also don't show the dirt.  They are comfortable to wear and they are breathable, but not thin but very durable.  I wear them all the time now.  They aren't bulky nor are they itchy or scratchy.  I like how they are low-cut and very versatile too.  I am not crazy about the price, but.  I would definitely recommend these though.  I do like how every order of socks that I have received from here come nicely presented in a box.  Now that's class!I received these complimentary in exchange for my honest opinion.

These Google Cardboard 3D lenses were easy to assemble and we ended up taping them together.  They feel very sturdy and my phone, an HTC One m7, fits great.  The QR code scans very well too.  There are a limited number of games available for Google Cardboard on the market thus far.  I haven't played any games yet but I did download an movie trailer and it scared the bejeesus out of me.  The functionality of the cardboard is pretty good.  I am thinking that maybe they should add an adjustable strap that goes about your head.  If you're playing for an extended period of time, your hands and arms are going to get tired from holding them up.  It was kinda weird to put them on for the first time, but you get used to them after a few minutes.  If you wear glasses, you have to wear them while you are using these.  It doesn't appear clear whether you are farsighted nor nearsighted.  There are many up and coming opportunities with these.  Not only are more apps in development, if you're an app developer, you can make apps for these too.  I think these are really kool to play around with and I totally recommend these.I received these complimentary in exchange for my honest review.

It took us a while to find a light fixture in our home that would accommodate this bulb.  The lamp is a little desk lamp and the bulb sticks out of the top a little bit, but it fits in the base.  It is super brights and provides ample light to do plenty of reading by.  I think this would be perfect as a night light bulb too, but it looks like it may be a chandler bulb too.  It's a very durable bulb and the light is super bright, which is great in an apartment that doesn't have a lot of windows nor that doesn't receive a lot of sunlight nor natural light.  This light bulb is amazing and definitely very unique and a great buy too.

This tutu is perfect for a newborn photo prop.  It's durable and fits great too.  It's also as cute as a button.  It's perfect for a photographer at any level or even for parents with newborns too.  The material is super soft, so it won't irritate baby.  This is a must-have for a photographer to have in their toolbox for props.I received this complimentary in exchange for my honest review.

My husband and I both love this speaker. It's so amazing! The sound that it puts out is rich, deep, and crystal clear, even with the volume turned all the way up. We haven't had a single problem connecting it to either of our HTC One phones. I use it daily to listen to my podcasts. The rubber casing is great because I've actually dropped it a couple times and it hasn't dented nor has it broken. What durability! The flashlight burns brightly too! And the range is pretty far too. I actually took it into two rooms away from my phone, which were separated by at least two walls, and it still worked great. All of these wonderful characterics make this speaker very rugged, so I give it my full recommendation. We have two other bluetooth speakers that we thought were pretty awesome before we got this, but now actually pale in comparison to this one. The battery life is really great too. I only need to charge it every four or five days. In the box, it contains the charging cord, the speaker, and the instruction booklet. I would recommend buying this speaker over all the other ones.I received this complimentary in exchange for my honest review.

This is a good, durable clothesline.  Will hold a light to medium heavy load.  I prefer to use clothespins on this line, unlike the hangers they have pictured. You could even use it in your home, like in the basement or even in the laundry room, if you have the space to put it up.I received this complimentary in exchange for a honest review.

I really love how this screen protector came presented in a nice looking book thing.  What presentation!  When using this glass screen protector on my phone, I have assurance that I have even more protection to my screen from scratches and even cracks if I happen to bump or God forbid, drop my phone. This cable is at a perfect length.  It does not kink nor tangle up.  This looks and feels like a durable cable that will stand the test of time.  It charges my iphone extremely fast too. It does all that it advertises.  I highly recommend this screen protector plus it is also at a great price too.I received this complimentary in exchange for my honest review.

These steel strainers are really pretty kool.  They are quite durable as the mesh is attached well underneath the metal and will not come apart.  There are three different sizes so you have the right sizes for all sorts of jobs.  They are easy to clean as well too.  The smallest one is perfect to strain your tea in too.  I love how there are little hooks on all three of them, which is perfect for me, because I hung them off the wall on one of our cupboards.  I use the strainers for all sorts of things from straining oil back into the bottle to straining homemade applesauce.  This is a great deal as well because usually you only find one sold individually, not a set of three. This dashboard holder securely holds your phone to your dashboard so you can enjoy your music or use your GPS in your car.  It securely holds your phone in the grips.  We found that it would not stick to our dashboard so we ended up putting it up on our windshield, which it holds securely.  This is a durable product and I highly recommend it.  This holds both out HTC One m7 and HTC One phones very tightly and secure in its gripes so we can safely use it whilst driving and riding.I received this complimentary in exchange for my honest review.

These socks are very nice looking and they fit my size 11 feet as well as my husband's size 10 feet well.  The material they are made of feel nice on your feet and feel durable and fit nicely on your feet.  The colors and subtle pattern are attractive.  They go well with dress shoes or sneakers as well.  I have worn them with a number of different of styles of outfits and they look sharp with all of them.  The price is a little high though.  But otherwise they are very nice socks.I received these complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

I love this shemagh.  It's not the best quality but it could be worse.  I use it a lot when I am out of doors, in the woods, taking pictures.  I wrap it round my head like a scarf to keep the gnats away from my face and brow so I am not constantly swatting at them.  Very annoying and distracting when I am trying to focus on my photography.  Plus it is great to wipe sweat off of one's brow.  I have worn it a time or two as a scarf with a shirt during the fall and winter.  It's pretty trendy. I see a lot of ladies and men wearing them as a fashion accessories(besides the real tradition behind wearing them).  It's pretty durable as long as your not using it for anything heavy duty, then you might as well spend $30+ on a real one.  This one washes pretty well on the gentle cycle in my washer, then I hang it to dry.  I wouldn't run it through the dryer.  God knows what might happen to it.  I would recommend this one.

I love to do embroidery when I have a few moments to myself(hahaha) which is quite rare because I always have so much going on.  But when I do have time, I prefer hot iron patterns because they're so much easier to follow instead of doing it free-hand and I always turn to Aunt Martha's patterns.  When I was looking at the selection of patterns online here at Amazon and saw that they have horse patterns, I shrieked and my heart lept with joy because my entire family and I are life-long equestrians and horse-lovers.  I ordered this pattern and I have yet to be disappointed by any pattern I have gotten from Aunt Martha's.  The patterns are always clear, and they transfer so nicely too.  Embroidery is a dying art.  More young girls should be taught by their elders to embroider before the skill dies with them.  My Grandma taught me the basics when I was learning to sew with her when I was a young girl and I am now 32 years of age.  When we adopt, I will teach our daughter to embroider.  Anyway, this is a great pattern and I highly recommend this over all over competitors.

This has got to be one of my favorite handbag brands and I especially love their wristlets.  I love this one in particular because it is small enough to grab and go when you just need to run with your cash, cards, and phone and do not want to bother with dragging your whole handbag with you.  This is my second wristlet from them, although I do not have it anymore, as my 16-year-old baby sister eyed it when I went home earlier this year and declared how darling it was and she would love one, so I just gave her mine and I ended up buying another one for myself.  Frankly, between you, me, and the wall(and I suppose Amazon too) it isn't so much the brand name, it's that charming little polo pony, as my whole family and I are life-long equestrians and horse lovers ;)

These Loew Cornell Woodsies No-Roll Slotted Clothespins were quite suited for the craft I needed them for.  They were durable, sanded down, and contained no marrs nor splinters.  They were good quality clothespins that are great for crafts but they are not for hanging the laundry out though, which is fine.  I would highly recommend these particular clothespins for any craft, particularly for clothespin dolls, which I make out of these.

Some pros:  The color is a very light beige, almost neutral, so it goes with any outfit.  It can be paired with almost any outfit from dressed down jeans to a skirt and top.  It is very roomy that you can carry a 11" tablet plus your other purse necessities(like your wallet, a hair brush, a coin purse, coupon holder thingy, etc.) with room to spare in it and the straps hold tight.  The purse is made of some imitation durable material that will hold.  The straps on the side are adjustable if you do wish to adjust them.Some cons:  It doesn't come with a long shoulder strap and the straps that it does come with are way too small to loop over your shoulders.  I ended up buying a separate longer shoulder strap off of Ebay.  It's a weird looking handbag.  It's not for everyone.  It is really eclectic and very original though, I have to give it that.I do enjoy handbags and I have a few of them and this was a great addition to my small collection.  I think it was a great buy.  This is definitely not something that you would ever see in the store.  It is just an amazing design.  Not mainstream in the least.This is a truly unique purse.  I think it is a really great purse for the right person.  It is certainly a good match for one who carries a bigger bag, like myself.  I definitely recommend it for a lady who likes unique handbags and a bigger handbag as well too.  I would recommend purchasing longer straps though if you prefer more of a shoulder kind of bag as I do.

I love how this Retseliney Exfoliant Cream is incredibly gentle, unlike 99% other exfoliant creams I have used in the past. Very cute watch! It keeps the time.  Compliments almost any outfit. If you take a lot of photos with your mobile phone, then they s tripod adapter is great for the everyday photographer to the professional photographer. This is the first time I have ever used a fractionated coconut oil.  I have been using organic refined coconut oil for a few years now, but I like this better for skin applications.  It goes on lighter and it absorbs so much quicker and I think it keeps my skin moisturized even longer than any skin product that I ever used.  I really like to put it on after I have shaved because it keeps my freshly shaven skin protect from any irritations as I have very sensitive skin.  This is perfect for those that have sensitive skin and/or skin issues too.  I have dermatitis on the back of my arms that sometimes spreads above my elbows from allergies stemming from dish soaps to shower gels to environmental to the city water and I have used this now for a couple of weeks and it has cleared it right up and kept it at bay.  I get patches of dry skin too and it has cleared those patches up too.  You only need a little bit of this oil to cover a large portion of wherever you are apply it and it comes in a huge bottle so it should last you a good period of time.  I wish a pump would be provided because it would make the application so much nicer.  Not only can you use this 'neat',  this coconut oil would also make a good basis for a lotion as well.  Add some shea butter, a drop or two of vitamin E, perhaps four drops of your favorite essential oil, and you would have some very high-end, moisturizing, organic lotion.  I use this daily, especially after washing my hands constantly, after doing dishes, after showers, or just because.  I highly recommend this.  Not only do you get a huge portion for you money, but you know you are a getting a premium and honest, to goodness product for you money.  Always remember that what you put on your skin also goes into you body too, so you don't want to put a product on that is loaded with chemicals, you'll want to stick with something that is all-natural and organic to keep you and your body safe.***Update 14 August 2015*** After contacting seller about not receiving a pump, they shipped it out to me super fast, so if you didn't receive one, contact them and they will be more than happy to get one out to you ASAP.Having a pump is great.  You have much better control over how much of the oil comes out and less mess.  What a great addition to this already awesome product!I received this complimentary in exchange for my honest review.

I wish they had these when I was still in high school when I suffered more acne breakouts then I do now!  On the occasions that I do experience breakouts, they are not as bad as they were in my teens, but these are extremely helpful for anyone of any age because everyone gets a breakout, even occasionally. Just wash your face as you usually do before you go to bed, put this tiny little 'dot' on afterwards to wear overnight, and in the morning, it has literally sucked most of the life out of the pimple and decreased its size by 80%. I did not buy from this particular listing, but I bought this from Radio Shack when it first came out in the late 1990s.  I remember I saw it in Radio Shack's flyer in the Sunday paper and I had to save my money for a couple of weeks before I was able to afford it.  I was still in high school then and no other kid in school had anything like this and this used to get passed around in class and everyone put their numbers in it and put notes in it and stuff.  Everyone loved it.  It was fun and surprisingly easy to use right out of the package.  Plus it came with a battery too.  I never had a problem with it then.  It operated well and kept my young, adolescent life organized and work exactly as described.  But eventually, when I got my first cell phone a couple of years later, it got phased out and went into storage.  I actually just found here a few days ago and the battery was dead, which is to be expected, some 13+ years later.  I have purchased another battery for it and I am going to put it in when it arrives and see if it still works.  I am assuming and hoping since it worked the last time I used it, it will work.  At the very least, it will be interested to see what information is still stored on it from way back then.  But then again, things that sit for a long period of time have a tendency to expire once turned back on again.

This was the first time I have ever tried such a product as this.  I did not care for this drink mix in the least.  I followed the directions to make it up correctly, but it did not dissolve and I ended up with a chunky, gritty nasty tasting drink. I do not doubt the claims of the ingredients on the package and I believe that some people like something like this and other people don't. You cannot go wrong with a stylus, promotional grade or not.  Regardless or not if they say 'Fenix' or whatever on them, a stylus is something that is a necessity on my life.  I loathe when I have to constantly clean someone's fingerprints off any of my device's touchscreens.  A three pack of these were quite welcome and very useful.  They are a perfect length and width, built touch with durability and quality.  Plus they work on all of my devices- HTC One m7, Nexus 10 Tablet, and Nook Color.  Plus, they come in a variety of colors in this three pack at a great price too.  The little cleaning cloth is a nice touch too.I received this product complimentary in exchange for my honest review.

This is my second pair of bluetooth wireless hands-free headphones and I just adore this style.  I love how there are no strings coming from your phone anymore and you are not tethered to your phone any longer.  If I am bumming around the house or outside, I usually have my phone on my arm in my armband or if I am sitting in one place, I usually have my phone plugged into my wireless charger.  The range is pretty good on these.  I go into the next room without any interruption but if I go any further, my headphones start flipping out.  They connected fast and easy to my HTC One m7.  These headphones came perfectly packaged together with some very brief instructions(that you really don't need) and a compatible charger.  Included on the headphones are forward and backward buttons for your music, on/off button for the headphones, and to switch between music and calls.  Unfortunately, there is no volume buttons like on my other wireless headphones.  But no biggie!  What really bugs me is the blue light that constantly flashes whilst I have my headphones on.  It is really discreetly annoying and I see it out of the corner of my eye.  But despite those two minor annoyances, these headphones produces high quality sound, the earbuds fit perfectly(which is a big issue with me because my one ear canal is deformed and much smaller than everyone else's so I need a much smaller size than normal) and the earbuds surprisingly fit snug and stay in, and the headphones fit well around my neck and stay put.  All in all, these are a great set off wireless headphones that I highly recommend, plus they are at a great price too!I received these complimentary in exchange for my honest review.

This is a nice little ring.  It is cute.  I just wish that it was adjustable all round like a real adjustable ring, not just halfway.  Otherwise, it fits alright and it looks nice.  Shipping took about two weeks.

My phone fit great even though I have an Otterbox case on my phone.  This is great for a beginner or amateur photographer, such as myself, or an amateur videographer.  This monopod is also priced right too.  It isn't bulky, it is light in your hand, perhaps a little too light but it seems to hold anyway.  I am really satisfied with this and I recommend this selfie stick.I received this product complimentary in exchange for my honest review.

I love how Kaeng Raeng After Glow Moisturizing Facial Serum includes all the oils that are amazing for your skin. Though this has a consistency of an essential oil, this facial serum goes on non-greasy and absorbs quickly into your skin. With all those wonderful oils mixed together, this serum smells wonderful, not overpowering, and lightly lingers upon your skin for several hours. Your face feels moisturized and looks vibrant and youthful afterwards. My skin stills feels amazing and looks into the next day too. This is my second product from Kaeng Raeng and I am still getting blown away by the quality and the effectiveness of their products. I love how all of their products are vegan, gluten-free, cruelty, and chemical free too. I definitely keep using this and reaping the benefits of amazing youthful Kaeng Raeng Afterglow Moisturizing Facial Serum.I receiving this complimentary in exchange for my honest review.

I used this to charge five different devices- my HTC One m7, Google Nexus 10 tablet, Nook Color, bluetooth wireless headphones, and a bluetooth watch.  I also used Foxnovo's 2.6ft 2-in-1 Lightning & Micro USB Cable to charge two devices at one.  It performed really well with two devices I first tried it on and it had come fully charged.  This isn't a very heavy batter and it is very slim, and it came with a very nice velvet protector sleeve.  It is light enough that you can throw in your handbag or overnight bag to take with you on the go.  Stranded in the woods and your phone is almost dead?  I hope you have this battery charger with you!There are 4 blue indicator lights to indicate a full charge and a convenient on/off button so you can turn the battery off to conserve it.  You can recharge this battery multiple times over again too.  This battery will also protect itself from overcharging and short circuiting too.  I really like this battery and I would recommend it.  Plus, it is backed by Foxnovo's® lifetime guarantee too.Thanks again to the wonder peoples over at Foxnovo® for letting me review this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

In the beginning there was DDR. Video game "dancing" consisted of mashing your feet to certain patterns. It was fun, it was a great workout, but at the end of the day it wasn't really dancing.Then along came Just Dance, which introduced the world to dancing to popular music using "real dance move", the kind that you could practice at home and then wow everyone with on the dance floor. It was slightly annoying that the controller accuracy was a bit off, but the dance moves were so fun we didn't care. Just Dance 2 introduced much better motion control accuracy. Plus, it introduced the concept of "duets", where people could dance cool choreographed routines together. And it was another winner. Because of the popularity of Just Dance, this spawned a lot of "copycat" titles from Ubisoft to cash in. Dance on Broadway. Michael Jackson The Experience, Just Dance for Kids. Even Just Dance with Smurfs. They were fun, but at a certain point they started to get a bit tiring, as they were all variations of the same theme.And so, we've all been waiting to see what Ubisoft would do for an encore with Just Dance 3? Could they push the genre forward, even as copycat titles on other platforms like Dance Central on the Xbox and Everybody Dance on the PS3 encroached on their turf? I'm happy to say that Just Dance 3 pushes the platform even further and does it with great success.When you start up Just Dance, the first thing it asks is if you'll connect Just Dance to the Internet so that "Ubisoft can learn more about the way you play to make Just Dance even more groovy". I wasn't sure quite how to answer the question, but I figure since Just Dance doesn't use a video camera like those other systems, there wasn't too much harm in it.The opening menu, like in Just Dance 1 and 2, is delightfully simple. There are only a couple choices:1) Dance!As with the previous versions, you just right into the dancing. What I love about Just Dance 3 is that getting started is extremely simple. No silly things to take up your time like creating avatars. No adjusting of cameras or calibrating of equipment. You just shake your remote to see what "color" you are on the screen, and get started.You can create a profile at any time; your name is limited to 5 characters. If you don't create a profile you'll be dancing by default as "Happy" (as opposed to "Sunny").As with previous version, your job is to dance the "mirror image" of a colorful silhouetted on-screen figure showing you the dance moves. I'm happy to say that the motion controls are better and more accurate than ever. Granted, it still only detects the movement of one arm holding the Wii remote, so technically you could still just hurl your arm the right way to build up points. But of course the fun of the game is to get into the dance with your full body (and in fact, if you follow the choreographed moves perfectly with your whole body, your score will be better than ever). One other subtle improvement over previous versions is that the audio cues coming through the Wii remote (for example, when you hit a milestone while dancing) are much louder and clearer than before.The choreography and backgrounds are as fun and in some cases as quirky as ever. For example, in Wilson Pickett's "Land of 1000 Dances" you're following a dancing alligator in a fancy suit dancing in a schoolroom. And yes, you "do the alligator" :) If you dance well on some songs, you can see the background animate and change.As with Just Dance 1 and 2, each song has a "technical difficulty" indicator from one to three gears, and a "workout intensity" indicate from one to three drops of sweat. There are over 45 great tracks to suit everyone's tastes, and most of the songs are popular and familiar.Multiplayer is where this game really shines. There's "Dance Crew Mode" which is like Duet Mode, except that up to 4 players has their own independent choreography (and a chance to shine with a solo performance). There's also a "Dance Til Dawn" party mode where you can just start the game up and it'll cycle through songs all night, without the need to go back through menus again.2) Just SweatAs someone who follows Wii exercise titles very closely, this option was the one I was most excited about. You can choose from a "Free Session" (an instant fitness session for up to 4 players) or the "7-Day Challenge" (A selection of challenges to boost your fitness during 7 days).For "Free Session" You can choose from a variety of options for the kind of music to work out to, including:Speed ShuffleNon-Stop ShufflePop! Pop!Rock PartyR&B VibesElectro SoundsJust 80'sOldies but GoodiesFancy Dress BallAround the WorldExtremeSweat AttackThere are also fantastic options for working out in a group, including:DuetsDance CrewI tried Sweat Attack, and sure enough I was sweating up a storm after just one song. The songs kept going and the more points I collected (in both Dance and Just Sweat modes), the more a "Mojo" meter filled up. Each time the "Mojo Meter" was full, it unlocked a "gift" of another game mode, song, or choreography (the first to be unlocked is Simon Says Mode). There are 27 "gifts" to unlock, which will definitely motivate you to keep coming back and building up those points. The songs in my case before I collapsed of exhaustion were Cee Lo Green's "Forget You", The Black Eyed Peas' "Pump It", Anja's "Dance all Night", Wilson Pickett's "Land of 1000 Dances", and appropriately, C&C Music Factory's Gonna Make You Sweat (Everybody Dance Now)..all very energetic and lively (and fun) songs.As in the Dance mode, you rack up points when you hit the right dance moves. In addition, as with Just Dance 2, they don't count calories for some reason, but rather, they count "sweat points". With Just Dance 2, the consensus on the Web was that 4.2 sweat points = about 1 calorie burned, and it seems about the same with Just Dance 3. In all honesty, I'm not sure why they didn't just use calories, which would have made things a lot easier. But still, as long as you do the math in your head, you can pretty much figure out how intensive a workout you're getting (since each song earns you about 400-500 sweat points, it'll take about 25-30 vigorous songs to reach 3500 calories, or 1 pound of fat lost). As you reach certain points, the system will give you an indication of how much exercise you've done (after completing 1000 sweat points, it told me "You've just walked across Central Park"; after 2000 points, it said "you've just run 10 rounds of the Wembley Stadium").For "7-Day Challenge" you're presented with three options for the next 7 days: The Fresh Start (3500 sweat points a week, the equivalent of walking 30 minutes a day), The Healthy Choice (7000 sweat points a week, equivalent to running 30 minutes a day), and The Sweat Explosion (21000 sweat points a week, equivalent to swimming for 30 minutes a day).Overall, I loved Just Sweat mode, but I would have liked to see the ability to chart my progress over days and weeks. Still, it's a great improvement over previous versions and definitely one of the best workouts you can have on the Wii.3) StoreThis is where you can purchase downloadable content (DLC) if your Wii is connected to the Internet. As of this writing (October 8, 2011), the store contained only the following songs:- Baby Don't Stop Now (Anja)- Jambo Mambo (Old Orquesta)- Soul Searchin (Groove Century)- Twist and Shake It (The Girly Team)But a bunch of empty icons indicates that there are more coming soon. Each song costs 250 Wii Points, so if you buy a 2000 point card for about $20, this comes out to about $2.50 a song.4) ExtrasThis is where you can adjust options, such as whether to display lyrics, display pictograms (the icons telling you what move to make), display help screens, and track usage. You can also view the medals you earned.I think one of the questions most people will have on their mind is: is Just Dance 3 on the Wii still relevant when there are so many new "real dance move" games out for systems like the Xbox 360 and Playstation 3. My answer is a resounding "yes". Not only does Just Dance 3 hold its own in terms of fun and accuracy--it actually has an advantage over those other systems. While those systems force players to squeeze into a camera view of 6 feet across, with Just Dance, players can stand anywhere in the room, and it doesn't even matter if there are spectators or "dancers without controllers" standing among them.Long story short, I think Ubisoft has taken a great franchise and moved it even further. Just Dance 3 for the Wii is another winner.

Back in 2008, the game "My Fitness Coach" was released to great fanfare. It was the first exercise game for the Wii, and paved the way for dozens of successors, both good and bad (and ugly).There have been a few excellent exercise games. Wii Fit introduced the Balance Board. EA Sports Active 2 introduced activities which make working out more fun and interactive. Exerbeat and Walk It Out introduced video gaming elements to exercise.But since My Fitness Coach there really hasn't been a game on the Wii which has captured the feeling of a real "personal trainer", the kind you spend money see at the gym. Too often, the on-screen personas seem far too artificial. They'll look cartoony on-screen and they'll yell the same platitudes and beratings to you over and over again (yes, I'm talking to you, cartoon Jillian Michaels).When you start Get Fit with Mel B, you'll be asked for your name, your gender, your date of birth, your height, and your "build". As with the original My Fitness Coach, you can choose the environment you work out in (Central Park, The Maldives, Infinity Pool, Forest Meadow, Apartment, or Luxury Yacht). Unlike that game, photorealistic video images are used (which are of surprisingly good quality for the Wii).Finally, you can choose up to two goals from various categories, including General Health, Lifestyle, Special Occasions, Sports and Activities, and Shape. Once you do this, the system will create a daily workout for you to meet your goals.Get Fit with Mel B in many ways feels like the true successor to the original My Fitness Coach. Like My Fitness Coach, each workout consists of individual calisthenics and aerobics exercises strung together. In typical workouts, you'll do 5-20 reps of each exercise before moving on to the next one. Exercises fall under two general categories: the first category consists of typical cardio fitness moves, from push-ups to lunges to crunches to curls to rows. The second category consists of aerobics workouts (step, combat, dance, cardio, or advanced cardio). If you bought a Balance Board for step aerobics but were always disappointed by Wii Fit's weak "plink, plink, plink" step aerobics, you'll love how they use the Balance Board here.A video image of Mel B will demonstrate each move to you, and very clearly call out how to do the move. On screen, you'll see how many reps you've done and how many there are to go. Of all the aerobics games that have come out, very few have really captured the feeling of having a real "personal trainer". But here, I felt that the computerized Mel B was just as clear in her demonstration and description of the exercise to mimic a real trainer.The game options are pretty simple. You can do Today's Workout which is a set number of exercises for 30 minutes. You can also choose a standard workout (customizing the length), or you can even create your own custom workout by stringing individual exercises together. A menu option called "Practice" lets you practice individual exercises if you're having difficulty with any one of them.There's a section called "Challenges" which are intensive groups of exercises where you're pushed to complete a set of themed exercise routines (Dance, Abs Attack, Legs of Steel, Fighting Fit, or Cardio Test) within a certain period of time. I would have liked to see this section be a little more "fun" and interactive, but it's really not much different than the standard workouts, just a bunch of tougher ones strung together.There's also a section called "Nutrition" which contains recipes. Unless your Wii is in the kitchen, this section really isn't going to be very useful for you, although I like the sentiment of reminding us to eat healthy in addition to the workout.Unlike the Playstation or the upcoming Xbox version, there is NO support for a video camera image of yourself next to Mel B. Having said that, I didn't really miss not having a video image all that much. Like I said, the on-screen rendition of Mel B is pretty clear, and the vocal instructions she shouts are very understandable and easy to follow.As for the accuracy of the controls, the game does use the Balance Board for certain exercises, and for most exercises it uses the Wii MotionPlus. But by now we all know that because it's a Wii, the controls are not the most precise in the world. Most exercises will err on the side of being generous in "awarding" you accuracy points, and of course, it's easy to "cheat" by moving your hands but not the rest of your body. Of course, if you want to get the most out of the workout, accuracy points aren't the most important thing--the most important thing is doing the exercise.Long story short, if you're looking for a simulation of a real personal trainer working out with you at a gym, in many ways Get Fit with Mel B comes closer than any other game since the original My Fitness Coach. Given the paucity of new fitness titles for Fall 2011, Get Fit with Mel B is a great choice if you're looking for something a little new and different, especially if you enjoy cardio and aerobic sessions at the gym.

When the early inventors of the automobile showed their invention to the public, I'm sure they were scoffed. Why would I deal with this ugly, smelly, smoke-guzzling monstrosity when I have a perfectly good horse?When I look at the early reviews of Kung-Fu Live by the game press, the same thought comes to mind. Back when the game was launched it was soundly panned by most of the gaming "media elite". But a funny thing happened. When you look at those same sites, the "critic reviews" are all bad, but the "user reviews" are all glowing.I downloaded the demo version from the Playstation Store. Within five minutes of my playing it, I knew I had to have this game. I bought it instantly.Kung Fu Live is a revolutionary game in many ways. First, it introduces to the PS3 something it never had before--Kinect-like capabilities where you use your body as a controller (that's right, no DualShock OR Move controller necessary--it just uses the Playstation Eye to detect your movements). Your on-screen character kicks when you kick and punches when you punch.Ah, the on-screen character. The on-screen character is YOU. Not a cartoon version of you, not an avatar, but your actual video image. The game basically as a Street Fighter-like interface in which villains come at you, and you literally punch and kick them into submission. As the game progresses you learn new "moves" like power punching, flips, and blocks, all which are done with very intuitive body movements.This was one of those games which I couldn't stop playing, even though I was exhausted. There's something very cathartic about breaking through the TV screen and fighting for real versus fighting by mashing buttons. And by the end of my playing, I had a pretty intense cardio workout.Cut scenes between levels take you through some beautifully drawn comic book art. An interesting (and hilarious) bonus is that they'll take pictures of YOU in various poses and drop them right into the comic book.I suspect the cause for some of the negative reviews is that the reviewers didn't go through the proper process for setting up the game. Your room needs to be lit very, very well, and your clothes should contrast with the background wall and furniture (for best results, play against a blank dark wall with light clothes or vice-versa).During setup, you can select from some pre-defined settings, or you can fine-tune your picture using advanced settings. You basically need to configure the system so your body shows through but the background does not. You won't get your picture perfect--after all, the game is trying to do things the system was never designed to do. I had my best results in the daytime in a room with bright natural sunlight; attempts to set up at night with shadows and lamps was much more challenging.All in all, once I got the game set up reasonably well, it was one of the best active games I've played on any platform--ironic that it's only $15. If you have a PS3, I definitely encourage you to download the demo and give it a try. I suspect that in ten years, we'll have this kind of virtual reality in a lot of video games where your image is literally immersed as part of the action. I think we'll be able to look at games like Kung Fu Live as ones that broke the old paradigm and were pioneers to a whole new kind of gaming.

I admit, I came to this game with low expectations, having just played the not-very-strong Wii version of this game. But the very things that made the Wii version so weak are what makes the Playstation version strong: its use of motion controls and its beautiful graphics.There are some similarities to the Wii version. First, the "Six" of the title refers to six core areas you need to work out to achieve full body fitness: Balance, Cardio, Core Body, Flexibility, Lower Body, and Upper Body. Every exercise you do in the program will tell you which of the six you're working on and to what degree. And you can pull up a graphical summary which tells you how much of each you've worked out, and which you need to focus more attention on.You can choose a fitness goal, after which the system will select a number of "classes" for you to take. Unlike the Wii version, you're greeted with a very colorful, very simple and clear user interface where you can select classes. The classes fall under these categories: Cardio (14 workouts), Upper Body (7 workouts), Core Body (8 workouts), Lower Body (8 workouts), Fit for Life (9 workouts), Boot Camp (10 workouts), Kickboxing (8 workouts), Cardio Dance (9 workouts), Pilates (7 workouts), Latin Dance (9 workouts), Dance Moves (10 workouts), and Challenges (6 workouts).Like most fitness games of this ilk, the classes are led by a computer-animated trainer. The level of detail of the trainer and the background graphics of natural environments are very good--not quite photo-realistic, but certainly done with a good attention to detail (for example, when you exercise by the water, you can see soothing clear blue skies with puffy clouds, seagulls flying gently, and even a gently moving ferris wheel in the background). I do like how you can see your own video image next to the trainer so you can match his or her motions.You do need to have a registered Playstation Account in order to play this game--I realized later that this is so Ubisoft could cleverly slip in some DLC into your choice of classes (certain classes require payment of $1.99 to download them). I'm not averse to downloadable content in general, but I was a bit annoyed that Ubisoft seems to be charging for exercises they would have included at no cost if the DLC option did not exist.As other reviews have said, the game does make use of the Move controller for about 50% of the classes, as identified by a blue ball icon over the menu choices. While the Move controller isn't necessary and doesn't track all of your motions 1:1, what it does is show you a colorful "swoosh" where you move your Move controller. By matching up your trail to your trainer's, you can tell if you're doing the exercise correctly. If you are, at certain points you'll get confirmation in the form of a "good!" or "great!" compliment.One thing I really like about this game is that you can play with minimal space. While most Kinect fitness games need at least 10 feet of space, I managed to play with under 6 feet, with room to spare. I also like that you can use your own music from your Playstation 3 instead of the generic music that comes with the game.Overall I wouldn't say this is a "fun" game (it's about as fun as a semi-intense trip to the gym). But in terms of workout value and the sheer number of exercises you can do, as well as the good graphics, it gets a solid 4 stars from me.

Fit in Six is Ubisoft's latest entry into the world of fitness games on the Wii. In many ways, it is the metaphysical heir to the original "My Fitness Coach" which helped pioneer the genre three years ago. Like that game, this one includes a large number of cardio and aerobic exercises. And like that game, this one doesn't use the Wii motion controls at all. You are "on the honor system" as to whether you're doing the exercises right (or at all).The number of workouts you can choose from is almost staggering. You can choose from "classes" that have 10-15 minute workouts focusing on upper body, core body, general fitness, cardio, boot camp, kick boxing, cardio dance, pilates, latin dance, and dance moves. The workouts are all very good, professionally designed exercises that teach you good technique and posture. As others have written, your on-screen trainer is cartoony to say the least, but that's to be expected with the Wii.One thing I wasn't too crazy about was how quickly the on-screen trainers move, without breaking down their moves or otherwise giving you a chance to learn them. This is especially frustrating on some of the quick "dance step" routines. But with enough repetition, you'll eventually get them.The lack of motion controls was a deal buster for me. Granted, many people enjoy workout titles without the motion controls, but to me, if I'm going to work out like that I'd rather just pop in a DVD and watch a real human instead of watching a cartoony character I can't interact with. At the very least I would have liked to see them build-in the option for motion detection, with the ability to shut them off. But it seems that after debacles like Your Shape with Jenny McCarthy, Ubisoft seems to have thrown in the towel completely in terms of trying to get motion detection correct. Worse, the fact that this game supports a USB camera may lead some to believe that it has Kinect-like motion controls; of course, it doesn't--all connecting the camera does is show a postage stamp-sized video image of you in the corner, not even aligned with the on-screen trainer so you can't compare your steps to his or hers.Overall, I'd say if you liked the original My Fitness Coach, you'll probably like this. It's a worthy successor to it in that it provides a much wider selection of exercises and doesn't let poor motion controls (or any motion controls) get in the way of your workout. A few years ago, I might have given this 5 stars, but in 2011, it's just "ok", especially when compared to other similar games on the Xbox and Playstation, or even other games like EA Sports Active on the Wii which do advanced things like good motion detection and heart rate monitoring.

I was a big fan of the movie Kung Fu Panda 2. The storyline was great, the characters were endearing, the animation was stunning, and the action was nonstop fun.Sadly, Kung Fu Panda 2 for Kinect seems to suffer from what plagues many movie tie-in games. The game is supposed to augment the movie experience, but it does the opposite. Even with Jack Black providing the voice for the video game, the Xbox Po seems a poor shadow of his big screen counterpart. I didn't expect the detail of the movie, but this didn't even seem close.The storyline starts out promising-it begins where the movie left off and describes how some of Shen's followers are still in the city and need to be eradicated. But that's pretty much where the story stars and ends. The rest of the game, you're just going from area to area fighting enemies, with really no additional plot.You pass your way through familiar environments in the movie: Gongmen City, the Undercity, the Bamboo Forest, The Desert, and Shantu Palace, but it's really the same routine in each area-fight what seem to be the same enemies over and over again, and maybe play a mini-game or two here and there.Where the game does shine-mostly-is in its use of the Kinect for motion detection. There's just something about actually punching and kicking that beats mashing buttons on a controller. Unlike similar Wii games of the past, this one is smart enough to detect when you punch with your left and right hands, when you kick with your left and right feet, when you block with your left and right arms, and when you duck and dodge. The moves are pretty simple; this is, after all, a kid's game. But yes, as I played through the game I worked up a sweat and an elevated heartrate.Unfortunately, combat is a bit stilted. With each villain you encounter, instead of a realistic fight, you fight a few seconds of "offense" (kicking and punching), and then you fight a few seconds of "defense" (blocking to the left, right, and with both arms).Worse still, later in the game you're introduced to "advanced" moves such as dodging attacks (you dodge left or right when the enemy glows red, and you duck if the enemy turns yellow). At that point the system does a worse and worse job of accurately picking up your motions. As a result, you may find yourself making the right moves but still getting penalized for them, and then being forced to replay entire levels (and watch long cut scenes without the ability to skip them).Once you finish Story Mode (which takes only a few hours), you can play a number of different parts of the story again in "Free Play" mode as mini-games. As I mentioned, there are some cute mini-games, such as racing a rickshaw (which requires you to tilt left and right, duck, and block objects thrown in your way) and making noodles (which require you to flail your arms as if you're stirring noodles, and then throwing the noodle bowl to the customer). These games for the most part follow the same pattern as the combat game--decent use of Kinect, but more satisfying in theory than in reality to play.One of my pet peeves with every Kinect game is that there are absolutely no standards with UI design. This game is no exception. To select something from a menu, you need to select it with your right hand a punch (yes, punch) a gong with your left hand. Cute at first, but it gets really annoying after a while. And there are some glitches which there is just no excuse for, such as the need to turn on your Xbox controller (which is not otherwise used) in the case of a game timeout, and the inability of the interface of detecting that you've selected certain menu choices without trying again and again.Overall, I'd say the use of Kinect in the game is very good. If you have a young child who loved the movie and would get a thrill out of beating up a few wolves as Po, this is a great game for you to get (and to play yourself from time to time to get a little exercise). But otherwise the repetitiveness and tedium of the game is hard to overcome.

The Wii MotionPlus came out almost exactly two years ago as an attachment to the old Wii Remote. While the original Wii remote could detect basic movements, the MotionPlus has built-in gyroscopes which can detect rotational movement and more fine movement.Nowadays for new Wii units, the MotionPlus is built into all new Wii remotes, which are now called "Wii Remote Plus". Just to be clear, there is no functional difference between an old Wii remote with MotionPlus attachment and the new "Wii Remote Plus" other than aesthetics (while the old Wii remote measures 7 1/2 inches with the attachment, the new Wii Remote Plus is six inches, the same size as the old Wii remote). Out of habit, I'll continue to call it MotionPlus throughout this review.In the last two years, it seems that not many game developers have really taken advantage of the MotionPlus; in fact, to date only three (Wii Sports Resort, FlingSmash, and Red Steel 2) actually require it. For most other games where the MotionPlus is optional, you can hardly notice the difference. A shame, because at its best, the MotionPlus can produce fine motor control that rivals the Playstation Move and the Xbox Kinect. I'm guessing that Wii Play Motion is Nintendo's attempt to get more people to adopt it and thus encourage more developers to develop for it (just as the original Wii Play got many people to purchase a second Wii remote).Wii Play Motion in many ways feels like a game that should have come out two years ago. It feels more like a collection of games designed to show off the capabilities of the MotionPlus than actual games that you'll take off the shelf and play over and over. Having said that, they do this very, very well. Nintendo's developers have really pushed the envelope of what its controller is capable of and have come up with a set of 12 mini-games which use it in different ways.As with most Nintendo titles, the games themselves are a ton of fun, and all your Miis are perfectly incorporated throughout the games in lots of fun ways.Here are the games and my take on them:1) Cone ZoneThis is a game reminiscent of the "present balancing" game Shifty Gifts in Wii Party, where you have to balance your Wii remote to keep ice cream on a cone. Fun to play in a group, but we've seen this before. I'd rate it 3 of 5 for fun.2) Veggie GardenThis is a version of whack-a-mole where you beat cute little moles into their holes before they steal your fruit. You control your Wii remote like a hammer, and the precision is very, very good. 4 of 5.3) Skip SkimmerThis is a neat little game where you skip stones across a lake. You first pick a stone you want to skip (as in real life, you look for a round and flat one), and you flick your wrist gently to skip, keeping your wrist angled as flat as possible and the "B" button pressed.
